For $2, we can get two giant fries from McDonald's that will at least be semi-appetizing. Get it together, Bliss, cause you're more like a Bust. Save your thirty bucks for Circle K.

eUjYIINRCARVjakwnzZQMA.text: The fish and chips were the blandest we've ever had.  The wings were pretty good - but then again, how do you mess up wings?  The menu is more geared to lunch/bar food.  Dinner options are limited.  The sound level was high so go with your theater voice.  The space is still terrific (still as in, from when it used to be Fate).  We'll probably try it again but we won't be in a hurry to go back.

y-wP7cMYS9HjfJ_dnZS8UQ.text: Great food and great service and great location! Had the pot roast and it was like eating my grandmothers Sunday best! And, the grilled and marinated baby broccoli was exquisite!

ErK5QmWSGZnf-OlXzZlS6w.text: Looking for something uber-cool downtown?  Just south of Roosevelt, on 4th St is the ultimate neighborhood restaurant - bar combo.  GREAT patio!  The grand opening was just 4 or 5 days ago and its drawing a crowd and turning heads!  Its the perfect place to start out First Fridays!!  Comfort food, food to go, great concoctions at the bar and a good-looking crowd!  check it out!  support our locally owned restaurants and bars!

2d1O8TZv-UNIt_M7jvhYBQ.text: Service was great. Food was below par and not worth the price at all. Really there was a major lack of flavor and originality.

d_BQjqBFK0cjmpQZUmNHQw.text: Oh what a blissful experience at Bliss/ReBar!  After a brief visit to rebar on a pub crawl, during which I spent most of the time drooling over the food on the other side of the fence, I've decided to try it out for dinner.   It was a Friday night about 8:30, we were greeted (actually twice), and sat almost immediately.   Our server was very friendly actually sported a personality which was a nice change.  The menu is pretty small, so I won't complain about the number of vegetarian options.  The ratio of vegetarian to non-veggie options was acceptable.  They offered a grilled veggie sandwich, grilled cheese with pear(which you could order without bacon), mac n cheese, several salads and a few appetizers.    Since it was so late, I didn't want to order anything too heavy. I decided on a pesto "cheese crisp" and  1/2 red rocket salad, yes I said it RED ROCKET!   A pleasant surprise was that I could order any salad in a half order, which was a great alternative to just getting a "side salad".     I'll start with the "Cheese crisp"-  fried tortilla sliced into 6 pieces topped with pesto, tomato and fresh mozzarella. -4 Stars.   The salad was also very tasty; it was a fried piece of goat cheese on top of a bed of arugula, with red bell pepper and red onion.  My only complaint is that there were only a few slivers of pepper and onion, so I ended up with a bowl of perfectly dressed arugula.  I made the best of it and added it on top of my cheese crisp... never let arugula go to waste!  My Bf ordered salt and vinegar fries for the table and they were very good, but I actually think they needed a little more seasoning to bring out the vinegar.   In hind sight, if I was eating the entire order it could be overwhelming.  Other orders at the table included a burger and an order of lettuce wraps, I can't speak to either of those as they both contained meat, but the rest of my party seemed pleased.  It all fairness to Bliss, since I didn't order a "real" meal, what they served me was very good and the service was spot on.  Since I about 25 minutes away, I wouldn't make a trip to Bliss just to eat, but I will definitely recommend it for a group dinner in the future.

umK6mXWOfJwtaNqPPV0EqQ.text: Good place with a nice atmosphere. Food is good, and they offer yelp coupons.

J5wOsHayZcVSuXc5bQWxxg.text: Love this place!!! The atmosphere is very laid back. Super friendly staff!! Pretty much anything on the menu is good, but I would recommend the Grilled Cheese or Mac and Cheese. You won't be disappointed.

YN1cUjgS7Jaw4D9u8Qdjsw.text: Some of the best mac n cheese I've had. The Buffalo Chicken wrap was good too, as were the wings and coconut tenders. Wide alcohol selection and a cool set up with lots of outside seating. The staff was friendly and we were well taken care of. Good for large groups.

YONHWgM5h5V_kfTGzCRosg.text: One of my favorite restaurants in Phx.  The mac-n-cheese is amazing.  The service can sometimes be off.  But the food has always been good, and I love the patio.

86vIFpyxJPdbGbG27Bezpg.text: I like Ticoz...I like Fez...I really Like Switch...but I was not impressed with Bliss/reBar. Server recommended Sausage Ravioli appetizer over the Nachos, saying the nachos were nothing special and you could get them anywhere. We got our ravioli, and they were like frozen-out-of-a-box-Totinos breaded ravioli....totally average/boring. Some friends joined us and ordered the nachos...and they were delicious! Way better than the ravioli!!! The chips seemed home-made, not plain store-bought...and the toppings were fresh and yummy! Oh well, lesson learned. After pigging out on appetizers, I went light and ordered the Rocket Salad for dinner with a side of the fresh vegetable. Even with the delicious breaded goat cheese medallions, I think this salad was way overpriced ($9) for the size. And while the broccolini was delicious, it seemed to be drowned in butter/oil....yummy, yes....a healthy vegetable? No. I don't know, maybe I'm being too harsh on this place...I guess I'd give it another go...but I'm sticking with a 2-star rating for now. (My partner got the baked cod with cauliflower mash - it was pretty tasty, but again the cod was DROWNED in butter, and the cauliflower mash was WAY too buttery/cheesy to be healthy!...Others have said the menu screams "comfort food"...and I tend to agree...so if you want bacon and cheese on mac and cheese, with a side of butter...you'll be happy here!)

uG14L4T77DwiktLMdKsBqA.text: We came here on last night for the first time. The service was absolutely fantastic. Haylee was absolutely adorable, super bubbly, and really friendly. She made sure we had everything we needed and did it with a smile. We started out with the nachos which were some of the best nachos I have ever had. They make their own chips and cheese sauce and both are delectable. Unfortunately, a bug decided to join our nacho party, which is the only reason I am giving this place four stars instead of five. Me and my friend both did the Tuesday night special, which comes with a glass of wine, a sandwich (burgers and wraps included) and a side salad for $10. After all the yummy nachos, we were pretty full and couldn't finish our meals. I got the bacon burger and it was really good. They used the same cheese sauce as the nachos so I was on cheese overhaul. We also ordered the brownie sundae and peach cobbler for dessert. The brownie was super yummy, but I was a little disappointed in the cobbler. I love where it is located. You barely notice it. It's tucked away on the corner and I almost felt like I was in the woods somewhere. I will be back to hang out with Haylee and eat those nachos again, as well as try some of their other daily specials.

PYWuJlLEgsaMcCaZm82MYA.text: Went there for a quick lunch after a work appt. downtown.  Decided to try it for the first time.  The server came over fairly quickly, they offered a fun menu an interesting daily special and a clean soothing interior.  I ordered the chef salad (had turkey and bacon bits as toppings). The size of the salad was on the medium side, slightly larger than a side salad...I felt like it was missing a bread stick or something.  I skipped on the $2 avocado option because the salad price was already $9 and some change...I quickly looked up the place on yelp and asked the server about the Yelp Oct. special and he said he didn't know anything about it.  Aside from my poor selection of that specific salad for lunch this is a cool downtown spot with easy parking, I have seen crowds here on the weekends and at first Fridays so I will be back to try something different...but they could have gone a whole other level with the salad toppings (chopped or carved turkey vs. cold sliced turkey and the bacon didn't seem like it was apple wood smoked or thick cut or anything special....just bacon like you get at any old place like Denny's.  Maybe I'm getting old haha, I just don't expect to spend over $12 on a quick lunch (tax + tip), I love a good lunch time special that gives me a meal (bonus points if it's on the healthy side) with a drink for under $10 tax and tip included...I know you're thinking good luck but aside from Fast Food places there are several out there.

kRq4QkBagfCxPMdgW-8Qtw.text: Food was really bland, tasted reheated. Atmosphere is nice, but the food quality is just poor.

Fg3h_TYhK-TcrBCsBKz-TA.text: My wife and I have been to Bliss several times and haven't had a bad experience- both brunch and dinner. Ive tried several different items on the menu. The grilled cheese with pears, pot roast, pork chops, sea bass (fish of the day), omelet, fried ravioli were all delicious. The pot roast is my favorite. For desert Ive had the cobbler and the brownie sundae. My least favorite was the skewers- while still good I didn't enjoy whatever the default sauce was they used- it was a bit heavy. I would recommend changing to one of the other sauces they offer. The few times Ive gotten mixed drinks they were always mixed well. Highly recommended!

QmRUVm3qOr0GPk03uL8lEw.text: I haven't been to too many places downtown but stumbled upon this place and enjoyed myself. Seemed like a very hip crowd but was still a relaxed place to be at. I liked the dj a lot as well, good mix of top 40 and some hipster anthems. Love the design of the place too, definitely will check it out again!

KE1VaKmS2QiBCEEn-VMQeQ.text: Went to a wedding on 12/15 and it rained so the outside was unavailable. The staff was so accommodating and in such good spirits even though it was a hassle to move everyone and everything inside.Throughout the 4 hours I was there they continued to smile and "put on a happy face". They made the event a fun night! Great job, it could have been a disaster.

aRC04gajFTD6F_bVxh0bOg.text: Hands down one of my favorite places to grab a bite or a cocktail. Awesome bartenders, super friendly wait staff, fantastic location! Way to go guys.

H8RIIEwOf84JNtYvAve5lA.text: Met up with a big group of people here for a friends birthday. My boyfriend and I were the first to arrive so we decided to grab a drink at the inside bar, as the one on the outside looked super busy. There was a door man who carded us before we entered the bar. There were a handful of people inside, the bartender came right over and then asked, "you're 21, right?" and then proceeded to serve me a drink without checking my ID. I have no problem being carded, I have no problem with being carded twice. But don't ask me IF i'm 21, and then not bother to even check my ID. It's just snotty, like you are doing me some favor or something. We paid cash and left right away to wait for our friends outside. After everyone arrived they seated us at a table that was in a separate room from everything else. We were actually sitting next to the window where the servers picked up the food for tables. No one else was in this room but our party. All we could hear was the buzz of the bar and the people having a good time outside the building. Why they didn't want us to enjoy the atmosphere is beyond me. The service was not good either, despite the fact we were so close to the kitchen. At one point we were waiting for our food to arrive and could see it sitting on the ledge, getting cold and waiting to be brought to our table. I was half tempted to go get it myself. It's a lucky thing too that we got our drinks in the beginning as drink service also took a long time. The only reason this place gets 2 stars is because the food was pretty good. I got the Mac & Cheese with chicken and bacon which was really good. It was also a huge portion, so when I was finished and we were waiting half an hour just to receive our checks everyone else tried it, loved it, and finished it. Even though the food was good, I will probably never go back.

WcJQwtvrkYzugxAECcwZhw.text: The food is average.  The outdoor bar for drinks is awesome.  If they had more outdoor seating in the bar area, I would have given them 4 stars.

XbdEa2KSBYnVYJXvR9EhOA.text: the nachos and mac and cheese are amazing!  they also have a good local IPA on tap from four peaks.  this is just a very cool place with great outdoor seating and cool vibe.

fNnbh2BnlW3-ma52U7D8mg.text: When I walked in the sign said see host for seating, but there was no host. I went inside and asked the bartender where I could sit since there was no host. He told me wherever I felt comfortable.  I chose a seat outside and waited for my friends. I was there 20 minutes and 3 servers walked past me, made eye contact but never came over. I received no menu or drinks until after my friend asked if there was a server that could help. She said they stopped serving food in about 30 minutes. A bartender finally came out and took our order. The food, when we did get it was good and so were the drinks. We did not see our server until the end of the meal and were not offered any refills.  The location is great but the service sucked.

Q1ux6H9-ikt1Cc-RNEvCOg.text: The BEST place for Sunday Funday!! I spent all day here one time, loved the bar outside and the brunch mimosa special is too good to pass up! Chicken and waffles are so tasty!   I've also been for Drag Brunch and that was so much fun!!

d33Kpm32eTBlf-u8b2RkYQ.text: I've came to this bar several times and it's a really nice ambience. They have a specialty drink called rehab and it's huge and when i have ordered it in the past i usually share with 2 other people. On Sundays they have great brunch drinking specials for $10 champagne bottles. They have an outside and inside seating area. Staff has been friendly every time i have came in. Overall this is one of my favorite bars in Downtown Phoenix. It is especially fun during first Friday's because of its location it's right in the middle of everything.

NNUjZ6wcbQN4jXCDj0YwGw.text: This is one hopping spot! It isn't your quiet brunch but rather a very dynamic place for millenials to dine and wine.  Music is extremely loud while everybody is having a blast.  We've eaten here twice.  Each time has been enjoyable, food is really excellent, fresh and well prepared. Service is quick, friendly and our plates were ready in minutes.  Veggie taco with grilled pineapple is super good, fries are thinly cut and crispy.

photos.caption: Photo of Bliss Rebar - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Bliss Rebar - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Bliss Rebar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Veggie taco with grilled pineapple is excellent

M14L3kUqGJ6dDRdAsslCaA.text: A neighbor recommended Bliss to me, so we decided to try it. The service was good, the food was great, and I the atmosphere was fun!

photos.caption: Photo of Bliss Rebar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Breakfast nachos

ym0fAi9KAh-wIGIAd8ghig.text: We love coming here. The patio is great and it's always packed on Sunday's. We have a few bartenders that recognize us as soon as we come in, which always makes the experience more enjoyable. Food wise we always stick to ordering the Mac and cheese balls and the hangover fries, can't go wrong with either. Today's experience was by far the worst. We stood at the outside bar waiting to be served and no one came up to us. Someone else walked up next to us and the bartender immediately started helping him. It's not like they couldn't see us. We figured he or the other bartender would get to us next and nothing. Decided to leave after that. We'll be back, but we'll stick to ordering inside where we know we'll actually be served.

HMYtnbGChzNvNW5bO4mZVw.text: Very nice place that I would frequent again. Very good waiters and waitresses. The portions are worth the money

s70ffSjc_voKRgdeb8W1YA.text: This is a nice little retreat in downtown Phoenix. We had nachos with pork on them to die for yummy. Then we had chicken with chili verde veggies and mashed potatoes and that did not disappoint. The drinks were drinks nothing special. The bathrooms are pansexual which is ok but the line is in the hallway near the kitchen and that kinda sucks. I would eat there again. Customer service was really good. Happy staff. Also customer with her boobs out

-uLwX4nY5KNqS5S0HJlOqg.text: This is a place that you would come to have a relaxing time. Really like the outside with misters. The large tree complimented the the scenery. During the day it would have been the perfect shade. We have had Sunday Funday here and enjoyed the ambiance. Although tonight the ambience was lacking but it could have been due to it being a Tuesday night. The drinks were creatively written but didn't taste as advertised. We had to add a separate bottle of Prosecco to make the drinks more palatable. The service was accommodating, wiping down our table and chairs that were dirty with last night's haboob. If you want to enjoy this place to the fullest, I would recommend coming on a weekend when the crowd is alive to enjoy.

photos.caption: Photo of Bliss Rebar - Phoenix, AZ, United States

sQJgIPAF4quKpTy2v7N-0Q.text: Loved this place!! We came late on a Thursday night after having just arrived in Phoenix and what a treat! Bartenders were just friendly enough, as they were plenty busy, and food was quick to our bar stools! We had the lettuce wraps, shrimp, and calamari off their small bites and all were delicious! I think we could have ordered the entire menu it all sounded so good! Great outdoor patio for warmer weather, and cozy interior for catching up with friends or getting a great bite!

kYgY2pXSe_h_kZpLYr5OLA.text: Meaty Mac'n'cheese, best mac in town, and their chipotle-bbq wings are veryvtasty too. Bliss also has A great Sunday funday with amazing drink specials! Great location since it is in downtown. The place is very nice so it's the ambiance.

RekoVMTH1cfFILxoiZHmkA.text: We enjoyed some tasty drinks. A beautiful comfortable patio. And some delicious food.  We had a pretzel bread and cheese appetizer that was delicious. I had a chicken lettuce wraps plate that was really tasty. My husband had the truffle oil and Parmesan fries that Were unbelievably tasty. As well as a sandwich and he enjoyed. Definitely recommend this place when I go back and check out other drinks as well as other menu items. Priced appropriately. Definitely check them out if you've never been.

photos.caption: Photo of Bliss Rebar - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Bliss Rebar - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Bliss Rebar - Phoenix, AZ, United States

3j_oG9i_dLTbMRFyUvatOw.text: I have heard great things about this place through a friend. Honestly, I was not impressed with this  restaurant because of the food. I got the chick-wick sandwich and it was horrible. I got this in a warps instead of a pretzel roll, and the taste and texture was off. I had to pick the chicken out of the wrap. However, I did get the Mac-N-Cheese balls, which weren't bad. Otherwise the service was fine and the atmosphere was inviting.

VsBIRYO_ovXh3Y-smNejQg.text: Bomb. Chicken Wings? Bomb. Vibes? Bomb. Patio? Bomb. Head Metal Sculpture Statute Thing? HELLA BOMB.   These guys just got it together. All-around solid performers. On a Sunday once, from my apartment down the street, I could hear them pumping Whitney Houston's Dollar Bill (Freemason's Remix). Honestly, just YouTube that and that is what eating here (the food, the vibes, the drinks) feels like.   Plus, they had a super duper bomb dulce de leche porter which blew my mind (shout out Eve, shout out Gwen)  Bombs, left, right up, down, got me spinning round and round

LVINZXaF5VcDaM9u-OGdpw.text: Great service and good food! The atmosphere is very relaxed and everyone just goes there to have a good time. Parking can be a pain if you park in front of a meter but there are plenty of free parking options if you are willing to walk about 1/2 a block. They have indoor and outdoor seating. The outdoor options have plenty of shade, misters, and some outdoor A/C units!

lkEL5JuW8Luya-Wi-tqLXw.text: Wasn't here long the other night but dropped in for a quick vodka soda and chicken wings to celebrate a friend's accomplishments. Our waitress was absolutely fabulous and had such an amazing personality. An Ignite event was being hosted so the bar was pretty busy for a weeknight but we were well taken care of. Our chicken wings were meaty and had an awesome sauce. I loved that they were served with jicama and tasty ranch dressing. Great deals for happy hour on foods and drinks. Will be back for sure!

photos.caption: Photo of Bliss Rebar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Wings

IB9qqCMkjcb4bwvA12Hswg.text: The only thing preventing me from giving a five star review is the change over in karaoke hosts. She's not nearly as personable as Phil, and has yet to start a karaoke show on time. Bring him baaack   Beyond that, great food, great staff behind the bar, reasonably priced food and drinks.

3k61AaPNxbQRz8AgDsgbIw.text: My wife and I stopped for lunch and we liked it. We ordered the vegetarian tacos with pineapple and some fries to munch on. They tasted great. We had very good service and the food was delivered to us very quickly. The music was a little loud so if that's not your thing this isn't the place for you. But if you like good food and a fun atmosphere then this is the place.

photos.caption: Photo of Bliss Rebar - Phoenix, AZ, United States

otdZNxZby5-yrMEa9-lHjA.text: Sunday brunch is for mimosas, so mimosas is what I do. At $12 a bottle of champagne I went a little crazy with my friends but it was so worth it. The whole restaurant was packed when we got there but it got even more crowded as the day went on. I think we spent about four hours here and probably could have been there longer. The time passes fast but you don't even notice because the atmosphere is so fun. Also, after your 6th mimosa time doesn't really become important..Everyone is so nice too. I had random people coming up to me to talk and I've never felt so welcomed by customers at a restaurant/bar.   I almost took off a star because the food is so expensive, but I know it's reminiscent of that area of town. I won't be eating there again but I'll definitely be going for some mimosas.

DW6ftdz8GT6ePPBtqmOCKw.text: Not my kinda place or kinda crowd. Sat on the patio group of gay dudes blowing mad cigarette smoke. Ordered some drinks and some apps.   Drinks were terrible.  Waitress disappeared for long periods of time. Apps came out by someone else. French fries were good.   Still no waitress. No napkins or silverware. Mad smoke still blowing all over me and my date.   Waitress finally comes back. Ask for check and bounce.   Would never come back nor recommend to anyone.

ZC8lzmOd65iZq2Uyro1o6g.text: The food is amazing, especially anything on their pretzel buns.  The staff is all very friendly and dangerously close to too good looking.  Most places I frequent I end up finding one dish they make that I just stick to.  I can't do that here, with the exception of the Shrimp BLT I have loved everything I've tried and can't pick a favorite.    Try anything on a pretzel bun, you won't be disappointed.

79M6FntuCRlWsJr_uBs-VQ.text: I love rebar, there are tons of friendly people here-I almost always make new friends when I come. The drinks are always flowing, and the food is always good! My favorite dishes are the black bean burger, the jicama that comes with the wings, and the grits and shrimp. Definitely a good place for vodka mixers-less options when it comes to wine.

photos.caption: Photo of Bliss Rebar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. new sign

nMYcMlONKC4P9Du_U8MlaA.text: Stopped by here on my way from the Food Truck Festival and surprise, surprise it was happy hour.  Good food but the drinks left a little to be desired.  The patio was great for people watching and the weather was amazing per usual.  The seemed to be one waitress working on a Saturday afternoon which I feel was a very big oversight on managements part but we made due.  I would visit again if I am in the area.  Music selection was decent and the venue becomes a local hangout spot if you are there after 10pm. Very colorful crowd but a good time overall.

photos.caption: Photo of Bliss Rebar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Braised beef nachos!!

_-ivuJmRvot7yZgtZhbONQ.text: I made a reservation online for Sunday brunch, and our table of 6 was right in the sun on the Bliss side with zero shade. We asked to move and were fairly warned ahead of time that the ReBar side was a bit less attentive. We didn't care, we just needed shade! So we moved to the other side and despite the warning, it took an unnecessarily long amount of time to get drinks, food, silverware, and the check. The server appeared to be pretty taxed, but made apologies for the wait and running back and forth. Several of the orders came out incorrectly but we didn't want to made anything of it because it appeared as though he really was doing his best.  We were bummed because the dishes were pretty bland tasting and average looking. The Bloody Mary needed work. The sandwiches and salads charge quite a bit for extras like protein or french fries which is weird-- the only place I've seen that charges extra for fries is somewhere like ZinBurger that's known for quality, super tasty entrees. You can charge extra for protein on a salad if the base of the salad is really strong. At Bliss is just felt like an unnecessary up charge.  Overall, the menu needs a little class. Someone with a good palette and eye needs to liven it up and make it more professional. I feel like most everything could have been made in my own kitchen.  It is in a great location, and the patio is beautiful and such a great environment, but I won't go back for more than drinks because it's just not worth the price.

kr4m_KV8MXut-i-izTHHeA.text: We went here during one of the crazy rainy days Phoenix rarely has, and although it was a Friday, there was hardly anyone here! I can't say that this is representative of every Friday night though; I think the rain kept people away.  While I can't comment on the Friday night atmosphere due to that reason, I can say: WOW to the food! As reviewers have noted, the pretzel bread is killer. Get it!!! I got the shrimp BLT (minus the BLT, I know it's sacrilege but I don't eat bacon) - SO good! My boyfriend got the chicken sandwich with the pretzel bread and he loved it. I wish I had the pretzel bread on mine... next time!  The best part to me was happy hour - SUCH good prices. We walked out of the bar spending less than $5 on drinks (granted, one of us was the DD, so only one person was drinking, but still. $5!!!) Speaking of driving, parking's actually not that bad. Parking downtown is free after 5 p.m., and there is plenty of street parking all around Bliss.  I can't wait to go back to Bliss when it's a little more crowded - we had awesome service from the staff, but I'd like to test it when it's busier. I LOVE the happy hour prices and can't wait to try the mac and cheese- people around us ordered it, and it looked HUGE. Yum!

ChlxDjk6N0EQPCO8VlCKyA.text: My first experience with Bliss/Rebar was during a Phoenix Pub Crawl.  After already having visited several other pubs and bar it was refreshing to find a place where the large group could all sit together and hang out instead of being scattered.  It was quick and easy to get drinks and the patio seating was a welcomed environment. Since that time I have returned numerous times to visit both the bar half on a first friday or to hang out with friends and also to chevk out their restsurant half. Living down the street Bliss/Rebar has become one of my favorite local places to visit.   My friends and I love to come here for Sunday morning brunch. There socials on mimosas and bloody Mary's are exceptional. We usually take advantage of the $10 mimosa during brunch.  When there are four of us it is enough for everyone to have two glasses worth.   Their brunch menu is quite amazing, breakfast nachos, pancakes, breakfast sandwhich(on a pretzel bun-a little taste of heaven there), and so much more.  I haven't tried one item on it that I have not enjoyed.  I have also been here for dinner many times.  The Mac and cheese is amazing! Love the spicy chorizo version, although I like to add bacon to it.  The meatloaf sand which is delicious, love that the meatloaf is wrapped in bacon. Their salads are served with giant romaine lettuce leaves so you can turn your salad into a lettuce wrap if you like.  I haven't tried it yet but I'm looking forward to the quinoa and lentil salad. I would recommend trying any sand which on a pretzel bun.  It culinary wonderment how the pretzel bun can compliment any sand which or burger into melt in your mouth magic. The fries are shoe string size and can be flavored in a few ways. My favorite is still the salt and pepper but the garlic Parmesan is a close second.  The draw back to having fries is that it is an extra charge $2, since the offered side is a small salad. While this is healthier for you, if I'm going to eat a burger or sand which I don't want a healthy salad as a side.   The drinks here warrant a mixed review.  While Bliss/Rebar offers a daily, including weekends, happy hour from 3-6:30, the caliber of the drinks is nothing exceptional. I have tried just about all of the specialty cocktails there isn't one that stands out to me as exceptional.  The drinks themselves do feel a bit watered down and lack that punch you expect to have. The group therapy is a fun drink to have with a couple of friends.  It is served in a extra large champaign style glass/bowl and multiple straws. While sharing this drink was fun the nearly $20 price tag is a bit steep when 75% of the glass is ice. :( The daily drink specials are fun but I usually have to point out on my phone what they are to the waitstaff.

Aoskwc1E1Nk_MaU1Ndn9pw.text: It saddens me to say this as Bliss/ReBar has always been a favorite but today was a huge disappointment.  I won't go on and on...I'll just say my food was pretty bad.  I am the benedict with the lack of pretzel bread (my boyfriend quoted me in an earlier review) and yes it was the "worst benedict I've ever had."  The bread which was supposed to be pretzel bread was too very tiny slices of something that looked more like bruschetta bread.  When we asked about this we were told indeed it was pretzel bread, however compared to my friend who had the french toast on pretzel bread, (which looked amazing)  the bread was completely different...don't lie to me sir!    Anyway-beyond the bread-the eggs were cold (gross), tiny, and I don't even think there was any hollandaise sauce on it.  Needless to say, it was so unsavory, I left some of the nasty egg on the plate.   We had just run the AIDSWalk 5k and I was starving..and this breakfast did not fill me up.  I actually left still feeling hungry which is the first time this has ever happened at Bliss/ReBar.    My friend is a lady who likes to post pictures of her food, and I keep going back to the pic she posted of her french toast with serious food regret.  In addition to this, there were phantom items on our menu which we were charged for, luckily they were taken off, and my boyfriend's scramble which came out quite a bit later than everyone else's food was pretty sub par.     I've always had amazing service at Bliss/ReBar, and the food has always been my favorite...I sincerely hope today was a fluke.

khvMzlgAPX5p_lJe9dhWLA.text: Came here late on Saturday to the bar side to have some food and drinks. The place was pretty packed on the outside patio despite the heat, and they had some good music playing.  I had the most amazing burger here, no joke. A nice size burger patty on a pretzel bun  covered with their own cheese sauce that was oozing out of the sides of my burger and topped with 2 huge pieces of bacon..thats it!! WOW!! So much flavor.... I was in aahhh with every bite. I was sharing this with the husband and I didn't want to give up the other half. Fries were just my style, super skinny & crispy, topped with parmesan and garlic...mmmmm!! Also had the coconut chicken tenders with citrus honey ginger sauce, chicken was cooked wonderfully and that dipping sauce made it extra special.  My husband had the bartender make a grape martini for me, it was perfect, and after 2 of them I was done.   All I can say is YUM  !!

photos.caption: Photo of Bliss Rebar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. French martini
Photo of Bliss Rebar - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Bliss Rebar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Peach Martini $5

snvK0eBX_mrRFt2Mpb4WZw.text: We were walking in the area and he whole restaurant had a great vibe to it with mist and great music. The food was excellent we got the chicken nachos. They were to die for , and happy hour is perfect too!

Dk0rMKrC_4KAfdAMZi9eFQ.text: I go for the mac and cheese! Service depends on the staff there. Hit or miss.

bMsL0zTz9Si5AWofW5ol5Q.text: If you want tasty food, perfect indoor or outdoor atmosphere, or a place to socialize this is the place.   Bliss=Restaurant side reBar=Bar side  The chef that created this menu clearly went to culinary school.  My favorite is the Bliss Burger with cheese sauce.  I also love the fries with aioli sauce.  If you want a nice calm atmosphere, going here during the week is perfect.  Understand the side next to it is a bar that is happening on Friday and Saturday nights.  I recommend checking the specials of the day as there is something interesting (off menu) that is cooked that you just don't get other places.   The food is always up to snuff and leaving you feeling satisfied.  The service is good.    The bar next door is a great place to socialize as well.  Know that it is a gay/gay-friendly bar, though MANY straight couples also hang out there... typical downtown feel to it.  Sunday is a great place to go as well for brunch with a good mimosa special.  If you are downtown and want a place with good prices, but amazing food... go here!

zROtI-J-GTjOh4giMVz4OA.text: Fun outdoor bar to hang out at during First Fridays. Food is good for a bar type menu - fries are some of the best in town. But good luck getting served - had to literally beg to get menus, have our order taken and then hunt down the waiter for our check.

Pe5clccyVUxm0ceuRSR1nA.text: I love this place. My fellow yelp elite introduced me to the WONDERFUL mac and cheese the first time I ever came her, instantly I was in love. The bacon and chicken mac and cheese with siracha is my favorite. Its outstanding. Large chunks of chicken and bacon with Parmesan cheese on top. They're brunch menu is also great (I love their breakfast nachos!) and brunch runs till 3pm. A perfect stop after a heavy night of drinking.  I would suggest sitting outside!  Also, the outdoor bar that's wrapped around a tree .... very good place to sit and get a drink.  Cant wait to come back!

9zjq49baHX16iudxG4Z9mA.text: Every time I seem to order from this place online, it takes forever and service is horrible (but when you sit down, they know they will make tips so they seem super nice then). I called them and asked them how long it would take to order...2.5 hours! This is because they go through a 3rd party vendor that may or may not be busy delivering for dozens of other places. So then my colleagues and I, as well as some of my bosses, decide to order for pick up. We make our orders and they tell us 15 minutes.  I wait 30 minutes before leaving our office, which is about 10 minutes away, just to make sure the food is done. When I arrive, I tell the bartender that I am there for a pick up order to which she replies, "When it's done, they'll bring it out." This obviously meant it was not ready yet.  I sat there for about 45 minutes and no one even offered me water, granted it was hot outside and I came in sweating must not have given away my thirst or need for water at all. After about 30 minutes, my boss called me wondering where her food was because she was starving and we were working on the weekend because we had a lot of TIMELY things to do, and could not wait for food for more than an hour. She then called the restaurant, who told her they would give a 20% discount on the entire order of meals. I was not sure what the totals were for all bills except mine, which they did not hand me a receipt for when I paid, but all others had receipts. When I returned to my office, we calculated it and the 20% never came off of any of our bills.  My boss, infuriated, was upset and just decided she would rather not eat there than waste time trying to get some decent customer service. BlissReBAR, you lost 5 customers that day. We won't pay for anything here again. Food is not worth that much, price-wise ESPECIALLY if you have to wait for an hour+ and they do not accommodate you and your complaints or provide you with basic customer service.

zTVDFn9Aq5FsindMrPKC2A.text: Right in the heart of downtown where the art is all around you this little gem is a wonderful find. Everything from the unique cocktails to the copper art is enticing. The service is attentive, food is so damn good and the happy hour specials are more than enough reason for me to make the trek back.

photos.caption: Photo of Bliss Rebar - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Bliss Rebar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. So good!!!
Photo of Bliss Rebar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Shrimp sandy

9Ra_EAaegGGSLIjHPhXikw.text: I'm a big fan. the menu is small but very well executed. The attached bar makes dinner and nightlife extra fun.  This place is definitely hetero-friendly, so open minds are welcomed. First Fridays here are insanely busy and there's lots to look at

p2FJTo2boBSVgQuH5-q9zg.text: I will be coming here again. As a lover of girly girl drinks this place was pure bliss! It does take extra time and a bartender who who how to do more than just pour. They are really making cocktails. Bartenders are super sweet too and have lovely personalities. Go here for a good time.

_QLQpo-ZIAByicg4j53Eng.text: GREAT happy hour - $3 beer, house wine, and well drinks, plus drink of the day. Food is pretty good, too. Wings were nice, but not too spicy. Hummus came as a nice trio, though we had to ask for more bread.  I love the patio area, especially when the weather is cooler. I would like to come back and try the rest of the menu. Overall, very nice.

Fe3JUq_1bfCPuKCpB-_JyQ.text: The patio here would be awesome if someone cleaned it.  My friend and I walked around looking for a place to sit but every spot was covered in dirt and an occasional bird shit.  Obviously everyone else felt the same way because even though it was a gorgeous day, the inside was packed with people while the patio was desolate.  Beer and cocktail selection was plentiful.  The service was meh.

coqxJIFjSwtCtpJmoGkWGw.text: BEWARE THE $10 BOTTLE OF BUBBLY "MAKE YOUR OWN MIMOSA"   I've been here a few times now and each time has been different.  One time a friend ordered the black bean burger, didn't like the way it tasted, alerted the server and his exact words were, "What do you want ME to do about it?"  This last time was the icing on the cake.  BEWARE THE "Make Your Own Mimosa!"  On the menu it says, "Bottle of bubbly $10 (make your own mimosa)".  We ordered two.  Upon receiving the bill I was quite surprised to see I had been charged $3 per small carafe of orange juice.  I went to the hostess' table, reviewing a menu to make sure I didn't miss the pricing.  When I could not find the small carafe of OJ on the menu, I asked the hostess.  She took a look at both sides of the menu and her exact words were, "It's not on the menu, but yeah, juice is $3 separate from the bottle."  That is extremely sneaky.  I will NOT be returning here.

RLzwZmT4mqussRT9yyABPA.text: We came here last weekend for Happy Hour with some friends we were visiting, and I knew I could count on my supper club girl to recommend something delicious! Pros: Happy hour drinks are plentiful to choose from and pretty good. 3 martinis for $9? Awesome! The appetizer menu was extensive and had a full array of things on it. We tried: the Asian ribs (special of the day and tasted like the average well made Korean beef rib- but the slaw was amazing), macaroni and cheese (yum! as good as my own), pretzel bread with dipping sauces (the tomato sauce was kinda weird, but the cheese was good), and chocolate chip cookies (good but a wee overdone- plus the bartender was nice enough to bring my friend milk that was not on the menu) Atmosphere was great! Cons: The server wasn't the most knowledgeable, I had to question the happy hour selection he gave us because the signs in the bathrooms said something different. He was nice about it, but still. Parking is annoying. No lot to park in and only street parking, which in this area, seems to be few and far between.

z3fWsT7BxzN16dDSIPdVyg.text: This is THE hangout spot for me and my friends downtown!  Cool, relaxed atmosphere, perfect location, awesome drinks, DELICIOUS food, and from the servers to the owners, the best customer service ever.    First Fridays are SUPER busy, but otherwise it's a very calm place.  Not a dance club, this is where you go to just chill and just hang with your friends.  Drink specials every day, the BEST brunch that you will find downtown, and did I mention the mac n cheese?!  Dear god the mac n cheese!  It will make you swoon, it will make you live, it will make you slap yo momma!  Give Bliss/ReBAR a try, you will NOT regret it!

oOmsFu5pCMPrlbO2iCJ_Sw.text: Great food very creative and they serve Blue Label Scotch!!!

PrC07n9ZrymEQhc_aLBmAA.text: Very relaxed environment. The food was okay. Was there for a business dinner and the group was not overly impressed with service. My plate was very good but others were not impressed. If I was out and about I would give it another shot.

P2AxVv_yIwrxqAqnqMiI9w.text: This spot is pretty good, but I was not blown away. My eggplant sandwich was OK. My hubby had the shrimp BLT sandwich and said it was pretty good. The friends I went  with had the burger and it was one of the best he's ever had in his life. Atmosphere was so-so....although it has a great patio area, the view is a construction site across the street, so made it not so great.

jAGv_bNVSJWuK-DwKvtCsg.text: Just recently moved to the area and took some family here for dinner and drinks. It was pretty quiet inside so we got a seat right away.  Good service, I think our waiter was either a little shy or tired but still kept on us. I had the broccoli cheese soup which was amazing!! Yum.  We all enjoyed our food and the experience. I will be back to try out some more of that menu!

qtP08au5ZHSOaF_1T_4c9A.text: Love this place.  Buffalo chicken breast on a pretzel bun was amazing. Love the atmosphere too!

QBBKiyot1chreIfj41KIfQ.text: Very impressed w the food and service at Bliss. My wife and I enjoy the Sunday brunch here. Cannot go wrong at Bliss

AZJvWo8YQ4erp1Av78DNUw.text: Was here for a work meeting and would like to go back. reBAR atmosphere was very cool, rebar twisted decor and brickk wall made for neato vibe.

WkDbX-NuFg4RQfQCRyPkxg.text: Not bad, but would love to see the service kick it up a bit.  I arrived after two of my friends had already started eating (and was followed by a handful of other friends).  The waitress/bartender neglected to bring over a menu, so I ended up not ordering anything to eat, despite being fairly hungry.  Luckily, the mac&cheese ordered by one of my table-mates was tasty and quite a large portion, so I got a few bites in.  After quite awhile, we were finally checked on, and I ordered a drink.  When the waitress got to the other end of our table, she told them about the drink special of the night - at $3, it was quite a steal!  Maybe they should tell the specials to the whole table though, before orders are placed?  Just a thought!  I love the atmosphere, but it was hampered by the smokers.  Not sure how they are able to get away with smoking right next to the entrance, but it was definitely allowed.  Gross!  Next time, I'd opt for food indoors with the drink special.  That might bump my rating up a bit!

kNQiY9R9fchdN40TRT6PcA.text: Great downtown spot, day or night. I enjoyed it as a bar several times before I ever had a chance to sample the menu. Three words...Mac N Cheese. Delicious! probably the best mac n cheese I've ever had. True, the food does seem to take a bit longer than average but in my experience it's been worth the wait. Keep up the good work!

Yt5zXKZAJ0gcsFvEcX2KsA.text: Went here to celebrate my birthday with some of my hot babe friends, which happened to be cinco de mayo.  Rachel was our bartender/server.  She is very friendly and helpful.  We asked for her recommendations as to what was popular and good.  There was seven of us so we had an opportunity to try quite a few items on the menu.   We ordered the fried sausage ravioli, the coconut chicken tenders, the chicken lettuce wraps, tempura vegetable medley, and the chef's sliders, all from the appetizer menu.  We also tried the mac 'n cheese with bacon and the pork chop dinner.  She makes a great French martini.  I must admit I didn't like the margarita.  I guess it's cause I don't like it with ice, and I like more salt on the rim, but probably my fault since I didn't tell her I didn't want it on ice.  Everything was fabulous, but if you're going to order anything, absolutely a must is the mac 'n cheese with the bacon.  The bacon really adds to it.  And the pork dinner had the right amount of "gravy."  I don't know if I could even call it gravy, but we were practically licking the plates of the mac 'n cheese and the pork.  I really liked the ravioli and the sliders.  Since I'm not all that big on fried food, all I can say is that they were good for fried food, but it wouldn't be something I, personally, would order.  But that's me.  Just like I wouldn't order lamb, but we won't go there.  I'd absolutely return.  reBAR is across the patio, and is the bar.  We dropped in there to see what it looked like.

EQgKkaJdLA_BHFGCdfirnw.text: Wonderful bar with a great atmosphere. The food and service was quite exceptional! I had the shrimp served with sweet potatoes, the yummiest. My friends both has the beef rib specials, again wonderful. For sure I will be back!

Z-lvP9FILDyObPi2ahllgQ.text: We had such high hopes! First, there's a lot going for Bliss/Rebar. The atmosphere is cool, the menu is interesting, and our waiter Drew was great. So why the low rating? Well, the food didn't meet up to expectations. We had the pretzel bread (boring), their homemade chips and dip (the chips were totally burnt and no one at our table touched them) but the nachos were delicious. I had their eggplant sandwich and one other girl at our table tried mine as well. We both got food poisoning. I was actively sick for about 36 hours. I called the restaurant just to let them know so they could check their ingredients, and the girl on the phone was very nice but told me she'd have to have the manager or chef call me back. She took my number... and I never heard a thing. I sure hope they didn't serve any more of those to anyone else!

ACwbismtdX3bPJ6-rBZ9gA.text: Stopped by for lunch with a friend and baby in tow. The patio seemed like a great place to chill with friends but it was too hot for the baby so we sat inside. We decided on the chicken wraps (friend did) and I devoured the grilled eggplant sandwich. Eggplant and goat cheese, a winning combination. We were satisfied with our meals and only wished we could have stayed longer.

u6VbEQH0sqZf7T9xvEH8Xg.text: fantastic little place with excellent food and drinks, and a great atmosphere. people complain of a lack of parking, but we didn't have a problem at all parking on the street.

photos.caption: Photo of Bliss Rebar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. awesome artwork and ambiance
Photo of Bliss Rebar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. hot servers and bartenders!

MOQ9kAAgUz2LcCxxLeTQGA.text: Super small inside. We went with a group of 8 and took up at least one-third of the dining area. Loved the look of the outdoor patio, but too warm for us to hang out there. Food was delish! And the service was wonderful. We'd definitely eat here again should we find ourselves in that area. =)

y_wBR7EKpHrKae9pWjCeUw.text: The deep fried mac and cheese is pretty amazing. Service is ok and the place is a lil loud. Fun place to goto dinner with friends

koGhc8Va3y_uIeHKxsYn5g.text: Holy Mac and Cheese! I went with a long lost best friend after reading many reviews. As I walked up to the restaurant the music and patio looked so fun and out of place but it really is a little slice of heaven in downtown!   We went for dinner before an event and I can't wait to go back when we've got 2 things...a d.d. and time. On a recommendation of the server we went for meaty mac and cheese and shrimp pesto penne. The meaty mac and cheese was so smooth and creamy and the ratio of meat to pasta was perfectly matched. The pesto was also tasty; they seemed to complement each other in a strange way. The iced tea was very good and the server was attentive, our glasses weren't empty for long.  We can't wait to go back and sample more the the menu.

bzjOaBXF6BsgmjzGqMm0nw.text: This place has absolutely spectacular food, and good prices for the quality for sure.  I love the BLT with tempura shrimp, and the loaded burger on pretzel bun is delicious.  I have made this my favorite lunch spot.  The micro-fries are good, but very small...fair warning.

hO0q4oKIHWeuNMuYd4qkEg.text: Review for Bliss:  Simple, non-complicated menu that is executed very well.  The portions are good sized and the prices are VERY reasonable.  Overall a GREAT restaurant.  Had the Mac and Cheese with chicken and Bacon and it was awesome.  Review for reBAR:  Layout is excellent and the drinks were poured good...I like the fact that it is open and people can just walk up to the place.  The crowd is mixed and it seems that the "pretty people" have left other bars to hang out here.  This could end up being the ultimate happy hour place for those young executives downtown....and good looking ones at that....  The place clears out after 10pm, but still enough people around to have a good time.  High times seem to be from 6 to 9pm.  Good pre-bar.....hmmm...maybe they should of called it preBAR.

CtpOnL5r0DBvcKt0HQXZHg.text: Tried ReBar on a Sunday for dinner loved the look of the place. Easily sat down to eat, as the sign says Left to Eat and Right to Drink. I had the Mac and Cheese it was good but not great maybe I would have enjoyed it more if it was baked or maybe I should have ordered something with a pretzel bun. After dinner we went on to the Drink side of the establishment and grabbed a seat on the outside patio, super functional that the bar is just a hop, skip and jump away. While we sat outside people kept arriving for the Sunday Karaoke night.  Karaoke singers looked like they were having a blast inside but as we were sitting outside we could not hear. Outside was relaxing and great for conversation on this quiet Sunday my only suggestion for outside would be to offer a bit more seating.

S6_ewvV4y1ZkxOOAytwzOw.text: This place is fantastic. We went for breakfast after a night out and it was a perfect way to end the excursion. The food was awesome (I got the breakfast sandwich but everything looked so good it was hard to decide). The staff were all very friendly and they made sure our drinks stayed full. The also feature local artists (like paintings and stuff)--added a cool touch. Check it out.

cERKE6K59WPqobimORNa1w.text: Went here for the first time for dinner tonight with my family and my best friend's family who were visiting from Pittsburgh. Was looking for a place to hopefully impress them. Turned out to be a great choice! Loved the menu selection, every single item was just slightly different. The menu was small, but not too small. Enough choices without it being terribly difficult to choose. Started off with a ton of appetizers. The pretzel bread, sweet potato chips, shoestring vinegar fries and 2 different types of wings. Every single appetizers was delicious. I think my favorite was the sweet potato chips. Nice and crispy. Each item was paired perfectly with a special dip. By the time our food came around we were already getting full! I had the shrimp soft tacos - amazing! The shrimp was crispy and perfect. I only could get one down, but it will serve as my lunch tomorrow. Tried the loaded mac and cheese too - rich and savory. I could eat that shit right now! Service was quick and friendly, no problems at all.  Would love to go back and try some of the other dishes on the menu. They serve brunch as well which also looked fabulous of course. Great spot and awesome location to sit outside on a sunny day.

a-g0y2TH2ERhodUROvARhQ.text: Downtown and need a drink? Stop in and see the best bartender, Michelle! She is great to chat with and she makes a mean drink! The food is good and the service is great!

7rpGGlRH32cgEABaT5Ifsw.text: I tried Bliss last night for the first time.  Very cool vibe and love that it doesn't look like every other bar/restaurant in town.  GREAT area outside once the temps calm down.  Can't say enough nice things about the hostess/server last night,  She was friendly, attentive and gave you just enough space to enjoy your dining partner while engaging you at the same time.  Grilled pretzel bread and cheese sauce was good; bread was hardly grilled on one side and a little charred on the other.  I had the buffalo chicken wrap.  It was not good.  The chicken was loaded with grissle; you knew what you were chewing wasn't chicken meat!  A little tastless as well.  I opted for a side of fries and they were so pale when the plate was delivered, I wasn't even sure if they had been fried.  WAY under done.  My dining partner had the mac-n-chees with bacon and chicken.  She said it was good.  The same cheese sauce is used for this as the dipping sauce for the pretzel bread.  For me, it's not a good thing that a place makes one cheese sauce for all things that have cheese.  I give it 2 stars for the food; 3 stars as a cool place to stop and have a drink and then move on for the main course.

G5qlf4dgcnHRlP4wq4X_eg.text: Went there for brunch after researching pet friendly eateries. I'm so glad I came here. My party and I were all treated wonderfully and the food was delicious too including the $10 mimosa pitcher. Great food and service, I will be returning for sure!.

P9GBmtXzEUbEP301CNPk8A.text: I was so excited for this place to reopen as I love the location and the big outdoor bar, but just like it's predecessors 905 and Fate, it's coming up way short. All it needs is to work out some minor kinks though, and I hope it does, because then I would happily revisit.   Though all the staff were really nice, we were seated for about 15 minutes before a server came over. Then it took another 10-15 minutes to get our drink orders. They ran out of a main ingredient on the menu so I couldn't order what I wanted to, and frankly, the menu failed to impress. There was nothing altogether unique on the menu that made me excited to try it, nor would I say, "Oh, I want to come back and try that next time." I settled for the grilled cheese, which was pretty bland. Nothing memorable about it. It had pears on it, which it didn't need. I get that it was trying to be a little different like that, but they didn't add to it at all. And the only thing it came with was one sad-looking pickle. My sandwich also arrived about 10 minutes before the server brought out my date's entree, which was just weird.   On a positive note, my dirty martini was perfect and I had a fun time just sitting at the bar afterward. I would definitely go back to the bar for a drink, but have no desire to retry the restaurant.

dTSmJiSRptMQBVqLwcBsmw.text: good brunch menu and great atmosphere. they are always packed and busy at nights on the weekends so be prepared lol. their patio is cool and their drink selection is good!

cH0Uu2BPzIdcvFHt-lQjBA.text: My wife and I went out here a few weeks back, ordered of the moonlight menu, we both got burgers, the portions were great, the food was very good, and came to the table quickly after we placed our order. It took a little bit after we sat down before we got served, but within reason. I like that it seems hidden with it's big walls of bamboo outside. it's a great, trendy dinner place that if you're willing to spend a little bit of money, you'll have a great dining experience.

c7A1zXzl7c4XUXQiyabmdA.text: I don't know where to start on the food experience here.  Fried macaroni & cheese balls, shrimp and grits.  It was BLISS!  And what a kitchy place.  The artwork and Rebar hangings were extraordinary.  Our server, Michelle (two L's like me) was so patient and helpful.  She was one busy lady but kept checking back with our table.  I agree with Rebecca R...please go there and help keep this place open 4ever!  I can't wait to go back again.

FcLBXTi977F6VpOSdrtH1A.text: Mmmm! The mac and cheese was very very tasty! Made with monterey jack cheese, it had a bit of a tangy bite! The coconut breaded chicken strips were awesome and so was the sweet/tangy dipping sauce. The bar is well stocked and the bartenders were friendly. Oh yeah... they have OAK CREEK HEFEWEIZEN on tap here! One of the best beers ever. The patio looks very inviting and lively in the evening. It's kind of hard to get to this place due to some local construction and street re-routing, but it's not too bad (they have some signage up for way-finding). I'd love to go back to this place during dinner rather than happy hour and have another nice night out.

_TUAp-QlFmOFZ092jSnNjw.text: Interesting crowd, good decor and Law and Order on the overhead TV on a Friday night?

jdf8m6mpul7TeRm4YqKHJA.text: Well, I guess it just took time to break this place in.  Came back in town after being gone for a year and reBAR has transformed itself into a popping Friday night spot.  The crowd makes such a difference because the space itself is so great.  Fairly nice bartenders too, one of which recommended a tequila shot with a pineapple chaser which changed my whole perspective on tequila shooters.  Good show!

ryUPGPGwuq2wiOc3w0NwFQ.text: I love going here, it's fun spot! The Ciroc Redberry Rapture is amazing (low-cal too!) and so is the grilled pretzel bread! I highly recommend checking it out!

UUytEakWasq0xMebY9WRUQ.text: When I heard Bliss was opening I had to go check it out as a fan of Fez, Switch and Ticoz. I love what they have done with the place. It is so much nicer than it's previous couple of attempts. I also like the parking. The staff is very friendly and the place has a mixed but heavily Gay clientele.  We decided to order cocktails. The choices were more limited than Fez and they couldn't make a Mojito so I ordered a peach martini. It was not that great and I was driving so I only had one. They were out of menus so we borrowed one from another table. hopefully they will order more. We decided to share a naked Mac and Cheese and a Cheese crisp (the waiter recommended the Tomato and pesto and a coconut Chicken tender for a starter.  The Chicken tenders were amazing. The food came out before we had even started on the Chicken but we were ready for the Mac and Cheese. It had Bacon and was spicy maybe jalapeno. The Mac and Cheese was a winner. Truly one of the better in town.   The cheese crisps were another story. It was a tortilla lightly spread with pesto, with a few slices of store bought quality tomatoes and mozzarella cheese slices on it. It was not very good and certainly not an entree by any stretch much less a $9 one. I think it should be an appetizer if anything any at most $5. Seriously I was completely disappointed with this dish. If that was what I had ordered as an Entree, I would probably not have gone back if I didn't know they could do better.  Obviously they are new and working things out. They need to work on the drink selection and add maybe three additional entrees around the $10 price range or under. The waiter said the tempura was not very good and his description didn't sound what I wanted either.  The brunch sounds good too but again it is a very limited menu.  All that said, it is going to be a great place after they work out a few things and the service is fantastic.

tonGwjjkwZh7PS5xOhsSyQ.text: We love Rebar! The food is fabulous and consistent, the drinks poured well and the staff beyond friendly! It's our neighborhood joint where everyone feels at home. Salmon, grilled cheese, burgers, meatloaf, bacon-wrapped pork, wings....all yummy!!!!!

qteW1gl3rSc5JrvHjJpMjA.text: I really enjoyed rebar! Even though I was the dd I had a great time. They have a awesome late night menu to help soak up all the alcohol. I couldn't believe they were only charging 3 dollars for shots( I should have been drinking for that price)! The decor was awesome feel to it! I will for sure go back so I can drink!

yxhJJUMfwUlKsICcxlJu0A.text: We dropped in last night for a snack before the Sigur Ros concert (Amazing!) and came away totally unimpressed. The waiter was extremely nice and very attentive but the food was very blah! I had the Pesto Pasta with shrimp and it was OK but not enough flavour  at all. Annie and Di shared the Lettuce wraps which were very "wet", and then they shared the Veggie sandwich which was also nothing to write home about. On top of it all Di was sick in the night but that is likely due to her having a Margarita. Won't be back there.

lKHjUAZxCwjl4x5aiDZwbQ.text: Bliss is a great bar for group outings! The staff members are all so friendly and are always down to give you a great recommendation for food or drink. On slow nights, the bartenders are even nice enough to humor us by letting us Google outrageous shots for them to concoct and for us to try. (Don't worry, we make sure to tip big to show our appreciation!) Bliss also includes a lovely outdoor patio and a killer brunch. Give it a try if you're ever on Roosevelt Row!

lL_maG6CPuLwu6P3uJyJCg.text: Very impressed with this location.  From the two outdoor patio areas to the two indoor seating areas, this place offers a place where you can socialize and/or hang out one on one with someone. Food is delicious and the drinks are pretty darn good. I recommend the loaded mac and cheese (comes with bacon and chicken) and the speciality drink I loved was the sparkling Bliss and my gf enjoyed both the Moscow mules.

_swLwbFAkoPnf_Gz1IkndA.text: Stopped by here after seeing one of the afternoon movies at the Phoenix Art Museum when I saw that Angel Trumpet House was way packed and glad I did. My father and I had the Bliss Nachos, which are made with flash fried flour instead of corn tortillas, and they not only put pickled jalapenos on them but sliced purple cabbage. It may seem odd but works and then they use a white cheese sauce and the crumbly white Mexican cheese. I think they were like $7.50 and for $2 more I got pulled white meat chickenon them, quite good. I tend to like corn tortillas but this was sort of a white chip with white cheese sauce and white cheese, and then white chicken.....sort of an artistic statement i guess, like interior decorating from the 80s, but it came together nicely.  I also ordered an Old Fashion. The bartender told me he used Maker's Mark and asked me if that was okay. I said sure and assumed I would be paying a premium but from 2 pm to 5 pm on Sundays it seems it is happy hour and it was $4, which is an amazing price! My only gripe would be that the bartender shook it with ice and generally it is the sort of drink that is best made without ice and then poured into a glass with one large ice cube, like they do over at the bar at the Blue Hound. I don't know how much that sort of ice machine costs but it makes a difference, so something for this establishment to consider.   Bottom line though, I will be coming back and the servers were friendly as well. I expect they will be quite busy later this year with the opening of the Roosevelt Point student apartments opening up literally, right across the street. :-)

photos.caption: Photo of Bliss Rebar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bliss Nachos

T3uCtBTc_Ydx97mjp3mgQg.text: Food was eh. Mac n cheese didn't have much flavor. Nacho cheese sauce tastes processed. Server was very nice, and patio was cool. But food wise.....it was a no for me

SsK9oPgK-P0Iy4itOx-4iw.text: I stop by here fairly frequently for a tasty bite or delicious cocktail. Every time I am greeted with a fantastic experience. Service is always stellar, I've never had anything that wasn't delicious, and it's a great atmosphere for a business lunch, happy hour with friends, a date, or a late night hang out.   My favorites on the menu are any sandwich in the pretzel roll, the pretzel bread app, coconut chicken strips, Mac and cheese, any of the salads, and more anything pretzel.  There is usually a great special whether it's food or a drink of the day, and portions are generous so even though it's a hip place, it's reasonably priced.   I love relaxing on the patio. Even when the weather is warm, it's usually comfortable out there with the shade and misters.

QVqrqs-yORSflEfHf4Y7KQ.text: We went to Bliss a couple weeks ago and I totally forgot to write a review so here it goes, It was our first time here and we had a great experience!  Our server was very friendly, and the bartenders were also very nice people. I got the orange cream drink, don't remember exactly what it's called but it was so creamy and tasty. My friend got a Pom comso also delicious!  We started off with the pretzel bread which was A1, and for my meal I got the coconut chicken strips and fries and my friend got the buffalo chicken sandwich which also had coleslaw and bleu cheese. The food was all really really good ! It was fresh, hot, and came out right away!  Afterwards I got a dirty gin martini with extra olives which once again, GOOD! We met some really nice people Here too! The whole experience was really great, and I've heard it's really fun here at Night too on the weekends when they have A DJ. I'll definitely be back! :)

d61eQoK-5PODgwQye5GDqA.text: Good food, good drinks, decent prices.  ALWAYS packed on Fri and Sat nights.

UcJqjXCHSOEdcxoKTf43nA.text: Came in for happy hour on a Friday after a less than pleasant workweek. Had the group therapy with the girls (we a loved it) and some appetizers;  coconut chicken tenders were perfectly cooked; and the hot wings. The wingers were a great size, spicy and real saucy paired with the chipotle dressing, perfect match. Erica was so great we stayed for dinner, had a few more friends join us and just had a great time. Erica did show us both sides the bliss (dinner where we were) & rebar (the very upbeat,fun bar). We'll defiantly be coming back for more happy hour/dinners.

photos.caption: Photo of Bliss Rebar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken wings:meaty, spicy and sauce everything a wing needs to have. Paired with chipotle dressing = March in h
Photo of Bliss Rebar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Group Therapy

zGtNYHvXXNDxuCShqquP1g.text: When the weather is nice, this is a great place for day drinking and people watching.  Nice patio in downtown.  Service is hit and miss.  Food is usually good.  It does get packed on most First Fridays.

CVYEkDwJIE07CDVRpVz98A.text: Monique the bartender makes this bar an enjoyable experience. We initially ordered off the menu which was very good. We asked Mo to create some drinks for us and we were absolutely amazed. She is an asset to the bar. We initially planned to have a drink or two and ended up staying several hours. We look forward to seeing her on our next visit as we stay nearby.

photos.caption: Photo of Bliss Rebar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mo made us happy!!!

jtm-jpCU_4P-ecnqIwBW9A.text: Does not deliver. 3rd party does,sometimes but stop at ten. Bar is sketchy. I avoid but not the worst.   Food supposed to be good, only had one meal there and it lacked flavor. Would be better if they toned down the creep.

tBMsGmgiPwzOp7Y4_u8pkQ.text: We came here for brunch before leaving town.  One of my friends picked the place and I had no say.  I was pretty skeptical when I saw the place, not in the best looking neighborhood and there were very few people there at 10:30 am on Sunday.  We ordered coffees and a bottle of $10 champagne.  The waitress we had was very friendly and sweet.  I ordered the breakfast burrito with the chirizo and chicken.  I don't normally eat chirizo so I was a little nervous.  When we all got our food everything looked so good.  I was very happy with my breakfast burrito and other's people food I tried were all good.  I would definitely recommen this place for brunch.

tvxi_66el4zdsOopcB1lBQ.text: A little escape from the hustle and bussle of first Friday. The "yeah man" I really liked the fact they had a few bars and short lines during the crowded first Friday me and a friend got our drinks run and coke for me Malibu pineapple for her 12$ for both 2$ til cause I saw he hooked it up with liquor "my man!!" After a few a was feeling nice. We did see the menu but not hungry enough to eat will have to try another time. The bad Some of the music was beyond corny lol I was shocked that a place that was so busy was playing old boring music no one seemed to care but that was my sign to make the move to another bar :-). Overall I will be back when I'm there for first Fridays and or any event downtown I def wanna try the food and I hope they will play some better music next time, "DJ hit me!!" :-)

wRtFwx9nuu5v5hFJqBfTfQ.text: Mac & cheese (meaty) 5 stars. One of the best if not the best Mac and cheese I've tried. The salsa is unique and good.the hummus is really good as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Bliss Rebar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mac and cheese (meaty version)

1mWzQ4rTU-uw3fExaNu1Yg.text: We had a wonderful birthday brunch for 15 today at Bliss.  Everything was great, food, drinks and service.  The owners of Bliss need to know how awesome their manager Margo is.  When we arrived there was a bit of a glitch with our reservation. Margo handled the situation with class.  Our party was seamless.  THANK YOU MARGO!  And Happy Birthday!

C3i2z8ck4yWHoRnr-diwUQ.text: I wish I left in Bliss, as I had high hopes about this place regarding their food.   Me and my Gps had an issue finding this place, but once there, the atmosphere was already pre-clubish on a Friday night. People looked like they were having a good time on the patio and bar area. I asked to be seated in the cafe area, which was a bit quieter. Server was nice, I think he was the assistant manager. Service was friendly honest about his recommendations and prompted.  The food started well, with the prezel bread did not disappoint. Yes, the cheese sauce made the dish. I did'nt care for the tomato jam, a little sweet for the bread if you ask me, but not the worst. The waiter told me that with the dip trio, people hate or love the tomato jam. I am glad he was honest, but I would recommend offering guests the choice of the three or having two or three of the same dip. I would have order three of the cheese myself. Next, I tried this loaded mac and cheese, which I was ok, but not the best thing I've tasted. I felt you could only taste one cheese in the dish, the bacon and chicken combo was a little bland to me. I think I had a cobber, but since I dont remember, I will not review it. But  I do remember the pretzel bread was on point and I should have ordered more.  Costs were good and I enjoyed the atmosphere, but the food was overall just okay.

lj2fRUPi8MI3uvcbEZH7Pw.text: Their macaroni and cheese balls are literally one of the best things I've ever eaten in my entire life. I've had macaroni and cheese balls from a ton of other places and none will ever compare to Bliss's. They also have an amazing deal on mimosas for Sunday brunch and fantastic nachos! The only reason I'm not giving it 5 stars is because sometimes the music is pretty bad, but that depends on when you go. Sometimes it's good but other times the music just makes me want to kick a little kid or something.

fHWJdVBOcD8J7XbkNsjv0w.text: The Bliss ReBar is my favorite casual place to dine in Phoenix when going to the Nash for jazz or the Symphony.  The atmosphere is laid back, but the service and food excellent.  I always ask for Britanni for service as she has never let me down; Britanni has a great personality is prompt and attentive and always remembers me when I return.  She deserves a raise.  The menu is varied but I tend to lean towards the Cobb with the addition of avocado and grilled chicken with the pretzel bread with cheese dip.  Check this place out; consistently good for food, casual atmosphere and great service.  Keep up the good work.

r3YjYfLT6ZPxbqB00XfFKA.text: Looking for a place in downtown Phoenix that delivered a decent (non-pizza or Asian cuisine) meal.... success! I ordered the spicy mac & cheese (with chorizo and siracha) and it was quite possibly the best mac and cheese I've had in my life. The level of heat was just right and it was super creamy and delicious! It arrived probably 20 minutes earlier than quoted and was still very warm!   There is a $15 food minimum for delivery, so I added on a dessert, the brownie with vanilla bean ice cream. The brownie was still warm when it arrived and they had the ice cream/sauce in a Styrofoam cup to keep it cold. It was perfect!  Although I had a hard time choosing what to order for dinner, I'm not worried now because I'll definitely be ordering from here again. Awesome restaurant-quality food delivered warm to your door!

uV_2bfVKLFfeE_eXj08PWg.text: Service here is horrible.  Tonight we found a plastic finger nail in one of our dishes. Not even joking. A fake fingernail!  The server didn't offer to comp any of our meals and laughed about it with his co workers. Shortly after that I picked out of my mouth a huge piece of plastic wrap that was in my nachos. After waiting twenty more mins to let the server know (while waiting for a round of beers that never came) we had finally had enough. We mentioned something about the finger nail which he replied " we already established it wasn't any of ours, I don't know what you want me to do "  I will never return to bliss

-0UOhC0ssuLFXR2uH1S41g.text: We've only been here for Sunday brunch, but 5 stars every time. $4 Mimosas, the BEST cheese board, incredible burgers, pretzel bread french toast..all equally great every time.  Love the decor and atmosphere. Our servers were really nice too.

--Cvm0GR-6vYB4zuzvanOg.text: I've heard so many good things about Bliss Rebar, and was so excited to come! I came for dinner with a friend, and got the chicken tenders with a side house salad. The side salad was fresh with a nice vinaigrette, but there was nothing special about the chicken tenders. I'm sure the portion was better than a fast food place, but the flavor/texture sure wasn't. I was pretty disappointed.    The ambience was nice, and the servers were really nice. Because of all the good things I've heard, I would definitely give this place another chance--but probably only for happy hour or brunch. We saw a few staff members pushing a bunch of bottles of alcohol outside while we were eating, and that looked pretty fun.

photos.caption: Photo of Bliss Rebar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Side house salad
Photo of Bliss Rebar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken tenders

DwbdvUrFbX6C4H1rbMMTUQ.text: Stopped by on a Tuesday night with a group of friends. We wanted to sit outside but due to the haboob yesterday the chairs were dirty and the waiter was kind enough to clean our chairs and table for us. I got the "bye felciia" and it was overly sweet. Too sweet. It tasted like Kool aid. We also got an order of the short wings that were decent. Then we finished with a bottle of prosecco that was decent. I've been here for Sunday funday before,  they have a great deal for bottles of champagne on the weekend. Overall, this place isn't anything too special but for drink specials it's a good place to stop by.

photos.caption: Photo of Bliss Rebar - Phoenix, AZ, United States

xBBbS9jpKzdsNvnZTAsI2w.text: It was a slow weeknight for dinner, and I thought the experience was okay. I got the 4th street tacos with chicken. There is a bar and several tables inside, as well as tables outside (front and side of the restaurant). I'd come back here again, probably for drinks or a weekend brunch.

FL-v9p_HlgqpEOCmhZsW_g.text: I really like this place , I went at night on a Wednesday with my lady. The place is so cool and it's awesome that they have all day happy hour on Wednesday. The vibe outside is so cool and it's perfect to have a few drinks on any arizona night. The drinks were ok a lot of sugar and soda but they were cheap so it's ok. We didn't try the food but I definitely will next time the menu seemed good with a lot of options. The bartender was so cool and polite and very accommodating and that was the highlight along with the music and people there, that day. It's a really nice bar and a good spot to check out , I'll will go again and try a few more things for sure.

5F1KHIsWJTyTsjESNNOMPA.text: Love this place! The atmosphere is very friendly and always lively. We mostly go here on sundays for their drink specials. The service is fantastic, the bartenders make the best drinks and are always good at making sure everybody gets served.

7oBjLNiixQieLpHqrPEjKg.text: Update : 4/28/19 3pm 345 pm  from the last nice review i made about this place! first off been coming to this place for many years brining people from all over.  so this sunday no different i order a bottle a get ready to order food i pay and as me and my 3 friends are sitting at the table the guy who just charged me for the bottle comes to our table and says very loudly we are being kicked out we need to finish our drinks and leave we asked why we where being kicked out and the bartender proceeded to say it was because the table behind us did not like or the way we look im not sure but all i know is he gave us 5 mins to finish and came back yelled again okay you got to so i was so shocked embarrassed confused i will never in my life go back to this place i will also make sure to let everyone know how thwy allow there employees to treat paying customers the so called manger that we wanted to speak with who was there with a nose ring would not even come and state why we where being kicked out never have i been to a place of business and been treated the way i have here pure disgust. Never got my refund! Keep the money buy your staff some human decency and class.

KncPeLLt4KHittL5qgXK7w.text: Ok. I have been here two times for their Sunday brunch and have had pretty different experiences in food quality.  The first time their food really did taste like they were using old oil on their fries or something. The rest of the food seemed ok but the fries were pretty off putting.  Next time the food was all better, including the fries which did not taste like old oil this time.  The staff was always very helpful and friendly. The Sunday brunch there is also just lit in general. I would recommend checking them out but their food might be a bit inconsistent...
