UFtEoZbchomvw_k13S2_fQ.text: Wow, a real live DJ playing happy and fun nostalgia inducing songs at breakfast time. Luckily the group I was with needed a good pick me up for a moot court competition. Bliss definitely pepped us all up.   The food was A-Ok. I had the chorizo breakfast tacos and a sangria. Sangria was a mix of red wine, a few liqueurs, OJ, and 7up. Tasted like fruit punch. Didn't feel the food was very special.   We sat on the patio, and their seemed to be only 1 waiter for a full patio. Our service was really slow. Felt bad for the waiter who was scrambling, but he still did it with a smile.   Atmosphere of the patio is really cute, loved the cute rebar decor. Peppy place to hang out. Really great patio space! I'd give this place another shot.

WPh5r30PqJxioSVW9exz_A.text: Bliss is loacated right in the heart of Downtown Phoenix, with a large outside seating area to include inside seating and large bar area.   Food;  The mac and cheese ball are absoluty to die for, and a must try.  This trip I had the brunch with eggs, and bacon that were delicious.   Service; The service is always super friendly and amazing

Cqw7Kg-lqBHgcXj0ie9Rtw.text: Sunday brunch was good. Offered Champagne bottles on special while having brunch. Think they offered 2 4 1 drinks on Sundays. Had a chill Sunday Funday vibe. Staff was very nice.

swlkEjXoV8QQWk-nQd81uw.text: Every single time I've been here, I've been surrounded by nothing but good vibes.   I've gone with and without reservations, and for both I recommend to get there before noon if you want to make sure you get a table to eat at. The atmosphere is friendly, welcoming and after the DJ gets there on Sundays at 2pm, it's ready for a party.   There are plenty of drink specials on the weekends, and the food is great too. I suggest stuffing your face with the sliders, the fried pickles, & any style of their potatoes. Thank god they have $12 champagne bottles to help you hydrate through any heaviness in the food

i-toZGf5a6gnsnQWWgu78Q.text: Dirty and rundown. Years ago this bar/restaurant used to be a nice place but over the years it has become run down. The place isn't kept up anymore. Furniture is old, warped and dirty. The outside bar isn't maintained and always looks gross. Patio floor is always dirty with debris from the trees. I wouldn't recommend this place. Spend your money at a place that cares about their appearance.

We were the only ones on the patio and the bartender turned on the misters along w the fan. Super attentive and accommodating. Menus one star cause the inside is kind of dark and dingy feel.

rmKfic_WdeKQtmow9LOPqw.text: Well , I've always been pleased in the pasr. Not today.  Went to brunch with friends. My food came well after everyone else had finished their food.   So what does one do then? I got my food to go and I just had a bite. It's awful.  I'm angry. Waited two hours. They had the temerity to charge me.

tT6NG084X70vd2LgcH1ptg.text: Bliss/Rebar is a stable in my week. The food is delicious - I've been eating here for years and have never had something I didn't like. The location/vibe is great for lunch/dinner during the week, and is a great place to go out for happy hour or late night on the weeks.   Staff are always attentive and friendly, great crowd that is typically in their 20's and 30's.

rLRKwoM0-yZE_1fs-b-FLQ.text: Such a fun laid back social spot especially for brunch!  First and most important the mimosas:  They offer $12 bottles of champagne and then you can purchase a small carffe of juice to add and you can make your own mimosas at your table. I like this because I hate juice full mimosas.    The menu has a great selection!  Very large.  Despite the nachos looking to die for every time I saw them come out and served to another table I had the omelette and subbed egg whites for an additional $2.  The omelette was great. Not dry at all or overcooked! The side of potatoes are the real all star. I would highly suggest getting a side if your entree does not come with them.  People mingle throughout the day on the patio if it's a nice day and they have a variety of types of seating.  Great place to start for brunch and be social, whether there is 2 of your or a large group.  Bartenders and servers were great! super friendly and easy going. You can't be in a bad mood once you come here!

VHvK6x6VocOdqYdP1SAsnQ.text: What a wonderful find! Wandered past several times, admiring the patio, before finally stopping in. Friendly crowd, great bartenders who are knowledgeable and give fantastic suggestions, tasty drinks, even tastier food! We had a blast. Nothing negative to say at all. Can't wait to come back and try the nachos, they looked ridiculously good.

A8b-zoUEI94-rKWHIPrbJw.text: Great staff as they're very accommodating to your needs. I would definitely recommend others to go and check it out especially in the weekends!

wz2Lzs2licYpHKu4bKeDXw.text: They've shown some improvement. I ate at Bliss opening weekend and was not impressed. However, I gave it a second chance and had a much better experience. I had a grilled cheese sandwich with the creamy tomato soup. My boyfriend had the Bliss Burger. Both were great comfort food. We'll be back again.

kWfCD0RmtlUPmCjmGVRw9w.text: These guys do a great job! Very good food and a very professional, friendly staff. Refreshing after the slew of mediocre restaurants that were there before.

OtmWDpid5QLZza7I9pJg3A.text: We parked about a couple of blocks from where the commotion of First Friday was happening.  We were starving when we came to the doorstep of Bliss/reBAR.  The bar side was packed full of people.  I was surprised to see that there are several empty tables inside the restaurant side while the outdoor patio was rockin'!  The menu was pretty small, but enough to have something for everyone.  The pretzel bun caught my attention so my hubby and I ordered the Bliss Burger with cheese.  This came with a side of spinach salad for $8.50.  Side of fries cost about $4 more.  My son wanted the Grilled Cheese with provolone, thick slices of bacon and pear since there were NO KIDS MENU. So good!!!   I love when restaurants make traditional staples their own!  I would so go back for the pretzel bun and check out what else they have up their sleaves!!!

ZAzB-ESwtWNoXdkucR1RgQ.text: Always have a great time at rebar. Love the mac and cheese. Great drink specials. Love sunday funday

Ff72iDuVh8IHeWiChfFZiw.text: Been awhile, used to go quite often because my friends liked it. Food is not very good, bar side is fun though.

Nm6uWyYoJeXvrjsk5OB0sw.text: To be fair, this review was for April 28, but I was only recently able to finish polishing it up.   The short: Solid contemporary American fare at a fair price, fast and efficient service, clean contemporary surroundings.   The long: Bliss is located on the northeast corner of 4th St. and Garfield. Free street parking can get scarce, but they have a lot on 3rd St north of Roosevelt, and we found unmetered parking an easy trot away on Garfield, just west of 3rd St.   We had reservations for Dining Out for Life, and I was relieved to see how efficiently everything ran on such a busy night. The patio at the connected reBAR was packed, and Bliss' patio was filling, but the tables were spaced so diners wouldn't be too crowded. We sat inside where it was dimly lit, clean, and again, not too tight a fit. The nondescript contemporary decorations faded into the background, but it wasn't boring, and it provided the sound buffer that I'm seeing lacking in more and more new restaurants--bare-walled, hard-surfaced, cement-floored, echoing new restaurants. With that in mind, extra kudos to Bliss for not pumping music so loudly into the tiny space--I was able to have a dinner conversation with my boyfriend without having to raise my voice or strain to hear him. If you like to see the cooks in action, the kitchen is open, and we were just about 8 feet from the window and the expediting chef so we could watch him run quality control over all the dishes coming out.   We started with the $4 grilled pretzel bread, served with a trio of dipping sauces. It was thin slices of pretzel loaf toasted into pretzel chips just small enough to fit into the big condiment cups. Nothing too remarkable, but the dish was tasty and conducive to snacking--a perfect appetizer--and I was glad to be able to switch between the spicy, fatty, and sweet dips: grainy mustard, melted cheese, and some sweet, fruity, red jammy sauce.   My boyfriend had the Blissburger with a side of coleslaw. More pretzel bread here, this time in bun form. The perfectly sized burger was perfectly cooked to medium-rare and was fine, and the greens on top were fresh. The red cabbage-based coleslaw was also good--fresh, crisp, not too sweet nor too vinegary. Really, everything was fine, but altogether, it wasn't a memorable dish. Then again, my most memorable burger in Phoenix is a griddled wineburger from a dive bar.   I had the $15 double cut pork chop dinner sauced with what they call tomato ragout and served with potatoes au gratin and veggies--that night, it was a couple stalks of broccolini. The broccolini was tough--I prefer my broccolini a couple shades softer. I liked the pork chops, but the meat was a little dry on one end. I just wish it hadn't been the end I finished with since it started out so well. The ragout was nice, but it seemed like it needed to be cooked together longer so the flavors could meld together better.   For dessert, we split the $6.50 cobbler of the day--apple. It's everything an apple cobbler with a crust instead of a crumble should be, although it didn't look like any apple cobbler I've seen, with a square of crust sitting on top. No complaints, though--every component was good, and the dessert came together well.   I'd like to try this place on a regular night--I have a feeling the quality of the food can only improve, and everything else was great.

nzoH9zN014g_zhnzRoeMKA.text: Took my co-workers out for lunch today and picked Bliss. We are all now full of Bliss! Around the table I saw Loaded Mac N Cheese, Naked Mac N Cheese, Three Tacos, Chicken Sandwich and Veggie Sandwich. As usual with this crew, the shoestring potatoes (we picked salt/vinegar) were done to perfection. All of the sandwiches were served with a small side of veggie slaw (red cabbage/carrot), which disappeared all around. Sadly there was no room for dessert, which sounded fantastic. Equally as sad...no alcoholic beverages for us, since we were headed back to work. The patio area is quite large and as soon as the temp dips, we'll be asking for that seating...such a beautiful building.

crlx88pO_XTzu0cua77TjQ.text: Had a great Sunday brunch, $10 pitchers of mimosas, and the french toast was pretty decent. It is mostly patio, so perfect place to bring a four legged friend.

7lIW9HKKQa7B20_20Ot0WA.text: My friend and I went to Bliss for a nice dinner before we met other friends for some drinks.  We were seated quickly and were excited about the menu.  With in 10 minutes of being seated a large (1 1/2") cockroach crawled across my foot.  Initially I panicked, jumping from the table while trying my hardest not to make a scene. We called the waiter over to investigate, but he could not find the roach.  As you can imagine, we were very unsettled by the experience and the fear of the critter returning.  Sitting there not sure if he had crawled in to our purses, up our chairs or in our hair.........you know that feeling.    We were served drinks as we debated on leaving the establishment and just calling it a night.  We sipped on the cocktails to calm our nerves and thought about our other friend who would be meeting us there later and the hassle it would take to redirect everyone to a different location.  Before we could get completely calmed, the roach returned!! Crawling on the wall just inches from my shoulder!!!!  We jumped from the table, again trying not to make a scene as there were at least 12 other guests in the small dining room.  We were ushered to another section of the establishment and reseated.    At this point we are in pure shock.  Our food came quickly after that, but at this point our appetites were not the same.  But here is the best part, when our $80.00 bill arrived, NOT ONE ITEM WAS COMPED!!  I expressed to the waiter my severe disappointment with our experience and how they did not have the courtesy to comp or at the minimum discount our meal, ESPECIALLY after we made a conscious effort not to make a scene and ruin the experience for some of the other customers.  After expressing my disappointment, we STILL weren't given a discount.  Instead, the manager gave us coupons for $5 off our NEXT visit.  LOL!!!  Good luck getting us to come back dude.  Your cheap decision and lack of customer service is going to cost you A LOT more than $80 now.  We will NEVER return.  Our friends will never return.  My family will never return.  My clients will never return.  I will inform, advise and YELP my poor experience at Bliss to anyone that will listen.  P.S. On a positive note the bartender on the other side of the establishment, ReBar was super friendly, understanding and helped us drown our roach filled disappointment with a strong cocktail.  Thank you ma'am, here's a $5 coupon for that drink.

4ci7RB9xE3rl3Teajd6L-Q.text: Had a wonderful brunch today. The burrito was excellent with a pitcher of mimosa. Check it out!

0NalEG8uQvomegRBOuZAsA.text: A fantasic spot to have a bite to eat, and grab a drink with your friends.  First Friday is always Jammed packed with all kinds of people from straights, gays, hipsters, the local, and the people watchers.  Great open patio with lots of room to mingle.  I would totally recommend stopping here.

KAM6FeNb5La3_7sRil-nhA.text: This was the second time I've been to Bliss. The first time I ordered the Grilled Cheese with Pears, the second time I just went for dessert.  Both times I was disappointed.  The grilled Cheese with pears was small, and didn't have a side.  For 7 dollars I thought it was overpriced, and nothing I couldn't have made at home-just some cheese, slapped on sourdough bread, with some pears.  This past time I had the Brownie Sundae and  it was not very good at all.  The brownie was extremely dry and severely lacking in that chocolatey taste.  The ice cream was good, but I also suspect it wasn't homemade-so that was probably why it was tasty.  There was some carmel drizzled on top of the ice cream with a sprig of mint. That was it. For $6.50 it was way overpriced and the brownie sundae is definitely something I could have made (better) at home.  The ambiance at Bliss is great though, and there isn't much noise. The service was alright, nothing to write home about.  I would recommend if you're absolutely starving and there isn't anywhere else to go. (you're in downtown phoenix though, so there's always somewhere else to go)

V-3ajmTKw7lRaMAn6_3Puw.text: Jojo rocks! Sunday is so good and for me it is all about the artistry of Jojo. Food good....drink prices good.....Jojo....sublime. Keep up the good work on Sundays.  Mac and cheese rocks by the way. The only thing we were wishing we had was longer live music because we were having a good time.

bPYsct5s6U23CnmkSX86qA.text: Hung out last night and had the shrimp tacos and some drinks. The food is amazing here and the staff is all very friendly! Going back tonight for 2-4-1 drinks and some sea salt & vinegar fries. This is definitely the new hang out spot for friends.

dRoGYdNw4fwUqUXmM-pAJQ.text: I have only eaten here once but I will definitely be back. The bacon Mac and cheese was sublime and my lunchmate said the shrimp tacos were delicious. Service was good, atmosphere friendly and low key.

GbrTBbc03qCCmB3dDjokKw.text: Nice location. Good outdoor dining. Moms Pot roast good and so are sausage ravioli. Interesting drinks an some local beers. I need to check out The Bliss Burger soon.

0I1glXTOX_wmmdV2lFG8UA.text: I'm kind of obsessed with their brunch. $10 bottle of champagne with orange juice for DIY mimosas, plus cheap and tasty entrees. I have always left full and tipsy for less than $20...how great is that? The space is super-cute, too, and the wait staff are friendly. The Roosevelt neighborhood is kind of lame, but so is most of downtown. At least parking is easy;-) I hope this place hangs on...it's a cute spot!

gjSI_zL3fWCP5AVe_2E74A.text: We went after a friend's gallery opening  Food was different and good. We had various apps with the daily drink special. Comfort cheese crisps had great flavor. Needed more cheese. We had a big party of about 20. They put us in the middle area with tables/bench seating. Quite nice

m5NZ0JaaT7mjm4ka0UV35A.text: A really interesting place to visit.  Sort of a new take on a pub menu. Nothing heavy but a nice mix of sandwiches, salads, appetizers.  Food was excellent, service was great.  Nice drink menu with a lot of interesting martinis.  Nice wine-by-the-glass.  Very moderately priced.  A great place to visit if you're in downtown Phoenix.  Very casual. We'd definitely go back.

UvMU4rttroYvg_-22W3TpA.text: Great decor inside and spacious patio bar area outside. The food was amazing and well presented. To make the place perfect I  would suggest the following; service could be a little more responsive and organized. In general the wait staff were very good. The lighting inside where we ate was harsh and bright, later they did turn it down to a soft glow. The music was an incessant pounding monotous beat, almost like a club. Perhaps jazz, electronic ambiant or a world beat would make for a more pleasing background sound vibe.

zPH-x3o_vxhkFW7NJI8XLg.text: Love the Mac and Cheese here! Officially my favorite Mac dish in the downtown phx area. You can add chicken for the meat lovers or just have veggies mixed in. You can also make it spicy for you Sriracha lovers.   Prices aren't bad, they have a good happy hour menu, and every day they have a drink special for $3.   Lastly, the employees there are really nice and helpful, my waitress Erica was very attentive and gave us options on what to try the next time we come back; which we will be coming back! Check it out!!

jSqkbk7Xpg_5qYF2K6ni4w.text: The tacos here are amazing!!! I came for a Sunday afternoon brunch and wow it was packed! We were still seated and served fast, and the crowd on the bar side looked like they were having an amazing time. The weather was perfect, friendly staff, amazing tacos... it was a great afternoon. I will definitely be back for those tacos.

LYD1nb0vWHtIbRH188LRaw.text: I typically don't do negative reviews but this place took the cake.  Sign said to see hostess and had to hunt her down to be told to seat where ever.   And then the best part we waited a 10 minutes be fore anybody acknowledged us  So adios.

xcm90iR1t0sj6tz9fi5ChQ.text: The food I had for lunch here was fine (including the fries, which made me happy as I hate cold/soggy/raw fries) and I was nicely offered water as I waited for my friend, but I found it very strange how the waitress had to keep leaving the building.  I guess the restaurant is in the building next door?  Why don't they open up that one for lunch then?  It was really strange, especially since there'd be NO employee in the entire restaurant for long periods of time.  It makes me wonder how often people walk out on their bill.  Also, the parking is nonexistent, and I couldn't tell where I was "allowed" to park in the surrounding mini lots.  I finally just parked on the street and walked in the bright heat.  Not fun.  I don't see myself coming back here unless someone else really wants to go.  I admit I am not a fan of the Roosevelt area/scene though.

AQ41-B5oFCqNDFpxGN1pBA.text: Perfect brunch spot. The food is good. Drinks are strong and you're sure to run into a friend or meet a new one here. The staff is very friendly and attentive.   I had this burger with pineapple on it, so yummy. Pretzel buns need to be standard on any burger.   Also try the cheese fries!

SunAneamWHxIuoRPqk5I3g.text: Awful.  Service was pretty slow (although server was super nice once he was able to give us some attention).  Ordered black bean burger that was a lukewarm garden burger patty topped off with a black hair in the fries.  Won't be back...ever.

OltkX_B04U8iFCloqxz5oA.text: Food was good. We had the cheesy mac balls balls for appetizer. Entrees we had were buddha burger, 4th street tacos chicken, and 4th street tacos shrimp.   Pros-  *food was good. *enjoyed the zoo animal artwork more than the service.   Cons- service was mediocre. *Asked for a Plantation Tea (Pineapple Ice Tea) and was charged for a $3.00 juice, and a $3.00 ice tea. Shocked... Probably cheaper to get a Long Island Ice Tea. If you order an Arnold Palmer, you probably have to pay $3.00 lemonade and $3.00 ice tea.  *Food took about 30 minutes. *Appetizer came after the entrees. *Had to ask for more silverware. *Had to ask for more water. *Had to get up and pump my own ketchup at the food line!  *Dessert was brought to the wrong table and not enough spoons to share.  *Asked for three separate checks and every check was wrong.   Would I come back? Probably not.

tnK3un_hWbW0oif_CW19gA.text: We hadn't been here in over 5 years, so decided to meet a friend last Sunday for brunch...wow, were we really impressed!  The service was fantastic, the atmosphere is really nice and good music was spinning, the food was amazing and the drink specials are ridiculous - $10 bottles of champagne and $3 carafes of juice (orange, grapefruit, cranberry or pineapple).  I highly recommend the egg white veggie scramble - so delicious!  We will definitely be back for this amazing brunch!

9YXXCKypNQa3j6nuw0GBuw.text: This was the best visit to bliss ever!!! Our server Andrew was attentive and friendly! He really cared, the drinks were flowing and the food was delicious!

sqJ-PNMSX17o5CR0F50ttw.text: The graffiti in the area is very remarkable and the views from Bliss patio are stunning.   I enjoyed the walk out of the canyon walls of downtown towards Bliss. No more than a mile trek from corporate and into an outcast part of town so it would seem but none the less, right where it belongs. Youth have been keeping these historical homes downtown relevant for the past 50 years.  HH is a $3dollar martini or draft beer. The young ones that serve here are pretty fun. Over all a very romantic house to chat, laugh and wipe the drink away from your date's lips and give up a kiss.

photos.caption: Photo of Bliss Rebar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bliss view of  The Westward Ho, the Moon, Venus and Jupiter, all nearly in conjunction from rebar.
Photo of Bliss Rebar - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Bliss Rebar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bliss view to the South from rebar

tXItfgVWLByvFfWYUrptwA.text: Love this place! Great food every time I have been. The nachos are amazing, go for brunch and get the Morning Nachos. Also have bottles of champagne and OJ for mimosas.

pwpOufmJ3I4WmFlW7WI4rQ.text: I went here with a whole lot of friends for the annual Brides of March Pub Crawl (women and MEN in wedding dresses - yaaasss!)  Bliss ReBAR took such good care of all of us.    This place has a pretty cool vibe.  They have nice outdoor seating and an outdoor bar.  A big building just across the street keeps the blaring sun at bay.  So awesome!  The people here are so nice and friendly.  They kept the drinks flowing as needed and made our day so fun.  The foodie in me of course had to try the food.  I had the nachos with just beef and cheese and they were delicious.  It comes with cabbage but I am not a fan.  They are made with wonton chips instead of tortilla chips.  WOWZA.  Best nachos I've ever had....EVER!  I also tried their chicken strips.  Been wanting to try them since the last Brides of March.  They are coconut chicken tenders w/citrus ginger honey sauce.  Very tasty and filling.  I recommend them if you want to try something different than the normal, standard, boring chicken strip.  They have a DOTD (Drink of the Day) - $4 drinks of the day & more listed on their website.  They have a Weekend Breakfast from 10am-3pm - delicious breakfast classics with $10 bottles of champagne (make your own mimosa), $4 bloody marys & single mimosas.  Have to try that!  Woot woot, loved this place.  5 stars

gS6JBTKLXzdMop6qZ8Vaeg.text: Great place to enjoy a nice meal and drinks. We went on Valentines day and it was not too crowded ( it was already late around 830 pm). They have inside and outside seating. Food is good, nothing to water for but worth the money. I had the salmon and it was good. We also tried the hummus trio for starter and it was very tasty.  Overall a good pick downtown.

cWBTINj3xxCQsCQLR0eTcg.text: Nice outdoor patio but it was cold when we went so we opted for a nice cozy seat inside. Nice menu and healthy selections ..+ and + ! Hummus, ;lettuce wraps, shrimp, veggies, cheese... we ordered so much food between two ppl even the waiter asked when the last time we ate was...lol we had the munchies what can i say :)  Quick service and the bill didn't hurt too much either.... check it out for apps and drinks!!

MjOl-VGydvDyh7n1dGBk8w.text: Hilary and Nina are amazing. Best service and awesome personalities. Thank you ladies for being so wonderful. Will be back just to enjoy more laughter and wonderful service!

DKEidHBxDJjnaBC1Dnap6A.text: We've been here several times, sat outside every time. It's so nice we brought family when they came to visit from out of state. Awesome food, and we have tried several different entrees and sandwiches with all good results - I'm from the South and can tell you they do shrimp and grits quite well. The cocktails and non-alcoholic drinks are always flavorful too. Atmosphere is great and servers always friendly. The only downside is that downtown parking, or lack thereof.

B8RzAGLW9HeD8FcFDv4gCQ.text: The inside is cute albeit small.  I asked our waitress to turn the music down and she happily obliged.  Our table ordered the pretzel bread (thanks to Yelpers!) and it was delish.  A few pieces were burned unfortunately.  :(  I had the spicy ceasar salad and I have to say, adding sriacha to ceasar dressing is a fantastic idea.  Chicken was tasty although a bit overcooked.  My companions enjoyed their meals as well.  The hot fudge sundae was a treat but my husband felt there was too much chocolate compared to the ice cream (I heartily disagree).    All in all, a great little place.  It was fairly empty on a Wednesday night but other reviews say it's packed on the weekends so that's good.  Support local businesses!

KZoEx4Bk0BGxIrG8Th-qjA.text: This place is pretty lively and a great atmosphere for Sunday Funday. It is really busy, so don't expect your server to come by every 5 minutes.  I ordered the Cuban with Parmesan fries as a side. The food was great, but they mixed up my order which is why they didn't get a 5 star. The took of my jalepenos & they didn't tell my fries cost extra. Who the hell wants a side salad as a side? The drinks are great, but also pricey. I do enjoy the food & atmosphere but not sure about the price. Maybe that's the vibe? I would be back though as their menu looked full of great options.

photos.caption: Photo of Bliss Rebar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cuban Sandwhich

YVODS4qjCFflLJyJ9_bolw.text: I joined up with Gato and other yelpers for a Boozy Bruch UYE and Bliss Rebar was the place picked. When the weather is nice, you brunch outside!  Since it was brunch hours, I with the $12 bottle of bubbles, yes baby we are brunchin right!  After checking out the menu I went with the breakfast tacos. Soft corn tortillas with scrambled eggs, chorizo, pepper, onion, cilantro and pico de gallo. Even though the tacos tasted great, they were lacking in filling, like they spilt filling for one taco into 2, so it left me some what hungry still and out of $11 bucks, but hey I did a bottle of bubby at a killer price! I did see some great plates being serve and maybe I just ordered the wrong thing.  Bliss Rebar is a hoppin place, so might have to wait for a few for a table and sometimes service is slow so keep your eye on the time to not go over on your parking meter (the joys of parking downtown). But Bliss Rebar knows how to do fun, so you won't be bored!

9N0rbWG-VtaTcahgMv3fAA.text: It's hit or miss here. It depends on the server. Our favorite nights are Tuesday and Friday. Always excellent service and food is spot on.  Tuesday and Thursday is cheese board and bottle wine for 22 bucks. (I'm sure you can share it but why? It's like KFC family meal. It's really for 1 selfish person sharing is for amateurs)  Happy hour is until 6:30. Drinks are strong and reasonable.  Grilled cheese burger is fantastic.  All in all we love this place and it's our go to spot.  Owners are nice guys

photos.caption: Photo of Bliss Rebar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Wings
Photo of Bliss Rebar - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Bliss Rebar - Phoenix, AZ, United States

v5MlNnPNUO99Wl7wIIBI1w.text: This place was nice! I've been here for how many times. A week ago I was here with my family. The food was pretty good! We got a lot of food and it was so delicious. The Chicken was great and the Dessert was so amazing and yummy. The place was nice and fun, especially at night. The ambiance of the place was good. The service was excellent and the staff was very friendly but sometimes lack of initiative. However, that was still a great time for us.

EpUk2FSF7GAF46O3W3fdSg.text: Came in for their brunch special circa noon-ish and was so glad we had reservations because 15mins later the place was thumping, bumping, and packed!  As we were waiting for a couple of other friends to arrive to complete our rag tag brunch party of four, we killed the time at the bar w/the abfab bartenders and the $12 champagne btl +$3 juice special. Worth it!   When our party was all there we were sat at a little table in the middle of it all that offered partial coverage from a nearby stray umbrella from the unrelenting #sundayfunday Phoenix sun.  Service was initially quick and we got our orders super fast, but it took awhile to get our checks and cash out/pay w/our cards because the place was little brimming w/people and I think our poor waiter was just overwhelmed.  He was also nice enough to let us know that while the $12 btls went back to full price at 2pm, the cocktails went on special. Sadly, because our meters were about to expire, we couldn't stay.  The food was on point. The fried mac n cheese balls were amazeballs (see what I did there?) and the sauce they came in was ridic delish!  The french toast bfast was also very good, but definitely a shareable plate, except for the bacon portion, which was only two pieces...and let's face it, you gotta really care for someone to only settle for a single piece of perfectly cured and crispy bacon! So, pro-tip: order an extra side if you split this dish.  The bfast tacos my friend ordered were meh & underwhelming, so I def go w/another brunch option.  What really sets this place apart (besides the ultra-fab crowd/vibe) is the decor! From the wow-factor of the bar and the big metal head sculpture behind the hostess stand to the psychedelic paintings inside, half the fun is just wandering around people watching and exploring the space!

photos.caption: Photo of Bliss Rebar - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Bliss Rebar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Menu
Photo of Bliss Rebar - Phoenix, AZ, United States

BVOaq3n8_056i_DEuO1ILQ.text: I ordered their, veggie "Bliss Famous Mac and Cheese" which was, "House-made sauce comprised of our special blend of white cheddar, pepper jack, and parmesan" plus tomatoes, broccoli, and spinach. Unfortunately, it ended up being runny and sour. I was hoping for a thicker mac n cheese.  I'll try to return and order something else to give it another chance because the service was great and the place is very artistic and beautiful. It's pretty memorable, has many large pieces inside and out.

photos.caption: Photo of Bliss Rebar - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Bliss Rebar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Signage.
Photo of Bliss Rebar - Phoenix, AZ, United States

Do1JwGi5EC0cM904m_3_vg.text: I've been wanting to try this place for the longest time! Every time we are in the area, Rebar seems to be the place to be! The music is going and  the place is packed!   We finally had the chance to make it to brunch for a friend's birthday. The food was so tasty! I had the cheeseburger and a side of fries. Half of the burger was more than enough to fill my belly. There was a drink special that happened at 2pm but I failed at taking a picture of the menu and don't remember what the special was. (oops)   Overall I had a great time and would recommend the place to friends. I love a come-as-you-are place that's chill and the only requirement is you must come to have fun!

tfuZn0Cw4qMhy6d7MR66nQ.text: I love the atmosphere here! Sitting outside in the trees people watching. Also a great stop in during First Friday's. I have never eaten here but the selection of craft cocktails and the knowledgeable bartenders is always a plus.  Stop in. Sit. And hang out downtown with a great cocktail!

AhDrbqvynPH6FQK0cqW3ng.text: I eat here with friends all the time! The atmosphere is wonderful, food is amazing especially the smothered breakfast burrito, and you can't beat the drink specials. I love the place for a friends hangout brunch spot. Only frustrating thing is all the new parking meters, but they can't help that.

XaRAwl6o_U4EUuo_o4wORA.text: I've been to Bliss Rebar a few times now and every time has been a great experience. The food has been tasty and they have a great drink menu!  You can't beat their weekend mimosa special!  The staff is great and attentive which can be difficult when it's busy. The outdoor patio is cozy with casual, bar, and table seating and great music. I recently had a miscommunication regarding a reservation where they could have easily blamed me but they took ownership right away, he seemed sincerely sorry for our mishap, and went above and beyond to fix things and get me to keep coming back. It was a busy day for them and I couldn't have had a better experience!

TE3RzabMz2OF1FsWajqQUw.text: Come here for brunch but the food needs lots of work ....I always get salads when I come out but romaine lettuce should not have red pigments in it ... indicating the freshness of the lettuce .... my thing if a salad with chicken is 15.50 then you have the chance to bring quality to the table .... if the chain "salad on the go" can bring quality and freshness for 1/2 the price ...then you can do the same.  Like chef Ramsey says ...."if your gonna charge high prices then you better be about quality and freshness"

MKLtF0CXgao89G32jD1DEw.text: My friend and I walk into Bliss on a Monday evening. Our waiter was Tony whom we instantly fell in like with, mostly because of his cookie monster t-shirt and yoga skills. Tony was the best waiter ever! He's personable and really went out of his way to make sure we were happy. I'm vegan and there aren't many vegan options on the menu so we started working on altering menu items to find me something suitable. The kitchen staff was happy to oblige.The drinks were strong enough to turn us from decent respectable individuals to unfit for public consumption in about about 2 hours which Tony managed to weathered like a pro. He really is waiter of the year. He even saved a woman and her puppy from drowning. Which I thought was noble until we found out she was a Trump supporter. But that's the kind of amazing human Tony is. I even got a hug on the way out. (The woman drowning thing didn't actually happen but I'm sure if it did, Tony would have saved the puppy first.)

d1eDC79g5ppD1QaDWyZ6HQ.text: Mac N Cheese meaty is way too good! Thai shrimp was delicious and wish I ordered more.

UaNezLtjx2-efDZX1FJDIg.text: This place what a good spot for a quick happy hour. I enjoyed the Bye Falicia (drink) and the Mac & Cheese Balls.

photos.caption: Photo of Bliss Rebar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Had the homemade Mac &amp; Cheese Balls
Photo of Bliss Rebar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Bye Falicia House Favorite

LEr6OFMIUw5aYpUBWw62vw.text: Been her numerous times and I'm finally writing a review.   I love this place. I've never had a bad time. The drinks are strong, food is bomb, and service is always top notch.   I crave their Mac n cheese balls and nachos. Every now and then I try other stuff and it's always been good.   The staff is always awesome. All my servers and bartenders have been great! Food always comes quick and so do drinks. I'm big on customer service. You can have great food but if the servers suck I don't usually go back. I can't say more about how much I love bliss.   I'll be back soon :)

aOkyzb0T3oJwfJ1Up1DqQg.text: I wanted a special place for Mothers Day! This was it! A bottle of champagne and chicken and waffles! Great service from Alex! My day is complete! Thanks Bliss / Rebar

photos.caption: Photo of Bliss Rebar - Phoenix, AZ, United States

oUq0bWtd5-D-oxPitdb-Fw.text: Cool little place. Came on a Monday night so it was pretty dead. Bartenders were Stephen and David and they were very nice and attentive!   Had the grilled pretzel bread is exactly what it sounds like, pretzel bread grilled on both sides like toast on the grill. They really give you a bunch of cheese which is nice because I love a lot of cheese!   The Mac n cheese came on a bed of house cheese, breaded, deep fried, crunchy and super cheesy.

photos.caption: Photo of Bliss Rebar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Sorry, we already started eating this but this was the grilled pretzel with cheese
Photo of Bliss Rebar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mac &amp; cheese bites
Photo of Bliss Rebar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Menu with drinks and happy hour!

X9Cbj63WRDhl-J6mW2DfpQ.text: Exceptional service,  Margo is a superstar. Attentive, authentic, and beautiful.  Great service and amazing energy.

UYJE3Brl-QTUmKHk351oRA.text: Love this place! I'm always there when I'm in PHX! Boys are cute and the woman are beautiful!

F59yljeLuulnSJrZkBH57g.text: Bliss is always a great time guaranteed. Great service and the best brunch in town! Margarita Mondays are also a must try and don't forget to try their nachos!  I love the relaxed and welcoming vibe and staff is always friendly and helpful. We live across the street and bliss is one of our favorite places to hang out and have a good time.

photos.caption: Photo of Bliss Rebar - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Bliss Rebar - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Bliss Rebar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Breakfast burrito, Thai shrimp, and mimosas

pnGtAx0E8GPd1meB1iwjNA.text: Must try the braised beef tacos, they were excellent. Chicken was good but the shrimp was battered and fried so that ruined it for me. Heavy hand on the mixed drinks which was a nice surprise. Deals everyday of the week which is very nice but they won't let you just 'run a tab', you have to actually run your card and sign it as you order, which is very annoying if you pay cash as they make you pay before you get each drink, appetizer, entree, etc. Other than that its a great place, packed on first Fridays, typical diverse downtown crowd but it leans towards a predominantly gay crowd quite often.

SXYTjAe7En08Jznlo9Sj-g.text: The service sometimes is like just ok... They seem to be all in the weeds... And the owner was just sitting at the bar, instead of helping out... was at a cocktail party for 1 in 10.    I want to love it, but they really need to hire some more servers... The bartender never sent over a menu, even though we had asked.

LOp9kbr3fPm9A1bsP0CFTQ.text: I love this place! The food is good, atmosphere is awesome and service is friendly. The very large outdoor patio make this the perfect downtown hangout for happy hour or dinner. Try one of the sandwiches that have the pretzel buns: NOM NOM!

6IlBrgtMJKkJ7oCYeB7nTg.text: Great service. Tasty food. Good place for friends to gather.

d0VhiI-LBsHn4L526cTEAw.text: The food was amazing.  Great open atmosphere. Good prices and wonderful waitress.  We went here before a Diamondbacks baseball game.  Great find by my friend Marcy.  We will be back!

kfTshuUV9RE6gARe3TA-QQ.text: Good drinks and a fun crowd, which is nice due to its proximity to my residence.

knItk62q7jzw230XRi4tKQ.text: I can only speak for the drinks we had outside the bar. We loved the outside atmosphere and the bartender was very friendly an attentitive. Will have to give the food a shot sometime.

N6R3lYdvV_1pIcfySuIGEA.text: i heard about Bliss ReBar from a coworker so i decided to stop in on a sunday for brunch, yummy yummy yummy for sure....food was really good, drinks were better and the staff was great...will be on the re visit list for sure!

R79DDUS7e3c4BJI3fuZN9w.text: Great food and drinks. The patio area is amazing for those nice cool PHX nights. Even in the summer it is nice and cool on the patio with their misters. I met the chef and he was a great person. The food he comes up with is crazy good. The mac n' cheese is one of my favorites and the Shrimp Tempura BLT was phenomenal!

c1ixKK8pgmYyOyMXEjsD0g.text: Sundays are so much fun at rebar. I haven't had a chance to dine at bliss but did have the shrimp tacos at the bar side and they were yum. Sundays they bring in a dj which completely brings in a great crowd and music all afternoon, something downtown Phoenix needs! So great to have!

UWwLJX8bPK-LgzsMCZvW3g.text: I really enjoyed coming to this place. Stopped here in the evening for a late dinner. I loved the patio area, indoor dinning, and how the bar was separated. The service was great and so was the food. They do have a somewhat small selection than most restaurants, but all places vary. I will definitely be coming back here.

4T0-BSnw8jIA-vBu5mL49w.text: A cute, cozy spot, with perfectly attentive service and fabulous and inexpensive food. A Sunday morning mimosa pitcher was a delicious accompaniment to breakfast sandwiches and the most amazing sandwich I've had in a long time: a BLT with tempura shrimp and avocado aioli. First of all, the shrimp were jumbo-sized. And the whole thing put together was really interesting and good! The bacon was both thick and crispy. Can't wait to come back and try more things from the menu!

em49Xl5CYv0TQJAQVV-AsQ.text: I enjoy hanging with my friends here, for dinner or a drink, very nice staff and I also enjoy the atmosphere.

CMbpDO4Crshnjcmstq-NXw.text: I went here for lunch today with a friend who had a groupon.  We were seated immediately by very friendly staff.  Service was excellent.  Our waitress made sure to see if we had any questions with the menu, and made suggestions.    I had the Fish special - it was the first day they had crab cakes.  It was pretty good, not amazing, but we're in the middle of the dessert - I get that.  I really liked the french fries - very thinly cut and crispy.  My friend had the mac n' cheese.  It was an enormous serving.  It was quite tasty.    They had a low-cal drinks menu - I got the margarita which was quite tasty.  The waitress explained to me that they just cut out all of the heavy sugary syrups for these drinks, which was great for me because I don't like very sweet drinks.  The kitchen is open for all to see, so I was able to see all of the other orders coming out.  Everything looked very good.  I would come back.

TOn4CADdvYPIREG6oU0ZvA.text: I loved this place! I was in Phoenix for work and my friend Peter took me here on a Thursday night for a drink and the atmosphere was so laidback, the bartender was cute and friendly, and the drinks were fantastic and not overpriced. While enjoying our cocktails, he told me about the restaurant attached to the bar and its phenomenal food, so we decided to lunch there the next day. He wasn't kidding. The service was awesome, again the drinks were tasty, and the food was excellent. I had the grilled pretzel bread with dipping sauces and tempura shrimp BLTA sandwich. The grilling of the pretzel bread varied (and not in the best way), but the cheese sauce completely made up for it. And the sandwich was ridiculously tasty... All in all, I would recommend this place to locals or visitors alike.

Tq-4CG_hlTWa5NyZh2wxog.text: I've been to Bliss/reBAR twice now and really enjoyed myself. The food is great (LOVE their parmesan fries), service is always spot on, and its super cute. Can't wait to sit outside once it cools down. The only bummer is that the two times I've been, they haven't been as busy as they deserve to be! Definitely a must the next time you are downtown.

lYL13GUa4rBNX5ahI3mR9Q.text: I have yet to be disappointed with this place!  This is a great new bar in Phoenix!    Happy hour is never a disappointment and the drinks are awesome!  The Pom is my favorite drink and it comes with a kick!  I haven't found an item on the menu I haven't liked.  I've had a little bit of everything on the menu.  The nachos are my favorite with the homemade chips.  The grill cheese was my best pick for dinner.  Bacon and pears was a fantastic addition to this sandwich.  Pair this sandwich with the sea salt & vinegar shoestring fries to complete the dish.  I can't wait to go back to try the Mac & Cheese.  This place has it all: great food, great drinks and an awesome atmosphere!

zuU55BxBnIjIDJuywV5fJg.text: This place is absolutely amazing. The set up is classy and comfortable and it's the kind of place you would go to for any occasion. The food is great and the drinks are well made and very reasonably priced. The bartenders are top notch and are super friendly no matter how busy it is. The owners Kevin and Jackson are great guys and they go out of their way to make you feel at home. I'm so glad that I found this place and I make a point to drop in every time I go to Phoenix.

NYXFHJQS4Q8mgj-FLfYpoA.text: While I normally don't frequent my 3-star places, Bliss/reBAR is still a go-to for me.  But there are just too many aspects to give it a solid rating.  Atmosphere-5 stars.  Always enjoy grabbing a few drinks at the outdoor bar at night.  During the day it functions as an awesome restaurant.  Trees surround the patio, making it a great outdoor eating spot with almost a whimsical feel.  Food-varies from 2 to 4 stars.  Pretzel buns are a must (if your food doesn't come on one, as them), and their nachos and mac-and-cheese have an awesome sauce.  It stops around there though, as salt and oil are clearly the favorite ingredients.  We got the two specials today-calamari tasted like nothing but salt, shrimp-and-grits were like a ship sinking in a sea of oil, and my eggplant/veggie sandwich was raining an oil monsoon.  Yuck!  Drinks-3 stars.  Pretty decent bar staff and generally great service.  If it's not super busy you might even catch a conversation with a bartender.  They could use a better beer selection though, since I can't justify any more $5 Fat Tires downtown.  I've never had an issue finding free street parking, check 4th St. or Garfield.

gwph7ttgcqdjWUDrN3r4UA.text: Took my niece to brunch here before seeing "Breakfast at Tiffany's" at FilmBar.  We were going to go to Matt's Big Breakfast but that place always has such a long line outside, I've only been able to withstand the wait once.  So Bliss it was.  I had been to ReBar on a few occasions, mostly on First Fridays.  Its a great patio.  The bar is big and round and constructed around a rebar fountain-shaped sculpture with bougainvillea growing in it.  Clever and pleasing to the eye.  But I'd never been to the restaurant next door.  We got right in.  My niece settled on the french toast.  It is made with pretzel bread, covered in cream cheese frosting and berries and comes with 2 strips of bacon.  It also came with maple syrup which when poured over the dish seemed to me a bit of sugar overkill.....but my niece loved it.  I tried to order the eggs Benedict, my favorite breakfast food, but was told they no longer were going to have it on the menu but hadn't taken it off yet.  That bummed me out kinda.  Take it off the menu if you don't want your waiters to have to explain all day long that your patrons can't have what they want to order.  I ordered a grilled cheese with tomatoes.  Unfortunately, they put slices of apple on there too, which I guess I overlooked as being a part of the dish on the menu.  Unfortunately, I don't like the combo of tomatoes and apples and picked all the apples out.  It came with a perfectly fine mixed green salad.  Our waiter was affable and attentive to us when our beverages were getting low.   I'd go back and order other items....I just really wanted that eggs Benedict.

9T62w84yC3uqZxxvHqPN5g.text: Black bean burger is really good, average ambience and finally the bad part fries are oily smelling

1Rb3Yo2fo5j9SIpJmYLAYg.text: This is my second time here and hands down the worse service I ever experienced. I came with a party of 9 and they put us on the list  which really never had a time of a waiting time it was like find a table yourself. After waiting 30 minutes  I finally found a table   I had to tell them to sit us  then after we sat I had  to chase someone to take our order.  The food is great  but the wait not worth it.The service   Is Terrible  my friends and I will never come here again this restaurant

Un7WcRLZflZRCUKJwuLa_g.text: Had Breakfast and a pitcher of mimosa - it was incredible. Great patio and atmosphere.

eKbZUi9j-4WpljLbiabm1Q.text: One of my most favorite spots to eat.  The white cheese blend for the mac and cheese is very tasty.  This is the same blend you can request on your burger.  My most favorite item is one which they no longer serve. It was the Philly Cheesesteak and they used this blend on it also.  I am not going to give away the cheese blend as you need to ask your waiter.  I only know that I now use a similar blend in my cooking.  The atmosphere is good especially if you get there at an inbetween time in order to enjoy the quieter times.  Great service too.  I go here quite often and have never been disappointed.

Q76dEEnFrFjeoqLD1VMRUQ.text: LOVED! Went for a late lunch on a beautiful Friday afternoon.  Sat outside, had great service, great food, and can't wait to come back for brunch/happy hour.  A friend and I shared two sandwiches - the tempura shrimp BLTA and grilled cheese.  The tempura shrimp BLTA was one of the best sandwiches I have ever had! Each came with a little spinach leaf side salad with a delish dressing. We splurged and ordered warm cookies for dessert and presented to us were 3 GIANT chocolate chip cookies (like the size of two of my hands!)  I definitely recommend it - sit on the patio, leisurely sip a cocktail, and have the best sandwich mmmmm

Q2oyuRLKFHvg3Nl7nHSLDw.text: Went there last night, and the atmosphere for the restaurant was great! Perfect outside seating, with candles. The pretzel bread with cheese was awesome..  The Mac and cheese with bacon was out of this world! Definitely eating there again!

svtMrWj3PeWVRiqDwybnAQ.text: Awesome style - you will get the name after you visit. They have an amazing patio which is totally lost in the brutal summer heat. I will return next winter.

Nj5TFBnj3APZA2Tz2x3hIg.text: Went for the first time on a Saturday night. Of course it was pretty packed outside.. But we did find some cushion couches off in a corner by themselves.. Our server was great and very friendly. A friend and I had margaritas which were decent. Didn't come with salt or lime or anything. Our other friends had some fruity kiltlifter? They really liked it. I snacked on a side of fries which was pretty yummy as well. One friend had the mac and loved it.

2C8mzM3vGCg9e1tRzW8yhg.text: Love the place. The Grill Cheese Sandwich is made by God's own hands.

8lXptNtZY13pcDCpQ9DxnA.text: reBAR is a great hang out to have a few drinks and enjoy the beautiful patio. The sweet potato chips are a fabulous little snack and the service is always outstanding.

yl25Gi8DuSbkEvJjgAi8Ug.text: Amazing outdoor seating area perfect for soaking up some vitamin D.

mgQdf0Ay4GTBPi7_cu7c9Q.text: Tried this place for happy hour last Wednesday.  Happy hour ends at 6:30p but on Wednesdays you get 20% off your total bill =)  I like that it wasn't crowded so we got lots of attention from the bartender.  The drinks were awesome.  I ordered my fav martini (not on the menu) and Tara (I think that was her name) made it perfectly.  While I'll definitely come here to drink again, I'll eat before I come.  I had the wings and they reminded me of some Tyson wings you could buy from frozen food section of your local grocery store and cook at home.  The chipotle ranch sauce served with the wings was awesome though...and I drank enough that it really didn't matter that the wings weren't that great. Good happy hour spot!

lX3noXz1PN6EAETsCGWzDw.text: I have eaten at Ticoz, Fez, and Switch and find them reasonably good. They aren't top of my list of downtown restaurants, and I can't say I've ever craved anything from them, but they usually offer reliable good eats. Since I live in the neighborhood of Bliss/reBAR, and my friend and I were hungry for lunch this past Sunday (and for those of you downtowners, you know how hard it is to find a good restaurant open on a Sunday!!!), we thought we'd try it out.   Since we had already eaten breakfast, we were looking forward to some lunch grub. Unfortunately, Bliss only serves breakfast until 2PM (as in, you are out of luck if you want to order lunch!). No worries. I like breakfast, so I'll eat it twice in one day. I ordered the breakfast burrito and my friend ordered the omelet. Both of our meals were fine, just not spectacular. The biggest downside was my friend's omelet came with toast - no jam or anything, just plain toast. We asked our server if we could get some jam and were informed that the kitchen didn't stock jam! Um, okay?! To the wait staff's credit, they went above and beyond to try and come up with something to put on the toast. I heard that they are going to start stocking jam in the future, so it must be a common request ;)  Overall, I think the place has good potential. The service was great and the space is interesting (although doesn't appear to be any changes since the space was nine05). I found the menu to be pretty limited, and wished I had gotten to eat lunch vs. breakfast. I think I'll give them some time to work out the kinks before I venture back.

yC9IWWxiiM0e5I4lxmHL1A.text: Awesome, fantastic service, wonderful food and amazing ambiance.  Always have a great time!

iJNHTkVGNyIxkV9p7JqNKw.text: I've only been here a couple times at night when it was slow. The other times I've thought about going, the place looked like a zoo... not my thing. Anyhow, the bartenders seem to know what they are doing, and I have had some good drinks. The patio is nice and I think it's a good place to enjoy some evening ambiance when it's not sweltering outside.

xZGPUdSVYuvqhtu_AfDLmg.text: Ok, ok I bite my tongue. I have been here way more times than my check ins say and it has been great every time. I know I was not to sure at first but they have been good to me. The food, the service, the drinks ( Thank you Haley for the newly crowned Ebony drink lol) Seriously, great people, great drinks, great food, and great company. What more can you ask for?

j_77rqK16lr-CMYR4TSv0g.text: The food at Bliss was sub-average to straight nasty and disgusting.  Yes, nasty and disgusting; my wife ordered the Shrimp Tempura BLTA (a is for avocado) and the shrimp wasn't only not tempura but it smelled fishy and quiet unpleasing. There was hardly any batter on the shrimp and it was soft and squishy not crispy or crunchy. Very unpleasing and my wife almost vomited after the first bite. I could of made this sandwich at home with ingredients from the grocery store.   I ordered the Chicken Fried Steak and it was actually edible just not very good. I would rate it a 5 out of 10. It was suppose to come to with a chorizo and jalapeno gravy that didn't taste like chorizo or jalapenos just fattyness.   The only good thing was the parmesan and rosemary fries, however we ordered a second round of fries and they overcooked them.   The server was great we expressed our concerns and he comped the shrimp tempura and the fries. He wanted us to come back but I don't think I could ever return.  This Mexican left hungry this day.

9qS30h1rKPhnAz0HfQGw8g.text: service was good.  The server came and did his thing, the drinks were topped off all night, food was super tasty. I had the buffalo chicken wrap and loved it.  My buddy wouldn't even let me try his grilled chicken sandwich, partly because he is a fatass, partly because he said it was so delicious.  Great prices, great atmosphere.

BdFpZs2tpZwCLgPOL9MsNw.text: Really fun place to eat and have a couple drinks.  The whole set up bar and restaurant is really cool.  I usually end up in the garage (?)  which is awesome.  The Mac and Cheese is amazing.  The service was very friendly.  Great place to go when your checking out First Fridays too.

TTbD00HcfdDvuYEyZgeoww.text: There are...things to discuss about this place. Let's tackle a review, huh? Whaddyasay......  Bliss/ReBar? You are a wizard. And you put my friends under a spell. I say this because you have mesmerized them into thinking that this is the only place downtown to eat or drink. They want to go there. All. The F*cking. Time. All the time. And I can't keep up. I'm not affected by your Jedi mind tricks...or your Hogwart's spells....or your One Ring to Rule Them All....so it leaves me sitting home, having just recieved my umpteenth text from a beloved friend which reads "At REBAR!! Get your ass over here! Hurry!" and just sighing and maybe shedding one tear and deciding not to go. And then spending a night in...reading a good novel. Like Dorothy Zbornak. I just can't go as much as they do.  What did you do to my friends? And why?  Let's get something out in the open....you can't give a restaurant a 5-star review based on cheese nachos. You just can't. Please find the nearest Yelp Exit and use it...because you're taking up modem time.   also.....this place has been open for just over 6 MONTHS. Quit bitching that it was "dead on a weeknight". It's a new restaurant! In a shitty economy! It takes time! Be grateful you have extra $$ to go out to dinner with! BREATHE and give it a chance. They are finding their crowd (outside of my wizard enchanted friends, that is). Don't take it out on the establishment because you got your roots done and there's nobody at the restaurant to notice. That's not the restaurant's problem.  THE FOOD: Gotta tell ya'....while I think their food is 'OK', I'm actually shocked that the gays have made this their new home away from homo. There's a noticeable amount of fried items on the menu, and it seems out of character for the gays to build a hive around a place that serves that kind of food. I think the coconut chicken tenders are nice....but they're nothing without the sauce. The salads are good (have had the Cobb and something else I can't remember the name of) and they were decent, but they weren't mixed: they were piles of 'salad ingredients', so if you're picky, asked the kitchen to pre-toss your salad (HEY now...). Really like the chicken lettuce wraps. They're a nice alternative to chicken fingers. Have also had the macaroni and cheese. Found it very tasteful, but I do agree that it's overpriced and am not sure what the "and more" means, either.  THE SERVICE: I've had some slow experiences, but no 'bad' experiences. I do NOT envy having the burden of staffing a new restaurant. It would be a daunting experience - especially in Phoenix. There is a lot of incredibly mediocre service in Phoenix. It is hard....HARD, folks, to find good restaurant staff here. It's shocking, and I don't know the answer. I think some of the staff at Bliss/ReBar needs to get a little more fire under their ass and quit worrying about looking pretty to everyone, but I wouldn't say anyone is outright bad.  The bartenders DEFINITELY all have different pours. Some drinks come out like water, while others actually taste like they contain more than an eyedropper amount of alcohol. Quit being stingy with your pours!! It's a BAR! It's REBAR, to be more specific! And a large portion of your clientele is GAY. Give them strong drinks! They bear the burdens of an oppressive society! They can't get married legally! Intoxicate them and they will be loyal scouts to your establishment. Do this instead of cheating by using wizard power to trick them. Trust me on this.  THE CROWD: Since this establishment has one heck of a marketing team, they get a lot of exposure. This place has been coined "The NEW Place to be Gay". I'm not sure what that means. Or what the old place was. Or that we had to 'go' someplace to be gay (The Mormons and Baptists just informed me that the 'someplace' is called hell.). Is it like showing up at a party and announcing "HEY EVERYONE! I brought GAY! Anybody up for a few rounds?". I digress...  anyway...  it's unfortunately the Amsterdam crowd. Often. Young twinks with a lot of hair product and darting eyes. But on the other hand, you can usually find local actors in 'post rehearsal' or 'post performance' mode there, so that's kinda nice, I guess. But it is a lot of the same people.... all under the same wizard spell. Petrificus Totallus.  So yeah - it's nice that this place has had it's 3rd or 4th reincarnation and that it's going nicely. This location has been a veritable k-hole of business ventures that crashed and burned. Hopefully it'll last. But is it worth going every night? Nope. Does it really warrant a listing as one of Phoenix Magazine's top restaurants? Hmmmmm....not sure on this one. They will need to raise the bar on their menu items to convince me of that.   So until the evil gay wizards decide to release my friends from their evil spell, I guess I won't be seeing them very often. This makes me sad.

U9103JZTII_5zOgYa9ARCQ.text: We went to Bliss for dinner and Rebar for drinks last night.  Really great experience.  The dinner was excellent; I asked if a couple of changes could be done to one of the menu items and they were more than accommodating and our server, Johnny, was exceptional!  I will ask for him the next time we go.  The drinks at Rebar were prepared well and again, the service was fantastic.  Bottom line:  food quality superior, drink/drink menu very good, views are great and the service was exceptionally good.  We went via light rail and while it's not right on the line, it's not a bad walk - maybe 5 minutes from the Roosevelt stop.  The indoors seemed a little like a pizza joint but the patio for both restaurant and bar are the best.  Enjoy!...

H_tfB6p_4x5QJn-jeSTcqw.text: I was first introduced to Bliss/Rebar in the winter of 2011 on a First Friday night. I instantly fell in love with the atmosphere and cool vibe, the bar patrons are an array of different mixes, cultures and backgrounds, I loved this place. Well imagine my surprise when the next day my friend takes me to weekend brunch. $10 bottles of mimosas? Yes please! I came to Bliss for brunch for the entire first half of 2012, I loved this place. The service was excellent, the wait staff was incredibly attentive and helpful, and the food and drink specials were like no others. Many a times my friends tried to persuade me to go to FEZ or Switchbar, but no I was faithful to Bliss. This all changed until one day I wanted to impress my lovely LA based friend. That's when the universe decided to teach me a lesson in humility. We arrive at Bliss on a Sunday morning; I went to the host/hostess table, empty. Not a big deal, really not a big deal. Someone who appeared to be a patron stood up from his table to inform me the host would be there shortly. I thanked him and waited. The host arrived, took my name and let me know there was a 20 minute wait. Perfect, we made our way to the bar. The bar atmosphere was great, they had tv's playing the college basketball games, the music was loud enough but not too loud. The service from our bartender was excellent. We see people at the bar ordering food and receiving their food very quickly, we were amazed how fast the food was coming out. We were then informed our table was ready, and to be honest we were a little bummed to be leaving the bar area, especially since we could have ordered our food there. Regardless, we took our table and waited for our server to come. And waited. And waited. And waited. After about a 20 minute wait, I know what you are thinking and I would love to tell you that yes I am exaggerating the time but I am not; I went to ask the host when our server would be with us, he then asked me who our server was, "uh I'm not sure, they haven't come around" was my honest reply, unfazed the host told me he would get someone right away. I would love to say they were extremely busy; I would love to say perhaps they didn't see us; I would love to say we were a drunken mess; I would love to say we were dressed in rags. But no, they were no busier than other brunch places midday, there were about 4 servers on the floor and we were right in the middle of the restaurant, right in the middle, we were not drunk and I'd like to think we were dressed nicely. About 5 minutes later, someone does come around, not a server, but another host. Whatever, he's nice enough and takes our order. So we sit and wait for our food. And waited. And waited. And waited, an additional 30 minutes. Did I mention the two hot guys behind us got their meal before us? Oh yeah, well they did. At that moment I wished I was a hot guy, but no I was just a mildly attractive late 20's female who was starving. We finally get our food. The nice host who took our order comes around and asks if we are doing ok, and I hate to be that table. But we were that table. We asked to see the manager. The manager was very apologetic, and he did take our meal off the bill. Unfortunately this is not what I had set out to get accomplished that morning. I had wanted to show my friend a good time in my city, at the places I patronize, eventually I did when we went to good ol' Charlie's, but that's not the point. Not only was our service terrible and lackadaisical, I asked to switch my bacon for turkey sausage and was given bacon, when the manager came out he informed us it was because they do not have sausage at the restaurant, our server/host did not inform us about that. I do not blame him as he was simply covering for someone else, but this is a perfect example of what may happen when you have a host do the wait staff's job. I don't know what happened at Bliss this time and why the service was horrible, perhaps it was a fluke, but to be honest I have never been treated with such disregard I will not be going back to see if indeed it was a fluke. If the restaurant and servers were busy it would have been only courteous for someone to have told us so, rather than have us wait without an explanation, or an offer of water. I'm glad to see other people have had better experiences; I was once a part of the majority as well. I really hope this is not a sign of things to come at Bliss.

21PgObYARwDigbBz2byN8g.text: Awesome food, great atmosphere, best patio in Phoenix.  We've already been back a couple times.  And you've NEVER had mac n' cheese like this!  Yummers!

tQh-0lTKSCFP1o9LCsTgEQ.text: It was empty when I went.  Just flew into Phoenix and wanted a late meal (at some place that was still serving food).  I ordered the coconut chicken tenders and fries.  Amazing and creative!  I'd definitely go back.

GeOt1IeE4tKCwMEyo5ZUKQ.text: We made a visit to Bliss ReBAR on the draw in of $3 cocktails but decided to stay for dinner as well.  The place has a very nice interior and a friendly staff.  The cocktails were fine but the food here needs help.  I had the $9 burger with the $2 add on for a handful of the thinest fries I have ever seen.  They don't hold up very well in a place that won't turn on the heat and by your second bite they are cold and greasy.  The fixins for the burger are great!  Pretzel bun, fresh produce are both very nice.  The burger, I was told by the bartender to be a 1/2 pound came out the size of a childs portion burger, very thin and covered up by the bun.  The kitchen really needs to work on this staple of any bar.  My wife had the grilled cheese that came out nice but with no heat in the place the second half went cold and therefore uneaten.  May repeat but only for the drink specials and then go someplace else for food.

-9wUWyQQy2yYeutnG428Bw.text: went to dinner last night with some friends and absolutely loved the food.  had the coconut chicken tenders and the beef and chicken soft tacos which were all delicious.  the chicken lettuce wraps were amazing.  i love they also have a "naked" drink menu for those that enjoy cocktails with less calories/sugar....awsome idea!  the naked margarita was actually better than i expected.  great atmosphere, wish music outside was a bit louder or "loungy".  inside bar could use some trendy plush seating areas like switch.  overall, great new place for downtown.

O6-5dA0dYS4rqyRAFVn6wQ.text: Cool, trendy, hip, artsy little place in the art walk district. I like the food here although I wish they would tweak up their food just a bit to bring up a couple more notches. The bar area is awesome as is the outdoor bar. A place I like to got a few times a month.

ibid7vFlM8stQQNYsHjHJQ.text: one year after my first dismal review, i'm happy to say that i like my neighbor quite a bit more now. i'm glad i did not give up on bliss/rebar. the mac & cheese is decadent! add bacon & it's pure debauchery at it's finest. i still love their burger & fries too as well as happy hour. and sunday brunch on the paito with mimosas...ooh la la! i'm glad i can recommend bliss in good conscience now.

YB1wDPs6uZK85GIH3_PA2Q.text: Well..... Just got done with New Year's day brunch here, and it was such a horrible experience I felt compelled to write a review. I've only been to reBAR for drinks and my friends said the food was great so I was looking forward to it today. Apparently Bliss wasn't prepared for the brunch crowd this morning? We got there at the time they were supposed to open and they were running around like chickens with their heads cut off even though there weren't many customers there yet. When we were seated the restaurant was less than half full and they were acting like it was the biggest group they've ever had to deal with. They never took our drink orders before they asked what we wanted to eat. The servers kept switching, the busers acted offended when you asked them for anything (like condiments), it took forever to order, and most of the food was doused in pepper which bothered nearly everyone in our party of 6. I didn't really care for my sandwich, even though the menu stated their pretzel bread was "famous,"  I didn't find it very tasty at all. Add on the obligatory 20% tip for the size of our party and I left super disappointed.

U0wLQstIbKxojICgrXSzGw.text: I've already been here 3 times since they opened so I GET the initial "getting the bugs out."  I have to say however, that each time has been better than the last. I was here for First Friday this past weekend. That can alway be a nightmare for any restaurant---especially a new one. We went to the inside bar first while we waited for the rest of our party. The male and female bartenders were not only GREAT to look at, but were so friendly, relaxed and cordial---and made really great drinks. Just that part of the evening was fun. After everyone arrived and got situated, we were given a table outside. It was such a beautiful night and the downtown vibe and views were magnificent. The place has a fairly casual menu but everyone loved what they got, even "Mr. Picky." We were there until about 9, which was almost 3 hrs and I could've stayed for another but felt guilty bcz there was a line to get in.........honestly can't wait to go back!

xkyJGZwDB9yDTusdj6BHtw.text: With a fresh coat of contemporary, Bliss attempts to fill the pews of my former favorite, Fate. Well Johnny, I preferred Fate to Sens, and I prefer most anything over my first dinner tonight at Bliss. With a concise menu of mostly comfort food, I tried the nachos, and my partner the Mac & cheese. Our food arrived within minutes, which was a plus. I confess that nachos are my go-to guilty fave, as fried tortilla strips and cheese are a delicious combo and hard to turd-up. Unfortunately, I am hard pressed to remember worse nachos. The chips were odd, more like wonton triangles. The white cheese on the nachos was the same cheese on my partner's Mac & cheese -- a bland pale cheese bechamel. The Mac was okay, nothing that competes with Mrs. White or Cheuvronts. I finished less than half of my nachos, and the waitress didn't blink an eye as she removed it after I placed my visa card next to the dish signaling my surrender.

LLOpYAGgBGRWV99WTWXcZA.text: Low class service, nobody to seat you, all the workers are doing their own thing and not worrying about the customers.  The restrooms are dirty and smell nasty.  The bartenders don't say hi or thank you for coming to their lonely bar.  By the way they don't even say hi, plus their bar smells awful too, like something spoils!

photos.caption: Photo of Bliss Rebar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Got it!

PyG_DUPFlcVKgHurSLMdjQ.text: Will never eat there again. We sat waiting for our food for over 40 minuets until we decided to leave.  All we ordered was a wrap,  street tacos, and a bowl of fruit.  Was that to much of an order that we couldn't get it? Watching people eat that had arrived after us was ridiculous. The waitress said there wasn't anything she could have done. So after getting the wrong food at that 40 min mark,  we left.

1VoQXkSP9tq-q7Cey4Kdgg.text: I've had a 4-star and a 3-star experience here.  The first time I went here, it was amazing. I sat outside and had a wonderful waiter. The kind where they actually had an opinion about the menu. I dined on quinoa and lentil salad, shrimp and grits, and a brownie sunday. It was fantastic and I told all my co-workers about it. However, the second time was a completely different experience. The waitress didn't have a clue about anything and didn't bring out the correct orders. We ate inside finished and left in a hurry and the food was just okay.  Amazing how different an experience the same person can half. I'm going to give it another try and see if the needle moves back up. Sure hope it does!

photos.caption: Photo of Bliss Rebar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Shrimp and grits
Photo of Bliss Rebar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Lentil and quinoa salad

MyrQmKjlJQ1pvI9a8YpAiw.text: Love this place for Sunday Brunch/Sunday Funday.  10$ bottles of champs. The atmosphere is really cool and i love the staff.  The food is also really good. If you bring back the good hollandaise ill make this 5 stars! I might be a regular

Tlj-DfLQFlgnS-h8zl8GHw.text: Not good on music. Scenery and Monday happy hour is the only reason to come.  Thanks to Anthony (who made 1 drink really well to only have it spill all over his hands, then made a shity drink to have it spill all over his hands again) I will never come to this shit hole again.

euUkfvW06yiiVMPk0_WMhQ.text: We didn't realize this would be such a long walk from the convention center in the 100* heat but it was worth it.  It was evening and the streets were pretty empty, even for a Saturday night.  When we arrived it was very cute with outdoor areas and the house is divided.  Walk to the left for the restaurant and to the right for the bar.  My husband and I went into the bar and sat at a table for 2.  We were to late for any kind of happy hour but their Saturday drinks special is a cherry vodka with lime drink for $3.  It wasn't bad and I enjoyed 3 of them.  My husband got the street tacos to eat and I had the pretzel bread with dips.  I enjoyed the queso much more than the alfredo.  The best part was the ambiance and I would like to go back some day.

RahAGr0jUc4FXSL1ZwgTHw.text: Wildcat Chick'wich  is the greatest !! If you like blue cheese and apple slaw don't pass this up!

photos.caption: Photo of Bliss Rebar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Make your own mimosas, $10 bottles with juices included

UsBQAy7WWQGeHl7MCuy5Hg.text: Bliss Rebar is your friendly neighborhood bar and restaurant. Has an amazing outdoor patio, with lots of shade and nice seating arrangements. I come here not as often but as often to be a regular! I've definitely had their delicious nachos, on HH and they also have daily specials throughout the week. But this review is mainly about my experience during brunch which was superb! I love the customer service from our waitress/ bartender she was delightful. This place is also lgbt friendly If you haven't noticed when you walk in! So at brunch which they have Saturday and Sunday, they do a 10$ bottle of champagne special which is would match better than your 4 dollar mimosa. I also ordered the OLala French toast which I thought was gonna be ok? But ended up being so delicious who knew pretzel bread would make something yummy! I also added 2 over easy eggs to make a breakfast complete meal. I definitely will come back and recommend if you wanna try something new and fun or actually in the area to stop by! And leave satisfied! Stay hungry Phoenix!

photos.caption: Photo of Bliss Rebar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. OLALA FRENCH TOAST WITH OVER EASY EGG.

GBxgx4G-eisv30TpMQU0KQ.text: I said I wont come here again, but I am back. Not because I wanted to, but friends wanted to go there for the food. apparently they have good food. I got the grilled eggplant sandwich which had goat cream cheese, tomato jam and seasonal greens on their famous pretzel bun. Ah the pretzel bun is outta this world. (Check the pic) The 3 stars are for the bun, the grilled eggplant sandwich was meh, the sandwich was bland and moist. I believe they can make it better, but hey the pretzel bun is all you need to go there, or NOT.  I asked the waiter for a Hot toddy, he said he doesnt have it, I asked for a moscow mule, he said he doesnt have it either and no gingery stuff, but he said he will make me something 'similar' with whiskey rye and he got it out and there was practically less than a quarter in whiskey glass and charged me $8 for it and it tasted nothing like anything he said, just saying!   guess I am coming back for the pretzel bun.

photos.caption: Photo of Bliss Rebar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Grilled eggplant with pretzel bun

TELIqTg1-OsVT7336Nf2Og.text: The place is simply beautiful. The venue spans two buildings. The North building is Bliss (restaurant) and to the south is ReBar (the bar). You can go back and froth between the two venues (with your drinks in hand). And you can't beat the view of Downtown from their circular bar that is outside. There is also a beautiful full bar in the building to the South.    We were served some samples of the Coconut Chicken and Sausage Ravioli and they were freakin great (at the "VIP" pre-view event we got invited to). But I can't speak to anything else on the menu.  The menu looks Damn good. And although the prices aren't cheap they do look fairly reasonable. Certainly better then what was here previously (FATE). The drink prices also seem reasonable ($4 for bottled beer and $5 for most draft).  The hamburgers buns are made of pretzel dough and they also have Mac & Cheese (with Chicken and Bacon) both of which I'm dying to try.
