And the best of all, the place is 3 blocks from our house so I'm very excited to try the full menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Bliss Rebar - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Bliss Rebar - Phoenix, AZ, United States

CHYZfEpLpOOA6vdxV7dcnw.text: Solid value, cool vibe...just beware of the mosquito during the 5-6pm period!  Good stuff,

bUcDsdneS5oCCPMyE1PFLg.text: Staff and food are equally amazing! Definitely order the Steakhouse Burger! It was delicious. Anthony was a wonderful Bartender and Server. If your a drinker you must try their Q-Cumber Martini. It's both refreshing and delightful. If that's not what you like, make sure to ask the bartender to whip you up something special. They are great at making me shots and mixed drinks.

photos.caption: Photo of Bliss Rebar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Rebar

TWMd7tg5CIAVZs82waAenA.text: Got there Friday, 11/25/2016: 5-6pm.  Service sucked. The male staff walked around getting ready for the night's party but neglected people sitting in the patio.  There was a table of two ladies sitting right next to us and the Latino server attended to them but NEVER once looked over at us. We were seated at the next table. I had to walk into the restaurant to put my order for food and drinks.  I usually enjoy this place for happy hour but today wasn't happy at all.  The whole time we sat there NO ONE except the food runner was helpful.  Great place ONLY if they give you basic service but today they failed.  Will I go back.... yes but next time I'll sit at the bar because there the staff have to look at you....  NOTE to the OWNER: Please look at the security footage and you'll see us being ignored but everyone.... Receipt Invoice: 600135 T: 689079.

ll447uTJlJZRagC8v_Id7w.text: I've been here a few times. Happy Hour and other specials are amazing, bartenders and servers are amazing. Drinks are great. Food is hit or miss. I really enjoy the nachos, the cheese sauce is delicious, but my breakfast tacos left a little to be desired. Not bad by any means, just not my favorite. Portion was very generous though. The atmosphere and staff are great though, so I'll always come back.

HgR4Gi_yvUiHjv-4iUv-ug.text: What an awesome outdoor space. Friendly staff and a great happy hour selection. I think this is our new after work hangout place. We ordered a bunch of apps and drinks and everything was very good.

rWUr3lIXfK1urKSExUCZFw.text: We are here on a Friday night celebrating my sister's birthday. I must admit that I was a little concerned walking up to the restaurant. We arrived at about 8pm and had to park down the street. The surrounding area looked a bit seedy. However, the crowd made me feel very comfortable. The service started out a little slow. It took about 20 minutes before we received water. That was quite disappointing. Fortunately, everything picked from here.  I ordered the nachos with chicken. Trust me, you've never had nachos like these! The chips were flour tortilla chips, the cheese was a white queso style but better and the chicken was in chunks and bursting with flavor! These were not the traditional nachos by far. These were nachos on an entirely different level. I must say they were the best I've ever had!  I tried the Strawberries and Champagne drink first. It had a strawberry vodka and champagne. It was quite tasty. I tried the cream sickle drink special. I was pleasantly surprised! Our server was Mike, he was very friendly and attentive. Our entire party Absolutely Loved our food and drinks! I'd recommend Bliss ReBar to anyone trying to enjoy great food and atmosphere !

photos.caption: Photo of Bliss Rebar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Strawberries and Champagne
Photo of Bliss Rebar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken Nachos

g2gUCM1liVSlP0Ic2KnZVA.text: Bliss ReBAR's website spins you off to "Delivery Dine" to place your order. which I would guess means they sponsor and take ownership for the quality of delivered food:  $7.00 Bliss Brownie  A La Mode $12.50 Steakhouse Burger* $0.00 Medium $2.00 Sea Salt & Vinegar Shoestring Fries $8.50 Romaine Wraps (Veggie) $9.00 Coconut Chicken Tenders  The brownie was great but that's where it ended.  EVERYTHING was cold upon delivery.   I got an email from "Delivery Dine" at 6:49pm saying my food was picked up and on they way. The guy got lost and finally delivered at 7:25pm. I live only 9 blocks away!  The guy delivering was on foot and got confused, calling me asking how to get into the building from a completely incorrect address???  -Salt and vinegar fries were NOT salt and vinegar. They were regular, cold fries. -Romaine Wraps were disgusting. They were packaged in a plastic box pre-assembled. The romaine was limp and soggy and it all had a half inch of water (juice) in it (and cold). They should have packaged the romaine separately so one could actually make a wrap rather than a gooey, soggy, gross mess.  -Coconut Chicken was much like last time I tried them. Tiny, over cooked and dry (and cold). -The burger, other than being cold and soggy was fine.   After my previous review I received an email from the manger apologizing and that he' get a handle on quality. That hasn't happened.   I wouldn't recommend and definitely NOT delivery.

edArhiHYq-mkK858SsAI3g.text: The service was quick and friendly even on a busy Saturday night. The Mac n Cheese was everything the reviews said it would be! As someone who travels in/out of PHX I will be booking marking Bliss as a go to.

6strnC9Yuhz4wkTSxMjJKg.text: First thing first: Get over your fear of carbs and calories and try the mac and cheese. Don't worry about adding meat or veggies to it, the thick cheese is perfect as it is. The grilled cheese is also great, so anything with carbs and cheese will make you happy.   Although the staff often forgets what the specials are, there is ALWAYS a cheap drink-of-the-day, and usually another deal as well (20% off all food, happy hours, etc.). They are also constantly supporting some kind of charity, so check out their website/facebook or the posters in the bathrooms to see what might be going on.  Because the majority of their seating is outdoor, the warmer months are rather quiet in the restaurant. The staff is always pretty outgoing, so even a slow day offers a good time.  A few imperfections: if you ask for a meal substitution, check your food before eating it. I've found meat in my food in MANY occasions, despite requests to make it vegetarian (usually at brunch). Also, the restaurant side and the bar side play different music at the same time. When you are outside the restaurant, you can usually hear both songs at the same time. Oh well.  I've probably visited Bliss ReBar over 50 times. If I still lived in Phoenix, I'd likely be there this weekend.

g32LN8DV-MhOqjMl1_ZRFQ.text: The food and drinks here were okay, noting great but up to par. The service however, was terrible. The waiters kept forgetting our orders, and refill requests and kept blaming it on the other workers that were working. No one accepting responsibility for there mistakes and poor service. They will also force a gratuity factor on your bill, probably a tactic when they know they will not be receiving a tip due to their painfully obvious poor service. Never returning, and would not recommend this place to anyone.

3WWns42AHjzvd2zrfNqm6Q.text: I only had a beer here but the outside bar was very cool.  Concrete bar with rebar bent over it to look like a palm tree awning.  It was cool place for people watching, located on a fairly busy corner.  I didn't get to sample the food but the bartender was cool.  The crowd was super sparse for 11:30 on a Saturday, though. Still, I'll definitely go back here in the future.

MQQOjvje6Xlzd_GojweJjg.text: This review is strictly for reBAR, because I did not eat at Bliss. I very rarely give out one star ratings, but I very rarely get terrible service.   I came in on a busy Friday night with two other people, and I went to the inside bar to get a drink while they went to the bathroom. As a side note - the bathroom is in a really weird location, so the line extends out to where people are sitting at tables.  I stood at the front of the bar and ended up waiting for service for 10-15 minutes, which is completely understandable, except for the fact that I was watching everyone get served except me. I was beginning to think that it was me, since I was watching people left and right get cycled out at the bar. I finally got the courage to raise my hand and ask for three beers. The bartender, very rudely, snapped at me saying, "you will wait your turn" I understand that the bar was busy, but even the guy next to me commented on how long I had been standing there. After that, I left and went to the bar outside. The bartender promptly served me immediately upon arriving and even bought one of my beers to make up for the bad service.  I never send food back, I'm a good tipper, and I'm friendly to servers. I am NEVER a rude customer, so I was extremely disgusted with my treatment. I will never be back.

tTCuPKV2O7RmU7sMKsWXWQ.text: So if your looking for a nice quiet spot to have a drink or two or three on the outskirts of downtown, this is an okay place.  On 1st Friday's there is an eclectic crowd. The only thing I have ordered from the food menu is wings. They were great, but just a little to hot for me.

Z3fPl4FcJNbuEg1RJNBmoQ.text: I went to Bliss/Rebar for brunch on Sunday and it wasnt very busy at all which was nice to get us in without having to wait.  It was my 3rd time eating at this place and while it is getting better I am not sure it is where it needs to be.  This place is super close to my house but I always over look it because I am just not impressed with the food and sometimes the service.  This time we had a pretty chill waiter.  They had a daily special that I wanted to get without one of the ingredients and was told they couldnt do it, which was fine so I had to pick something else.  When we came to deliver our food, which seemed like it took a long time, he had asked the chef to make the special without the ingredient I didnt want which I thought was pretty cool.  Another thing that they have to remember is that the kitchen area is open for the customers to see.  There were several times that I would glance over and see the chef "smell" ingredients which made to feel that things may not be super fresh at this establishment.  I dont know if I will go back to this place to food but their outside areas are nice and should be packed when the weather is nicer.

qq-WVnoAwe4lZoCDwCWcWg.text: All I can say is pretzel bun....and mac n cheese! SO FREAKIN  YUMMY!!!! Bliss's pretzel bun is made daily by a local bakery downtown, this incredible bun is put on their famous burger and chicken sandwich which are sooooo tasty! A homemade cheese sauce is  put on these sandwiches, which is a great touch. The mac n cheese is one of the best in town, and has taken over my previous favorite, Chelseas kitchen. I am proud to say I am  a french fry whore, and their skinny parmesan fries do it for me every time!  I have almost been through the whole menu including brunch.  For being a new restaurant the staff is doing a great job, the kitchen is so small, I have no idea how the chef's move around! But they make it happen and the food has been consistent every time.   The bar is also way cute and the drinks are poured nicely! Even when it is happy hour you wont get skimpy drinks here darling!  The owners are great guys who are at the restaurant on a a regular.I hope you try BlissRebar and enjoy your time as much as I have, because  I definitely have experienced Bliss:)

jp4u-YuizUDJm16nS4oiuA.text: Came here around 8:00 last night to graze and drink. I love, love, love the outdoor seating. A great place to meet friends and away the hours in central Phoenix. I am a huge fan of the low-sugar mixed drinks menu: I had a conconction with muddled raspberries that was tart and just the right sweetness, yet not at all short on the booze.  Service was excellent throughout the night.  I wanted to like the food, but was definitely not blown away. A friend and I shared the parmesan shoestring fries--good crispness, just fine. Passing on the signature mac and cheese, I ordered the grilled chicken sandwich, my friend the lettuce wraps. Interestingly, the wraps came with Napa cabbage leaves instead of lettuce, which was okay as a substitute until the leaves started to soften. The filling was a tad too sweet for our tastes, but we appreciated the addition of walnuts. The chicken sandwich was good--not certain about the texture of the stone-ground mustard used (too seedy for some, I think), and adding Sriracha definitely toned down any sweetness in the sauce.  The seasonal apple cobbler was partially burnt on one edge, but was fresh-tasting and serviceable.  I will be back!

bYszgwekDzEawaOMaWCIgw.text: We didn't know this was a Gay bar when we went. To be very honest with you, it was irrelevant after we started partying. What a great crowd!  This is an alternative lifestyle bar that is very couples friendly. Will definately go back. The food I would say was average to slightly above average also.  Very good drink specials also.

naVOwXmhCjqtSuiyLDHamw.text: Not done reBAR but have been to Bliss several time for lunch.    I am addicted to the shrimp taco's and every that has come with me has loved their meal be it a sandwich or the mac and cheese.  Service is great and I love the atmosphere.  In an odd location so I hope it survives.

Hj-O7ZsvGIyIRPaUFnQ8tQ.text: I believe I found this place via those weekly Yelp specials that get sent out each Wednesday. The BF and I decided to go check it out and found a neat little restaurant/bar, located in downtown. The decor was cool, the place quiet, and the service attentive.  We've been there twice now. Both times, I've gotten the loaded mac and cheese, which is everything a great mac and cheese should be. Rich, creamy, sprinkled with slices of smokey, chewy bacon and moist chicken.   The first time the BF got the pork loin, which was great. If I remember right, the side was these silky mashed potatoes that were heaven, and some vegetables that were buttery and well done. The 2nd time we were there he got the crab cakes (mostly at my enthusiastic urging), which was a special on Valentine's day. I thought it was good, but he's a little harder to impress. I think it didn't blow him out of the water.   We also got the red velvet cake. it was a nice spin on the classic dessert, as it had candied orange peel and some orange in the cake and frosting as well. The peach cobbler is to DIE for, please do get that. Both desserts have been very enjoyable, to say the least.   I only have two quibbles: the drinks have only always been so-so for me. The first time I got one of their 'skinny' drinks, and that was a rather bland letdown. The 2nd time I got their grapefruit cocktail, and it was too bitter for me to drink down. I hate sending drinks and food back, so I stuck some splenda in it and chugged it down. I admit that half the problem was likely me picking the wrong drinks, but it was still rather disappointing.   Also, the 2nd time we went, our server was clearly rather new. We only knew to ask about the red velvet because we heard another server tell the couple next to us about it.  Overall, pretty decent food, good desserts, the drinks are a little hit or miss. Definitely worth a shot!

dXN6Lns5hq1Q5-VWZqYM_Q.text: My fiance and I went here for dinner and loved it! I had the 4th St tacos and she had the black bean burger. Tacos were tangy with the right amount of kick. The setting was great and we really enjoyed all the metal sculptures. The rebar outdoor bar may be the most unique bar in PHX. Service was great and prices were reasonable. We'll go back and try their brunch next time.

7wM8QL7yduyg26GLgQBA9w.text: Cool place for eats and drinks. Small but has good atmosphere. Service and food options are great.  Robert Pfeifer

UnXywxxiVGxDV8-29tIjDg.text: Bullet point review....and GO!  -Two older homes modified, with one as the restaurant (Bliss) and the other as the bar (guess!)  -Fomerly "Fade" from my understanding, but I never dined there and have no reference for comparison  -Architecture and design is very cool, melding old and new  -Service was excellent, food decent.  Good beer on tap (good beer on tap is always worth at least half a star!)  -Diverse crowd and a cool vibe.  Nice changeup from the 'dale.  -Make sure to add it to your list for and light rail pub crawl on Central as it's worth walking a few blocks!  ...and DONE!

Q7a3_IHscKbep0ZiPWCx_A.text: I went back here before the Yelp party to use up my stupid happy hour coupons that had been sitting in my wallet since August.  And, I still don't love it.  The cocktails tasted pretty cheap.   The french fries are better now!! Thin, and crispy and delicious.  Sadly, I don't think a restaurant can survive on fries alone (except for maybe Delux).

9wuohmR4SjVpjal5SQ1y7Q.text: I chose to come to Bliss/reBar because of its' fun energy and decent food.  Tonight was a special night, "Dining Out For life" and I wanted to support the cause. Upon arriving, I waited at the bar for a table.  I had only one drink before I realized the bartender could give a crap if I was there or not.  Seems he was more interested in entertaining and acting like some sissy girl, then paying attention to his responsibilities.  Instead of waiting for him, I walked off to check my table status.  Again, I was ignored and not informed that a table was ready.  Once finally seated, service arrived but was severely lacking in substance.  Highly disappointed in this place tonight but I certainly let my presence be known to the owners.  Only time will tell if they care to step up their game and fire a few people.

UNGjk50kmjocFvl3fcrn5A.text: Went last night (9-17-11) for my first time and can't stop thinking about how impressed I am with both the service and the food.   A super cool concept, atmosphere and menu. Our waiter (Kevin, who is actually one of the 3 owners) was awesome and extremely personable. He suggested the redberry rapture for a drink and it was spectacular (and under 100 calories!) We got to talking about vodka and he spoke of a brand I had never heard before and within minutes, he brought both my hubby and I a sample of the vodka he was talking about. The gesture was great and so was the vodka!   We started with the pretzel bread. delish...especially the tomato dipping jam! I had the buffalo chicken wrap and my hubby got a 1/2 of the loaded Mac and Cheese. The buffalo wrap was really good and the Mac and Cheese was hands down the best I have ever had! I am not a big meat fan so I would probably get it "naked" next time but holy cow was it good! A 1/2 order is fine for an average sized meal.   All in all, amazing experience. I loved the concept of "owners at your service"....the three owners were the waiters from 7-9pm and all of their tips went to charity. Awesome. I will be back!

36xBOVYnRhwNHqI8ajOygg.text: I was out on a date and she took me to Bliss REBAR. It was a Friday night and I wasn't really in the mood for a crowded bar scene. The ambience of the place is really nice. Not a party spot but people were definitely having a great time. I had their pomegranate martini and it was DELICIOUS. Not to strong but strong enough to taste it. It was smooth going down. The veggie mac and cheese was ok. I was told they have the best mac and cheese. I would have to disagree. They good mac and cheese... certainly not the best. I've had better. But it was good. The staff was friendly and the place was clean.

QvuopTGutqLTC-RmhK92Zw.text: I don't like the food that I've had here so far. the fries are just plain disappointing.   they play awful, terrible popular music that makes me want to slit my wrists. the music is interspersed with several-second gaps between songs, so my friend's slightly aghast exclamation ("i would *never* shave it!") echoes throughout the bar and garners our party some awkward glances.   the reason(s) i'm offering Bliss/reBAR 3 stars is b/c of the bar staff and the drink prices (at the bar, specials seem to be different on the restaurant side).  I like the bar's space, other than the echo issue (get some local art on your walls,  your neighbors will love you for it), and will return, but it would really make it easier and more enjoyable if they actually played good music.

0y2Ke3KLc8rtBi278Knzbw.text: The nachos were amazing! And so were the coconut chicken strips. The service was a 8 out of a 10 because it was a slow night and the waitress took forever and a day to bring over ranch and water. I'll go back though because the food was that good!

eY3lozfGk2nQpf1n9XWKGw.text: I first visited for Get Your PHX and now visit once a month to attend the University of Arizona College of Medicine lectures.  I love the patio when the weather cools off.  It's clearly popular with its regulars, and it's nice to see a business succeed at this location.  I do wish there were fewer fried appetizers and more items for people who don't eat fried food (out of the bar).  But then I'm a nutritionist for a living...a spectrum of choices may not be what the majority of people who keep this place in business are looking for.

oGucYc0YfFK0lQazw3bDIw.text: I am a huge fan of Bliss ReBar. Every time we go the drinks are delicious and the food is amazing. Saturday we were pub crawling downtown and made this one of our stops. We had about 15 in our party and were all ready feeling pretty good and were a little loud. The bartender gave us excellent service and laughed and talked with us all while making drinks and handling our food orders. Everyone loved their food and had a blast while we were there. Thanks Bliss ReBar for being a great place to hang out!!

WJ85R0Af71fai8larTJdSA.text: Came here for lunch with friends, we were told there would be a 30 minute wait for food. The patio is nice so we decided to stay. After waiting thirty minutes and seeing open tables around, we asked the hostess if she had an estimate on wait time. She said she was seating a party of two and we were next. We waited 20 more minutes and watched her seat a different table of four, and watched many other groups walk in and just take tables (I'm assuming they were regulars). Very disorganized, we finally got fed up and just left. The menu was so promising I was sad to miss out! I'd like to try again but I really don't want to put up with that service.

yVPVq53QpimVou1ZjZNKAA.text: Such terrible service tonight. Not only did our drinks come out after our meals,  the hostess served us more than the server, and the drinks incorrectly made.  Waters never refilled until we received our bill. So disappointing.

O_U-q459bVffCVASHv48JA.text: I think will be one of my favorite restaurants in PHX.  Not only are their drinks and food are , but the atmosphere of this place is just great! We had the sliders that were more like sloppy joe's and some hummus to start with. I remember having this cranberry and vodka-ish drink for $3 and it was heavenly!

photos.caption: Photo of Bliss Rebar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. On our way in, this caught our attention

cGBUKf2FMctzmweEqQlO3g.text: Quick stop in for a drink and run. Cool place, cool vibe. Good drinks.

DDP13XwGEPHP8pEo4zIfgA.text: I have try this place again today Sunday night and the service was much better. Getting served by the GM awesome service and food.

LC6FiF4dURji63u_xsUbRw.text: Had Cheese Burger Sliders on Pretzel Buns with Sea Salt & Vinegar Shoestring Fries. Delicious. Others in my party had Macaroni and Cheese and the Cheese Sandwich Burger, which is a hamburger patty and fixins between two grilled cheese sandwiches, both yummy. We there a little later in the evening so it was a small crowd. Will definitely return. Located at 4th St and Garfield I'll definitely be back to check out some menu items and some other local venues within walking distance. Hear tell there's a little spot that plays live music a block away!

0Y4fqRyOfrhalx7vb1DQsg.text: A couple of my coworkers and I were looking for a place to have lunch yesterday. I had been to Bliss Rebar before and really enjoyed, so suggested it. After they looked at the menu online, they decided it looked good and that they wanted to try it.   We decided to start with the pretzel bread and cheese sauce. I was expecting the bread and/or the cheese to cons out warm, but they both came out cold. It was still delicious, but there was not enough pretzel bread for the amount of cheese that came with. Therefore, we asked if we could get somewhere pretzel bread and our server Shawn said of course. He asked if we wanted more cheese too, but we said no thank you, we just need the bread for the rest of the cheese. To our surprise, when we received our bill, Shawn had charged is another $5.00 for the extra pretzel bread. The whole appetizer was $5.00, so I found this to be quite disappointing. I can understand a charge for the extra bread, but it shouldn't equal the cost of the actual dish. Aside from the charge, there was no mention of a charge for the extra bread when we asked for it. We should have been told at the time we asked, cause at $5, we would have said never mind.  We enjoyed our entrees. I had the nachos with braided beef. One of my coworkers had a burger and the other had a salad.

7wxYIJnvYkOkMUxGk_q7RQ.text: Wow. 4 stars? The Mac and cheese balls were decent but everything  else was poor. Soda was FLAT. Food took 30 minutes at least and was wrong cold and overcooked. Spare yourself. Tons of better places to eat.

VMWD8tnROWprVwWhEeOkJA.text: I love the chicken nachos here!  It's my favorite by far!  I think their lobster mac and cheese is pretty good too, though I'm not sure its a regular thing.  Great beer and drink selection and such a nice patio to hang out in!

7G3vF5MFI2GC5sxAIdMaxA.text: I went here last night and thoroughly enjoyed it! This bar is busy, but not crowded like the bars in Scottsdale. I had room to breathe. They were playing upbeat music, but it wasn't so loud that you couldn't have a conversation. The art in this place is interesting and the misters on the patio make it very pleasant (even when it's really hot outside). I definitely want to come try the food here, especially because they have some awesome deals during the week (5$ patty melts on Mondays...count me in!). I will be back.

R3O04YtiDGrWmNj3F5CDPg.text: The macaroni & cheese bites are TO DIE FOR, as are their chicken 4th st tacos. I highly recommend for atmosphere and people, not to mention decor and location. Our drinks were meh (very sweet, not very strong), but everything else made up for it.

L9_i5jHi92YQ4a6uxzsGsA.text: I like this place because it is different. I love to people watch over here. This business will stay fine as along as they don't raise the prices.

dcwftedRpuG1HAgbNHqG3A.text: Good luck getting food service. I sat my table, waited 15 minutes , no one showed up to take my food or drink order. I walked out. It was a Friday night; 10 o'clock, slow, not many customers. The servers seemed more interested out flaming one another.

3eaDz1RiUqD2Bh6QOXv3IQ.text: We came here on a First Friday which worried me a little bit.  Trying to get good service at a location downtown on a First Friday is like trying to get an alligator to drop it's lunch in the middle of it's barrel roll.  (You like that simile?)  Well, we got great service.  Our server was so friendly and attentive and helpful.  It was a huge change from the first time I went to this restaurant when it was called something else. I had the Boston Tea Party cocktail: vodka, lemonade, and green tea I believe.  If that's wrong, that's what it tastes like.  It was great.  I love vodka.  For dinner, I had the loaded mac and cheese.  Judge me all you want, it was worth every gram of fat and carbohydrates.  It was filled with lots of chicken and lots of bacon and lots of cheese.  After this meal, I realized how amazing life is that my taste buds have the opportunity to indulge like this.

0Vb9c6y44rBZxAgHmkRgiQ.text: Awe ... I've loved bliss for years -  came in tonight for my delicious bliss burger-  still great food but sad to see that they are nickel and dime-ing for sides of sauce, aioli, etc etc.  even a 1.00 charge for a tall cocktail.  (4 up charges on one burger and one drink) Next do i have to pay for the use of a glass?  Sorry bliss-  still love you! But would love you more if you just charged a fair rate and left it at that. Thank goodness the food is great!

_QMESD28CbSpUvcJh3y7yA.text: We ate here after our long day at the convention center for training. We were seated inside however we really wanted to sit out so our awesome waitress Hillary  hooked us up with opening up the additional outside patio. Her service started off strong and it just keep going. There were 15 of us and we couldn't have asked for better service and food. Damn I'm stuffed and drunk. Ahhhh good times.

y8SvDZFKux7tkrr-Md6TNw.text: This place has a cool urban vibe, and mixed crowd, the patio is lovely and bartender Monique is very attentive and accomodating, the menu looks good but we usually just stop by for drinks. Its the closest thing to the Abbey in Phx.

TZ20uesqybVN5WZwKbsChA.text: Bliss Rebar is definitely worth the drive from wherever you are in the metro area. Great food, drinks and service.

hpJhUqoTj7Bn-wd7MKA6oA.text: Went to #buzzcation @blissrebar. Enjoyed the evening immensely.  Sat down for some grub, had the pretzel bread, and the loaded mac-and-cheese.  The pretzel bread came with a honey-mustard sauce that was amazing, a cheese sauce that was fantastic, and a tomato jam that I didn't try because I don't like ketchup.  I have always loved the space they occupy, and think they have one of the best patios in town.  Always have a good time there, and will definitely be back.

UpfMvqA27MBLxT3KXiyfAQ.text: We love Bliss!  Please eat here so it stays open forever!!!  Maybe it's the fact that downtown Phoenix is a ghost town after 5 p.m. (unless there's a sporting event or concert) but every time we go to Bliss, which is often, there's maybe one other table seated. And we can't figure out why!    The food is wonderful.  The service is better than most places we've been to.  The specials are great (20% off Wednesdays, $3 house wine during happy hour).  The art is local. What gives?   My husband and I have been coming here for the past year.  I love their macaroni and cheese.  I order it most times we eat here. They use a combo of cheeses and I think one of them is spicy Jack because there is this heat to the cheese sauce that makes it addictive.  My husband and I fight over it.   My husband usually orders either the Buffalo chicken wrap or the barbecue chicken wrap.  He did try the Tempura Shrimp BLTA last time and it looked amazing. He was very happy. (The A stands for Avocado.)  I don't have to ask for a refill of my water here which earns Bliss 5 stars.

RY9uq1XgO9eRzk_L908r6w.text: Service was pretty slow when I went. It took a while to get drinks and food. I got the Mac and cheese which was mediocre at best. It is a neat environment though so I really liked the atmosphere. Just wished the food and the service was better.

xm7NsatW6fO6-3mdu83exg.text: Bliss/rebar has been a fantastic bar for years. The foods great and the drinks are even better. I had a great time at the outside bar,  especially because of our inventive bartender Jake who makes excellent original creations. I  never leave downtown without a drink from bliss.

J4QWQ_ZtuyieH4PDEN83Kw.text: Was volunteering at Ben's Bells right near here and decided to check it out. Thought it was so cute, both the outside area and inside area, I bet it's a cool place to go at night as well. The menu was super appealing to me, quite a few appetizing looking vegetarian meals. I was deciding between the lentil and quinoa salad or the veggie Mac n cheese. I went for the Mac n cheese and boy was that a mistake. I think this was the second time in my life I've taken a bite of something, and was so disgusted, I couldn't go in for another bite. It looked tasty too so I was sad! The cheese sauce on it is made at the restaurant, but I just didn't enjoy how it tasted. Also it seemed more like Alfredo than Mac n cheese. My mom got a black bean burger and substituted Rosemary Parmesan fries as her side and was kind enough to share with me. She also substituted the bun with pretzel bread which was awesome. The veggie burger was just a morning star southwestern patty I believe, which kind of sucks but it wasn't bad. The pretzel bun was super delicious. The fries were mediocre.  The servers weren't too attentive in that we weren't checked on much, water cup was empty for a while... However, when I pointed out that I was unhappy with my meal, my server offers to get me something else but I wasn't hungry because I had some of my moms meal. He did take it off our order too which was super nice of him and really appreciated.

photos.caption: Photo of Bliss Rebar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Veggie Mac n cheese
Photo of Bliss Rebar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Black bean burger

YZIg31ufm4Bt1ij5tjnHSA.text: First Friday was probably not the best first time to try Bliss Rebar. It was super busy and they couldn't keep up with the demand. First round of drinks took 30 minutes to get. The food was good and our waitress did her best. We will need to try it again! The Mexican Mule was very good.

I2nFPb8_2Bkqwlk3FALVCA.text: LOVE THIS PLACE! The mimosas have the perfect ratio of champagne to OJ (Yes that is important!) and they have breakfast nachos. BREAKFAST. NACHOS. They're fantastic! I used to come to this place 10 years ago and am so glad to see that it's still around! I've only been recently for brunch so I cannot speak to their happy hour or late night service (yet) but it's definitely a great brunch spot!

BTtB8Y5IUDAmdFlIhWidpQ.text: Tried out Bliss on First Friday and I will be returning! My friend and I went out this first Friday and we came here on a recommendation from another friend saying how awesome the food was. We  arrived around 7:30 and we were told by the hostess it would be about a 40 minute wait for 2 people. No big deal since we planned on getting drinks anyways. We sat at the indoor bar and it wasn't too crowed yet so we served immediately. I wanted something girly so I asked the bartender if he recommend the raspberry cosmo dreamy creamy orangesicle. He informed me that the orangesicle was on special for $4 so I went ahead and ordered that. It was way to sweet for my friends liking but I enjoyed it.   Halfway through our 2nd drink (20mins) a table had opened up for us so we headed inside. We ordered the cheesy mac balls balls to start ($10) I got the atlantic salmon (16.50) and he got the sundried pasta with chicken ($14). The cheesy mac balls came out quickly and were delicious! Glancing around at the other tables I saw that two other parties had ordered the same, I'm glad we didn't miss out. Our plates were cleared immediately and after a few minutes our dinners came out. Everything was so good! The salmon was well cooked came on a bed of spinach and red potato mash. I also tried the pasta and the sauce was great! After dinner we went back to the outdoor patio. More people started coming in from first Friday and the vibe was very friendly.   Overall I will be coming back for the high quality food and great atmosphere.

photos.caption: Photo of Bliss Rebar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Atlantic Salmon &amp; Sundried Pasta with Chicken

1EY93b4KEDpPqITKvQuyVA.text: I'll start by prefacing this in that I never got a chance to try the food. I was in town for a conference, so I can understand that most businesses around the downtown area saw a massive influx...it was also Pride weekend so that was also added to the influx of people. We had a reservation for 4 of us and were promptly seated and our waiter was prompt. Then, after ordering we waited, and waited, and waited, and ultimately got the feeling our waiter was avoiding us due to the long period of time our food was taking.   After almost an hour I gave up and asked about the progress of our order. It had not even been started. I know they were busy but come on! I needed to get back to my conference as I was a speaker so I politely engaged the food runner/expediter about cancelling my order. She was pissed and totally annoyed that I was interrupting her process. She was reluctant to cancel my order but could not guarantee that our food would be ready anytime soon. It finally took me saying, "that's fine, go ahead and make it, but it won't be paid for," and she finally chose to cancel it.   Long story short, I won't be back...even if I make it back to Phoenix, I won't even give this place another thought. If it's busy, you're better off walking to another restaurant downtown.

fofqwOtfl0Myu6dpKiWHNg.text: Stopped in with a group of folks. My first time here. The location is perfect for Phoenix. It's a very upbeat atmosphere. Beautiful people fill the joint. I had a screwdriver which was very good. My husband ordered a coffee and unfortunately, that was never brought out. The rest of the group ordered two giant drinks to share. I didn't get the name of this special drink but they are huge. They are very sweet and tasty, but could use more alcohol. Tasted like punch to me. The music is way too loud, very difficult to have a conversation without having to shout. A good start for bar hopping.

roYsFLXrsbesNBXZNthchw.text: Everyone working the food line we're fast and hard working. Girl with the pineapple tattoo was a boss! She was amazing. Our waiter, short guy with glasses (Gary or Greg)... horrible waiter. Saw him twice.  Alex the runner was all over the place, (amazing) when I asked him to find our waiter he came back and said he couldn't and he would help us. There was also an argument in the kitchen, some short bartender (working outside) with blonde hair, with RBF, came in snapping at the girl with the pineapple tattoo, cussing and walked out saying "do your f-ing job". He was completely unprofessional and rude. Saw him at the bar after breakfast and he had even worse attitude with customers. If I return I will probably wait for another bartender to serve me. Also, our food came out at separate times. From 1st to 3rd plate was a 22minute difference, who wants to eat at different times? The food was pretty awesome though. It probably won't be my choice to return, but if I do, I'll be sure to be selective on who gets my business.

PgHsxfN_rQBV5JVZ9R1xTA.text: Very busy because I think it's the art walk for the first Friday of the month pretty atmosphere outside loved the bar with all the rebar that's outside. I did not go inside maybe next time.

4dmRkHDsdQiHdjAesYtOzA.text: Dude forgot my drink, not cool.  He asked me what I wanted to drink the first time. He got my drink and my friends drink order. He came back right away with my friends drink order and completely dismissed my drink. He then was standing around with nothing to do until someone flagged him down to order drinks but my friend had to grab his attention to get my drink. He then asked for my drink again and it was wrong he guessed it the second time.  During 2 hours of being here he has filled my water once. So upon bringing my forgotten beer my friend asked for more water he then said "uh yea I got you water once all three of you. " Well okay good for you it's been two hours I want another water.   The food is delicious so I will give them the three stars. I got the Mac and cheese and pretzel cheese dip with Alfredo sauce as an appetizer.

kmEsVGHuovX-zvVxIwzoMA.text: Took my staff here for some team building over drinks and appetizers. There were 9 of us and it was a hot July evening so was worried that we would not be able to find a plot in side, but being a Monday night we had no problem getting a couple tables together. Happy hour specials ran all night on Mondays and we tried one of every appetizer on the specials list and all were great. Especially enjoyed the meat and cheese board, hummus and rosemary Parmesan fries. The hummus came with lots of veggies, a plus versus versions that are only bread.  The atmosphere is very hip with use of rebar throughout and large a varied patio that will be great once fall temperatures hit.

oivfDCQgSx2-nJmUPDoJyg.text: Have only been able to try their late night menu. Love the Nachos! Seriously, why don't more restaurant use flour chips for nachos? It's sooo good. Favorite nachos by far! I also like their coconut chicken strips. It comes with a citrus ginger dip - tangy and delicious. I'd take this over ranch or BBQ sauce any day.  Will have to try their brunch one of these days. I will let you know how that goes..

photos.caption: Photo of Bliss Rebar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Nachos w Chicken - so freakin good!
Photo of Bliss Rebar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Coconut Chicken Strips

o8GMRAzx0-t0tmxquKNx0Q.text: I have been here twice now. The first time was on Christmas Eve. My family was visiting from Florida and we were trying to find somewhere open on Christmas Eve with decent food. I first suggested we go to Carly's around the corner (a regular spot for me).   I was excited to try somewhere new and I was pleasantly surprised! It was pretty empty but the staff was extremely friendly and accommodating. Our waiter was also the bar tender and he did not give the vibe that he wanted to get the hell out of there; which is a win in itself on x-mas eve!!.   The food was awesome. Fried Mac & Cheese Balls= Heaven. The menu is pretty small but everything on it seems to be good.

TUMFTAVZ2Hdg3dT7z6Nlew.text: Mimosas great. Brunch great. And staff is great. Great place!! Can't wait to try the drag brunch. Road here on  our bicycles. Really cool bar area. If you're looking for a centrally located good time for all go here.

photos.caption: Photo of Bliss Rebar - Phoenix, AZ, United States

-NK6LatEJdJquen3et9x6g.text: Love this place. Big patio. Great food and drinks. Fantastic place for groups after work. We've always had a good time. I haven't been in quit awhile so I hope things are just as good. Love the coconut chicken and mac and cheese balls. The tacos and burgers have always been on point. The staff works very hard. What else can I say but enjoy yourself if you end up going.

WfBCbXCJpV9_jzWTrE5R9A.text: Bliss is the perfect spot for lunch during the workweek to happy hour after work. Brunchin' on the weekend to sunday funday.

00RZdWPKbJ5KqMGm1YWLDA.text: Sssssooooooooopooo we came to Bliss for Karaoke like always, a gay restaurant/bar, with a group of 20 people, and they have no karaoke tonight... Bc of the Super Bowl.... 90% of the people who come here to karaoke do NOT watch sports, let alone a game that doesn't have our home team. While I'm here there has been several regulars who came in and left to spend their money at the 3rd less desirable Kobalt for Karaoke, And spending their money there. As a Front of the House Manager of another restaurant here in town I would say this was a bad move and huge loss of revenue especially since it's been half dead here today. This is second time I've come here and karaoke is off. I still love this place but please let's not cancel this ever again.

vBO8Li_zHGhhNa9pvOXaKA.text: 5 stars for fast friendly service from the female bartender who was also working the table tops by the bar. One star for the leftover vomit from last night smell emanating in the place.

cqFVzTPj9_DbnvRdVWCLCg.text: One of my favorite neighborhood hangouts, and I don't even live in the area anymore! I come here a lot for the great prices on drinks and the fabulous patio. During the weekdays, the bar is super quiet, really laid back and great for the AZ fall/winter weather. On the weekends or at night, its usually busy but not crazy and perfect for a couple drinks with friends. I have only had the chips and salsa but everyone I know loves the food here, I just haven't been for dinner yet.  Also, the service is fantastic! The bartenders know me by name (and it only took a couple visits) and they are all super friendly.  Best bar in downtown for a relaxing happy hour AND a friday night meetup with a group.

f0hLbweTrJU1ADpGscIe5A.text: Ok, back for an update, but it will be brief. Go to Bliss as soon as possible, sit on the patio in the gorgeous weather, & get the salt & vinegar fries they are amazing! That's all. You're welcome.

1m_6RsBB8adXG3OTe49mOQ.text: Was once a great place service and quality of food had gone down hill waited ten minutes before server even asked what I wanted or to get served. All new employees doesn't speak much to loyalty. Was so disappointed was once a regular but that will be no more. Do they feel with university Croud they can  let quality of service and food mean nothing. Very sad.....

iADHkhRitthHaeRvUfjjvg.text: We came here after a concert and needed food without a line asap in downtown. Enter Bliss ReBAR - the patio was empty, but looks like a nice area. We walked inside and the restaurant was somewhat small and there was one bartender/waiter. There were at least 20 people there but the bartender didn't acknowledge us for several minutes.   When we were ready to order, we motioned him over and we got the cheesy Mac balls and the Steakhouse Burger. The balls were good but the burger was not. It just had too much going on with it in terms of flavor! I had one bite and decided not to eat anymore. My fubby tried to eat it all because he was so hungry but only managed to eat half.

vRBruOcaqw4lFwEaeFRUOA.text: Drinks and food are good. Mac-n-cheese is absolutely amazing. Service consistently leaves much to be desired.

rCDLMeZuPd5sN0h8f11fiA.text: Love this place! I went twice this weekend. This is a great location to visit during first Fridays. They have a great happy hour menu and the drinks are fantastic. I had the cucumber cooler today it was very refreshing and not too sweet. Definitely try the nachos.

photos.caption: Photo of Bliss Rebar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cucumber cooler

RYro-ILSvTk5_TwDAenuvw.text: Great on atmosphere, good on food, just ok on drinks and specials.   The patio is so nice, I've been drawn here since it was the Nine 05, which went under just as I became of age. Kudos to Bliss for consistently keeping it groovy with good music that isn't too loud, and *almost* enough staff to prevent wait times from getting ridiculous.  They've got some nice happy hour specials I haven't taken advantage of yet, like $6 apps on Monday. That or weekend brunch is really all that appeals to me. If I'm out late on any other weeknight, their answer to the valley's numerous reverse happy hours are rather unexciting. As for the weekend nightlife, it's alright as well. Keep in mind it's unofficially a gay bar, which is legit, as my gaybros need places to drink that aren't as wild as Karamba or Charlie's. If you come here on a Friday night, it operates more like a lounge (with inefficient seating) than a restaurant, and everyone there will be prettier than you.   Overall, I don't think their drinks are anything to die for, and I usually just get wine. This is a solid chill spot where you should grab a small meal from time to time, but by no means THE place to kick it in 'til 2am.

UStCZZIW4GIaok9Hh6p0tg.text: Atmosphere amazing . Service marginal at best. Food deplorable, had the Chob it was like eating bland nothing, and the veggie burger was dry and got like zero ketchup for the fries THEY UPCHARGE FOR.  All in , not worth it. Go to a better food establishment then go to a fun bar somewhere else.

Eo2cUkD-Lf-1Ckx5fUQPqQ.text: Being from Colorado, this place gave me vibes of the cool, chic, downtown spots without feeling "uppity". The decor and atmosphere is gorgeous and the drinks and food are delicious. Love this place.

q-ij1cMMQbXT2pNs80bZUw.text: First time here. Enjoying myself and our out of town Company is also loving it here. Beautiful view outside sitting

photos.caption: Photo of Bliss Rebar - Phoenix, AZ, United States

8XRioIiAEyhaYkNobs5_4g.text: My food was okay, but not what I ordered. Wife liked her burger very much. The music was loud and the crowd wasn't my thing. Wasn't aware it was "alternative lifestyle" place. Made for uncomfortable dinner.

okOv2N97yfieMUGj5VYncw.text: First of all, do not come here if you are in a rush! We came here and they only had one person working. He was working the indoor bar as well as waiting tables indoors and outdoors so it took a long time to be seated and waited on. But I will say the waiter was awesome and so personable.  Second, it was amazing food. The bar area outside is beautiful and the food was worth the wait. The nachos are outstanding, the sandwiches and salads are also incredible.  Would definitely recommend the food. Just be prepared for slow service!

KxREZJAg3xeDuaa2UsCHUg.text: There's a Lindsey there. My boyfriend said hey and she said dont tell at me! Then another person im with asked her for a shot with training wheels and she yelled im not serving that! Really rude for no reason on two occasions. Wouldn't recommend her.

VmpMRDOkKvhaCBnM8y8OyA.text: Tuesdays - $20 wine bottle and cheese board. I get to be fancy and cheap at the same time. YEAH!! :D Best day ever!  Bliss ReBar has great food, atmosphere, music and the bartenders have always been nice and are always open to talk and just make you laugh.

photos.caption: Photo of Bliss Rebar - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Bliss Rebar - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Bliss Rebar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Wine tuesdays!

R-P1rPuOHK9N3e0A_gGi7Q.text: Went there recently on a Friday night and the place was busy.  Went to order drinks inside for myself and friends and was told by the bartender that we will be served in plastic cups. These cups were so small, almost half the size of the regular pint glasses they use.   Ok so I figured the cost would be a little less since it was obvious they were no where near the same size as the glass pints.  Nope.  Full price.  Plus the bartender that night  must've been new and inexperienced because he looked confused when trying to ring up people's credit cards, which took forever and he was really slow at making drinks. After that we just left.

q_Bp29N0UHqs9WyWcEu8QQ.text: Went yesterday for lunch. First Visit. The patio art aka Rebar is what caught my eye.  Went in On a Monday for lunch and it was dead. That's not a bad thing, we got right in and it's also Happy Hour all day.  Discounted drinks and apps.  The server (only person on staff)  was very welcoming and friendly.  Didn't get her name but she's of an ethnic background.  She recommended a couple things and we tried a couple. We had the pretzel bread with cheese (omg yummy),  we had the rolled tacos (good),  then we had the grillled cheese and the chicken tacos.  The chicken tacos were a little spicy but good and lots of meat!!  The restaurant was clean as well.  Great little intimate place and delicious food!  Will visit again.

kV8BkVv6_3FTk2GmmyjCUA.text: This is my favorite place to just chill and eat at night time downtown. Hands down the best nachos I've ever had.

zSPgk-1e2qZyYw7E_SepEQ.text: The only problem with Brunch is what to order. Everything is good making it a really hard decision. Everytime we go we think service can't get better but alway leave talking about how good the food was and the great service.

p4lNvBNWHB83yAWbXNmcbQ.text: Been there 4 times:  Their Southwest Salad taste worse than the southwest salad in McDonalds and much worse than any salad in Wildflower and Bread (Best). Their breakfast are just like Denny's except worse coffee. The omelet is a little better but worse than iHop. Burgers are ok. Nothing stands out. The location is good and they have Sunday shows. Drink is good. I love their Bloody Mary special on Sundays at $4. I love their waiters and services.  Don't go their for their food but for the environment and solely social. I don't understand why gays accept crappy food place like this.

Rys-unZy9eDf4VRhbiQL3Q.text: I am totally digging the Phoenix food scene! I'm so spoiled with Chicago cuisine, and have been completely and pleasantly surprised with Phoenix dining. My friend and I came here for brunch and really enjoyed ourselves. First if all, our server Erik was AWESOME AWESOME AWESOME! He made our experience exceptional. Erik was great at suggesting menu items and we loved everything.   We got chicken tacos with habanero pineapple salsa. Crazy good! Then we got Mac and cheese. Ok, anyone who knows me knows I'm a Mac and cheese snob. This stuff was A-mazing. It had broccoli, spinach, tomatoes and 3 cheeses.  The pepper jack gave it the perfect spicy kick. Then we split a southwest salad with avocado. Not sure what's in that dressing, but I'll tell you that You could probably put it on anything horrible and it would turn tasty!  Sitting outside in sunny, 79 degree weather in January when you're from Chicago? Priceless!!

7y-20f0avtJg-mM92-LOYA.text: This place is located on the NE corner of 4th St and Garfield. Outside seating as well as inside seating. The food looks beautiful on the plate. It also taste great.  The area is in the Garfield area. Some might think it's unsafe but actually it is safe and clean. We had a nice lunch. I had the Churchill Club, my wife had Southwest Salad we love it.  Enjoy Anthony

photos.caption: Photo of Bliss Rebar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Shirley my wife&#39;s salad
Photo of Bliss Rebar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Man this Church Hill Club is awesome. The food plated well

bCOY6bFPH2QY39a9krqyyw.text: Great drinks, prime location, and fantastic patio area. The bartenders are always incredibly friendly, and the drinks are usually pretty strong. I've tried the "Group Therapy," and it lives up to it's name--you need AT LEAST one other person for the drink.   Not a place for dancing, but a great bar to hand out with a group of people.

CxD4RgCfLcdbUOqd_2Afiw.text: Fabulous service and delicious food in a pleasant,  artsy  atmosphere. I had the  sliders.  They were served on buttery pretzel buns.  The salad was delicious,  with a light dressing and lot's of fresh leafy greens.  Excellent service, too.

rnhQ8a8pD7lZDDiA4U9lbQ.text: I have been there several times.  The service and experience is average.  It is a good thing they have a big patio.

L3oUASH52bQhVJgccttR7w.text: Nice place, Brett and Nick are cool dudes. The food and atmosphere is great, and the location is walking distance from my apt. which makes it super convenient. I haven't checked out brunch yet but look forward to it. Only one thing I didn't like. Going there by yourself can be hit or miss, I found some of the people to be a bit "judgey", and not very friendly to new people. But then there are many cool ones who make it a great time.

zA6GAqO4GjqhZqAaFSb0Gw.text: I LOVE this place! the decor/atmosphere is great, patio is amazing in nice weather and the food is delish. We had the nachos and Garfield Grilled Cheese with bacon and apple. The food is fresh, great portions. But the best thing about this place is the staff..every time I've been they are personable, checking in often to see if we need anything. Today there was a homeless woman that was outside in 115 degrees in distress from the heat. The male bartender brought her inside and sat her down, gave her water and cool towels and asked her if he could do anything else and then called the ambulance for her when it was clear she was in heat distress. He treated her with the utmost of respect and attentiveness just like a paying customer. Bravo for doing it right!

wgLt8VhsgH-hAES7xFsfxg.text: I'll probably be stoned to death and lose my pink card for this review, but I've given Bliss a chance three times and was sorely disappointed all three. From inconsistent service, to snooze-inducing food choices, I just can't go into the rapturous food orgasms that many of my locals seem to have when eating here.  I haven't done the reBAR side of the combo, so all I can speak of is the restaurant. I like the space, and sure the staff is cute (in a sort of frat-boy/porn star way), but I need good food with my eye candy.  Things I have tried: 1) the chicken soft tacos -- no flavor and HEAVY on the purple cabbage. 2) loaded mac n cheese -- I prefer the mac n cheese at Switch, hands down. 3) buffalo chicken sandwich -- decent taste, but a total mess to eat.

Z-8nrZ8wNa2KGMGWSPoG9g.text: food was good but service was so bad... i ordered the chicken sandwich during first friday art walk.. it took forever for server tho take our order and for for to arrive.  When i received my sandwich I noticed that it came with green salad on the side on plate (how served salad next to a sandwich on a plate?) i told the server that i thought that sandwich came with fresh fries and she said that french fries will be additional charge.  At that point I was too annoyed to order fries and wait again for them to arrive.. not going back.. If you are dying from hunger, go here, if you have any other options, skip this place...Should've gone to Strand for fab Italian food insured... smh

uwliM09bq5c98Oq9fVG-XA.text: Met a few friends here for happy hour.  They had $5 martinis, but that's not what I ended up getting.  They have a drink special everyday.  That day they had the Walter Crankite, I think!  It was like an appletini with cranberry juice.  We didn't order anything else.  The service was great.  Our servere was very attentive.

Rrq-9wA7LUeCctvqoEG7CQ.text: Very good food and service was great. Everyone was very friendly. Meaty Mac n cheese was awesome. Tacos great and apps pretzel bread and coconut chicken great too!!

_xxWLlPwQs7YXVbZukrFLA.text: This is my third review. It has been close to two years since my last review, but I have been here 4-5 times since then. Since my last review the food has been consistently good, but the service consistently mediocre. After my last trip back in October, I would never come back. I was visiting with a friend on a weeknight. We had come for drinks and stayed close to two hours. About 45 min before closing, we stopped ordering from our server because he was so slow, instead opting to go to the inside bar to get drinks. The majority of the time we were there, we sat at one of the tables on the side patio, but towards the end, we were standing next to the same table and chairs. While we were talking, the owner (well, I am 97% sure he was the owner) walked by and without a word took my friends chair and walked off. I said to my friend, "Did he just take your chair?" The owner replied "Yes, we're closing." I apologized and said I didn't realize it was that late, are you closing right now? He responded that they closed in 30 minutes and walked off. It was the absolute rudest I've been treated before. Sorry, there are too many other really good restaurants with great service and all within a short distance for me to have to put up with his bougie attitude.

8BFfKUHUYCyr-N57kTdy2g.text: Great drink menu and awesome cheeses.  Had a great dinner/late night snack with my wife.  Bartender was extremely helpful, great place.  Not into the general bar scene and since it was an off night I cannot measure how it would be.  Can tell you that it is worth the stop and there is something for everyone on the menu.  We sat outside and the ambience was great, not too much traffic.  We would definitely go back!

782cX2UjRejpNJ7yJGu9yg.text: Love this place. Indoor or outdoor seating. The food is wonderful. Have not had a bad meal there. My favorite is their black bean burger and side salad. So yummy. Their sliders are also delicious. They have nice wines and are generous with the pours.

k_V9kEP6dHWZNgpD0cD3IQ.text: Not good. 30+minutes for sliders and the bartender asks if I want another drink and the. Ignores me. Stay away!!

XosL06LlHQzAXnIHPpJP7g.text: We've eaten here twice.  Both on weekend, one for breakfast, one for lunch.  Setting is great.  Nice atmosphere.    Service is fair.  Friendly, but not overly attentive.  Food is just okay.    Here is the GREAT thing about them for breakfast/lunch.  The $10 mimosa special is an entire bottle of champagne with a large caraffe of orange juice.  Enough to get 3-4 people tipsy over breakfast.  $4 bloody mary was decent.  Mac & Cheese is tasty but nothing gourmet about it.   Chicken sandwhich with bacon was just okay.  Pretzel bun best part.  Eggs are okay on the breakfast platter as well.  Fries with grated parmesan cheese and red sauce dip is okay, but nothing special.  After two times, with all of the fantastic places to eat downtown, I probably won't be back.  Seems like it's a better place to go to visit the bar than the restaurant.  When busy, with outdoor, it would be a terrific venue.

6Z1X278hbMLEWKEzCn-z_Q.text: If "Cheers" were real it would be Bliss/Rebar.  There is no such thing as a "stranger" while you're there.  The waitstaff is friendly and your glass never goes empty.  If you become a "regular" they remember what you like.  As for the food, not typical bar food, but you can get a GREAT meal.  The pasta dinner is really good, so are the Thai Shrimp.  Everyone there has a good time and this will quickly be your "go to" place to go any day of the week.

8TrMLaDrt6iVu9AGpKzoJw.text: The Roosevelt was closed in June during First Friday so we looked on Yelp for another bar we could go to close by and found Bliss ReBar. Too bad I forgot my ID in another purse so we couldn't go. Fast forward two months later, tried to go to The Roosevelt, still closed (anyone know what's going on there?). We remembered this place from last time and went here.   There were 5 of us and we were promptly seated inside. We were looking to get a few drinks but most of us hadn't eaten yet so this was going to serve as dinner too. Our server was very personable and accommodating. I split the grilled cheese with my boyfriend and it was delicious! The pear was a great touch (we got it w/o the bacon) and very different from any other grilled cheese I have had. We also got the September special bruschetta which came on their pretzel bread (amazing). There were 3 kinds: an olive based one, a mozzarella with pesto sauce (I think they forgot the tomato on it since our friend ordered it and got a slice), and a cucumber-chipotle based one. I had the first 2 and really liked them. Everyone else's food looked delicious and they were all happy with their orders. The price wasn't bad either for food and a few beers. I would definitely come back here again.   The other side was pretty poppin' by the time we left around 9pm and looked more like a bar scene. Maybe we'll have to try that side out next time we're in the area.

sXs6CheudjJjAe3hGjm7iQ.text: SUNDAY FUNDAY! Breakfast nachos are the bomb! I love the mimosa price. We also split a burger and it was very good, but oh my breakfast nachos how I dream about you.

ldDNHxYtChmed8--PmMtLg.text: We love this place!  Great food and a fantastic team.    The meatloaf dinner and sandwich are great, and try the pot roast!    The best patio in downtown Phoenix.  If you haven't been here, definitely give it a try!

XKrdTMDHftMtGTUL8AguEg.text: Went for happy hour and had appetizers only. Great food, pretzel bread was delicious and the drinks were better. No complaints and I will be coming back.

naxeZssROw3pu-EIe6hKaw.text: GET THE NACHOS. They will change your life. I'm telling you. Trust me.  I have been with the bf a couple of times to start our Roosevelt Row area bar hopping evenings of fun. The inside is small but cozy and there is a nice spacious patio area.   They have good beer on tap, like most Roosevelt Row bars. Definitely would like to go back to try the cocktails- they look pretty fun.   But all you really need to get is the nachos with braised beef. Homemade chips- and you can tell. Somehow the cheese sauce is amazing- I suspect it is made fresh. Top it off with some cabbage and tomatoes. So simple, yet so glorious. Me and the bf both love them so much we have seriously considered getting two orders of the nachos. Or coming back at the end of one of our nights- though after a drink or 5 we have yet to do that.   Someday perhaps I'll try something else on the menu besides beer and nachos (the better quality version of the ballpark classic). someday....

2HyEGO_wIwDNhXpo2Hb4tw.text: Visited Bliss/reBAR for the 1st time tonight via Buzzcation. Excellent place. Very nice atmosphere. The bar is next to the restaurant. Food was nice, if just a little pricey. Tried the loaded mac-n-cheese...it had chicken and bacon in it. Can't go wrong with bacon. Also tried the pretzel bread...it came with three different sauces. All were good, but the cheese one was excellent.  All in all, nice place to go and hang out with friends....and the company just made it even better.

BZcsTndM1Mi0NxcjBjXvOQ.text: Thought from the looks of it, it'd be a fun place. Not really. Atmosphere is nice by sight, but nothing else much to it. Servers don't seem to care much. It's more of a gay-friendly hang out. So, if you're wanting to take a heteor-date there, I'd opt for a dif place. The food was mediocre. Won't try it again. Left a bad taste in my mouth.

WhjRU0bebVoJdcwrAZ78pQ.text: Food was decent overall. One member of our group ordered eggs poached medium. The eggs came poached but very runny. When she asked for them to be cooked a little longer, the server obliged. After about 10 mins the server returned and relayed the cook said you "can't" cook poached eggs to medium. At least 15 minutes later, the server returned with 2 fried eggs and said "I don't think these are even poached." My friend was starving so she ate them anyways. The server comped the meal...she seemed to be discouraged with her limited ability to meet her customers request due to the kitchen.

Yf18-RqLZaTfOYQBHGnbRA.text: Small, simple and accommodating menu.    Excellent service, ambiance and portions = phenomenal value.  I highly recommend the house cheeseburger with "fondue" style cheese sauce, and side of fries.   Perfect date nite with the BF.  We'll be back again soon.

SfYeX9sEzfAkPTTX4rk-qw.text: First off... very creative use of recycled ReBAR. Awesome to see businesses revamping downtown. Phoenix really needs some night life.  But the real reason for me being a fan... MACARONI & CHEESE. I know, I know, but really, it was that freaking amazing. I had the Naked Mac and Cheese. Naked because it didn't have the bacon and chicken in it. Honestly I don't know if I even want to try the bacon and chicken because the Naked was so divine. I'm not kidding. If you ever make it down to Phoenix and need a cool hang out and late night munchies, hit this joint and order the Mac & Cheese. You'll thank me. If you don't like it then your next lunch is on me.  I also got a little run down from the owner, nice guy, about the foods all being hand made and healthier ingredients. It's always a plus to have good people and a happy owner to greet you.  The only negative, just because I was shocked when I experienced it, was the bathroom. It's got a combined male/female sink area when you first walk in. And I thought I was walking into the ladies room when I opened the door to see a woman washing her hands. ...uhhh... did I just... uhhh... Funny now, but scary when it happened.

bj7i7KpUFFvG28g-HTOo7w.text: I had a Groupon I needed to use, so last Friday my hubby picked me up from work & we went to lunch here. It was a gorgeous day out with a nice breeze so we sat on the patio. Terra was our server & she was so cool & friendly.  For starters we ordered the chips & dip and the grilled pretzel bread. The chips & dip were pretty good, loved the green onion dip but the chips could have been a bit more crispy. The pretzel bread was just ok, a few of the pieces were pretty burnt & the tomato jam dipping sauce was the best of the 3 sauces. I also ordered the strawberries & champagne cocktail, it was nice & strong.  For our entrees; my hubby ordered the grilled chicken sandwich & I ordered the bliss burger loaded, both meals came with a side salad. My hubby liked his sandwich but they put way too much honey mustard on it. My burger was pretty good but I should have just got the regular, the cheese sauce & bacon was a bit too much. The pretzel bread on both sandwiches was so yummy though. The salads were ok, didn't care for the dressing. I decided to order some parmesan fries to share & since I had a Groupon, I also got the bacon mac & cheese to go. The fries were ok, I liked that they were shoestring but they were bland in flavor. I had the mac & cheese for dinner that night & it was pretty good, a lil too oily though & I wish there was more cheese.  Total for everything was $50.67, but with my Groupon it was only $20.67. The atmosphere is great & I would definitely come back to have a drink on the patio, but the food was pretty average so not sure I'd come back for that.

RNpRW_Ra-b2QcP7R8vNpzw.text: This place is amazing! The happy hour/weekend specials are such a bargain. The food is outstanding!!! From the breakfast nachos  and mimosas to the wine and cheese plate, this place has it all! One of my favorite places to go!

_o9g6YYd7UyVvsGppbmeRw.text: I used a groupon for lunch at this place which was a smoking deal. And I really wanted to like it. I really did. But unfortunately the food was just not good. I ordered the buffalo chicken wrap. The tortilla was very dry which made the whole thing fall apart. I had to cut it up and eat it with a fork. And if it wasn't for a few drops of buffalo sauce that I saw but couldn't taste, I probably would have sent it back thinking it wasn't what I ordered. It didn't taste like it had any sauce what-so-ever in it. I would've guessed it was a grilled chicken wrap with no sauce. And the little "salad" that came on the side was more like some leaves of lettuce with a drop of oil on them. There was no flavor at all!  This place does deserve some credit for the atmosphere. The place is super cute and the service was good. All of the staff was very friendly and I really liked the feel of the place. Which made it even more upsetting the food didn't match the ambiance. But I will give this place another try. Maybe in the evening because it looks like it might be a cool place to chill and have a drink!

me-vHbfTnGEhgYx5oCUGZQ.text: good atmosphere.  food is good, not great. (i still miss fate's delicious asian menu *sniff*)  happy hour drink specials are good and the indoor/outdoor seating is perfect to take advantage of our beautiful autumn weather.  the outdoor bar still makes a fun stop during first friday festivities!

RCuqVfIOXVjL5mqjYWI9NA.text: Bliss/reBAR nearly overcomes its terrible location but the food just isn't quite up to par.  The coconut chicken tenders were flavorless and disappointing but the chicken itself was great. The grilled cheese was pretty damn good but I did expect more out of it. The mac 'n cheese is the real winner for sure. Don't even ask how much fat is in this, it's way too much but the flavor is absolutely wonderful.  Our server was friendly and prompt never allowing our drinks to run dry.  We sat outside as the weather was beautiful and I highly recommend this. Inside is small, cramped and noisy.  Do go here if you love bacon  Don't go here if you're homophobic

CbznNLNwJ2VJpbMbEVuPIg.text: This is a fun place to have a drink. The bartenders are nice and they have a good selection of beer. Is location is great.  There are a lot of places to walk around nearby.

pZI2rgMUS2Ga-tFU72y12A.text: Really digging this place. With huge pito and small seating inside this is the ideal spot to hang out. There severs was awesome and fast. Guys check this place out. i came around noon and will be back asap.

_H6oznNROJ4fssB3ReDg1A.text: Excellent patio for weekend day drinking! Servers are super friendly and food is great. Breakfast Bites - deep fried egg, macaroni, cheese, and bacon - are a great cure for hangovers!

_sPBJ4lqEhw3tbr9qEp3gA.text: Great bar. Great location in downtown, and excellent outdoor/indoor bars. They play good tunes and everyone there is having a good time. Highly recommended.

16yYguPxgW5knlwMEWMXUA.text: This is second time here. I got hooked by the grilled cheese and apple sandwich. Then today they hit me with the bacon wrapped meatloaf. Give me a break already.  Great staff and great food. Monique rocked the bar and made the evening fun.

GWlAwwAVPc-tRK_EapZWuA.text: Great food, service and ambiance. Reasonably priced, reasonably expensive, but worth it.

6cLQqqDJ3HgdzzZ86PlXow.text: This is a nice spot with good food. Swanky and comfortable patio area. Varied menu and the prices aren't bad.

-uuMRA9z_dudKfWeK497Ig.text: Can I tell you how much I despised Fate with all its pretentious, snooty bullshit? I should have known the second I realized that Bliss/reBar was in the same building that it was probably tainted from all the leftover evil.  And so it is. We showed up and the restaurant was practically empty. There is no hostess or even a hint of one. We stood there for many minutes on end before even being acknowledged by one of the many servers who were rushing around (perhaps serving to invisible people? The place was dead.). We were told there was a 15 minute wait, or we could eat on the patio. Um, it's 40 degrees...  AND THE PLACE WAS DEAD. I guess we'll wait. We go back outside because there is zero point zero extra room to stand. The server comes back out and says they have two large parties coming in an hour, but we can sit inside now if we can be done in 45 minutes. That's sure inviting, isn't it.  So we hustle on inside and make some hasty selections. $9 faux comfort food shit like gourmet mac and cheese just offends me, so I go with the veggie sandwich. That sounds innocuous enough, right? The food came out straightaway - too fast for a burger to be cooked medium well, like my companion ordered. Sure as shit, she cut into it, and it was bleeding and mooing all over the place. My "veggie" sandwich arrives and it looks like a Filet-o-Fish from hell, some huge block of something unidentifiable due to extreme deep-frying. I couldn't help it - I asked the server what the hell it was.   Eggplant.  Ohhhhkay then.   It was like trying to eat a deep fried brick between two pillows. Impossible. The pretzel bread, while yummy, is totally unyielding. Only Jenna Jameson can fit that thing into her mouth. My companion was suffering a similar fate with her bleeding burger. There was mayonnaise and shredded cabbage and boiling hot eggplant juice going everywhere and it was goddamn ridiculous. Neither of us got through even a half of our sandwiches. I wolfed down the side salad just to get something remotely healthy in there after the onslaught of grease, although I almost choked on the buckets of sugar syrup they call salad dressing.  So, while we are attempting to recover from this mess, the server goes MIA. You'd think if they were trying to hustle us out of there, we'd get a damn check. Nope. No. Nada. Had to chase someone down and ask for it. When it finally came, there wasn't even an itemized receipt, so even though the total seemed a little low I couldn't check it out. I was so over the whole experience at the point I didn't even care. I left a shitty tip and we escaped to the bar next door, where the cute bartenders gave us some free drinks and we sucked down innumerable $3 vodka specials for the next four hours.   Just UGH in every way.

5zX0Ibtj--B98QA5ZNMaOA.text: Love coming here for great drinks and always amazing Mac and cheese! If your downtown don't miss out on this place!!

HhPGzxtdMSfUe0eze5D0Tw.text: Went with a large group and they were extremely accommodating. We ordered a bunch of the appetizers that were all very big  - my personal favorite was the hummus platter and Mac and cheese balls!! I got the grilled cheese less the bacon plus avocado and it was ok. Wouldn't get it again. Shared a bottle of wine for about $30 and everything was 20 % off which was awesome... Not sure why though. Salad dressing is amazing I would get that again. Our server was extremely friendly and helpful!!
